title: Delle Nazioni Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Nice quiet hotel near train station with breakfast included.
review: Stayed here for 5 days in October. Close to the station (less than a minute walk) and easily accessible to the hearty of Florence. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay with a good selection of breakfast items in the morning. Staff Members were friendly and rooms were kept clean everyday. They also provide information about tours in reception.

title: Average, just average
review: Dear Daniela,  Can’t tell you how happy we are that you found Delle Nazioni Hotel to your liking.   It is always so encouraging and gratifying to receive such feedback.   Grazie Mille for having stayed with us, it was a true pleasure having you.   We do hope to have you back soon, ARRIVEDERCI and thank you again!  Elisabetta

title: Fantastic location
review: We stayed here in October for several days.  It's a very short walk from the train station.  So there's no need to drag your luggage around the streets. The front desk staff were great. The room was quiet and clean with private bath. Breakfast is included and offers many options. You are within walking distance to all major sites in Florence.

title: Worst experience in Italy
review: The rooms aren’t well maintained and look run down. The tv is so small there’s almost no point of having one. The cleaners always gave me the wrong number of towels. Apart from that, people are generally welcoming, breakfast is ok.

title: Excellent Service
review: the hotel was fantastic as was the staff and service, the location was fantastic as its walking distance the to main attractions. very close from the main train station. the staff was very helpful in helping us organise tours.

title: Practical and functional, excellent price and localization
review: Dear Guest,  Just a quick note to thank you for your kind words.   It is always a pleasure to receive such great feedback, it really works wonders on all of us.   We are so happy that we have been part of your Flor-entine stay and hope to have you and your family back  in the near future so, ARRIVEDERCI!  Elisabetta

title: Nice Hotel next to Florence Santa Maria Novella Train Station
review: Our experience was a great one! Aside from its great rooms, good food, and practical location which is very close to the Florence Santa Maria Novella main train station, I'd like to mention the excellent service the concierge has done for us!  I stayed in this hotel for 3 days and 2 nights and I just remembered that I left behind a couple of things. I emailed them about this and was glad to hear back immediately. They were able to find the two things I left and they kept it as is.  Since they kept my things sorted even after 2 days from my check out, I mentioned to reward them but they declined. I was also able to arrange a courier service to have it picked up from them and delivered to me.  It was a very delightful experience. Hands down to the team for their great service.…

title: Great Hotel - Recommended
review: Dear Sean,  Thank you for choosing Delle Nazioni Hotel !   It's a pleasure to see that you enjoyed your stay and found our facilities and amenities useful for your needs.   We are very proud of the high standards of service that we provide, and it's very special to receive first hand positive feedback from valued guests such as you.   We appreciated your visit, and hope to welcome you back to the Delle Nazioni Hotel in the not too distant future,  Kind regards,  Elisabetta

title: Convenient location especially for the trains.
review: I shall begin with a postive, the location. The hotel is situated opposite the train station and within walking distance of all the sights to see in Florence. We retired late in the evening to a spacious nicely decorated room, clean bathroom but only a view of the fire escape. Much to my horror early next morning I found a bedbug, then another. We pulled away the bedding and mattress to discover many more. Now, as a seasoned traveller I am more than aware this problem is becoming more common but in my view hotels should prepare for this issue and  act upon it, carrying out regular thorough inspections of their accommodation. In this instance the hotel had failed. Worse still was the response upon reporting it to reception staff. No apology, even questioning my certainty! I had…

title: Par excellence!
review: Good morning AlisonG707, Thanking you for the time spending of writing and sharing your feedback regarding your stay at Delle Nazioni Hotel. We regret for your problem and we understand your discomfort but as we have already explained, the bugs also have an incubation of 10 days. We changed the room with the risk of spreading the problem even through the luggage. The housekeeper did the control  and there was NOTHING, moreover as a precaution we also called the firm specialized to do a second check with a NEGATIVE result. It is not correct to write a review like yours, on a hotel without having confirmations, your panic could damage a structure where working people who give their all to make the customer feel at home. Hoping to have you back again in our hotel, Best regards Giovanni Mariella Hotel Manager

title: Old Hotel close to tourist area
review: Great position as we arrived by train and it was a short walk and near to all sites. Room was for 3 people so was plenty big enough for 2. Breakfast was OK nothing to shout about but the juice was awful as it was so strong it would strip the enamel from one's teeth the coffee was from a machine and was again not brilliant. But overall for position and price and its location it is a good choice.

title: Pefect hotel for city trip
review: The hotel was literally 5 mins away from the train station, 10 mins from the Duomo, 15 mins from the Accademia and Uffizi. Extremely accessible laundry mat and grocery store. The lobby and rooms are clean (especially the bathroom.) The staff is so kind and helpful with a sense of humour. For the price we paid, this exceeds our expectation! I recommend this to anyone wanting to experience all of Florence.

title: Helpful staff, great location
review: The first night they provided us with no bath towels and not enough towels for everyone in the room. The breakfast was below average. The shower was nice. Overall the experience was average. The air condition in the room was adequate.

title: Simple and clean
review: Dear Christina,   Thank you for your nice review.   We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay here at the Delle Nazioni Hotel.   Your feedback is very valuable to us and we have shared your feedback with the rest of the team.  We look forward to welcome you back to our Hotel in the near future,  Grazie & Arrivederci, Elisabetta

title: JUST OK
review: The hotel is located next to Santa Maria Novella station..so you have your location perfect.  The staff is very friendly and helpful. They speak fluent English, making it easy to converse. That may not be the case in rest of Florence - but Italians are helpful in general. The breakfast was repetitive but very good. I thought the rice was interesting since one is not used to rice for breakfast.  The room was alright. Did not have a fridge. I was told I could not get an iron in the room - not pleasant since I wanted to iron my shirts to my meetings. I had to get the laundry service - which was closed on Sunday.  The bed was very comfortable, so I slept well. The bathroom was clean. The room was cleaned well every day. The room had a small balcony, so I enjoyed my evenings. The TV…

title: Comfortable hotel near the heart of Florence.
review: Dear Aaditya,  Thank you for your beautiful feedback!  You have given us the greatest motivational tool any business owner could wish for!   The proof that our extra efforts do make a difference.   On behalf of all the staff at Delle Nazioni Hotel, who provided you with the great service all our customers have grown to expect from us,   GRAZIE for having stayed with us.  Kindest regards and ARRIVEDERCI!  Elisabetta

title: Across road from main rail station
review: The hotel is directly opposite the main railway station and just around the corner from the bus station. It is ideally situated for walking into Florence, about ten minutes. The hotel staff were very friendly and the rooms and bathroom very clean. If you have a room facing the station, then you might find the trams a little noisy at night. The breakfast was ok but a bit samey each day. We only stayed four nights so it was fine for us although I would hope the breakfast would improve if I were to stay longer ! All in all good value for the money.

title: Trip to Florence.
review: Easy to get to, stayed in superior room, comfy bed, shower over bath, but on long flexible hose as riser rail is at end wall and due to installation of bath you have to stand a couple of feet away just at the edge of shower screen, poor design. Food at breakfast is basic, electric griddle for toast. No tea/coffee or fridge in room, as 3 star. Towels, toiletries and hairdryer provided. Staff helpful.

title: Good Hotel Great Location
review: A great location, close to the train station. Easy walking distance to just about everywhere. Unlikely to get a view from your window. Clean hotel, clean rooms. Good breakfast. We would stay at this hotel again.

title: Good location
review: Dear Sheridon,  Your nice review and fine words are the best reward, we know we have a great location, but what makes special stay at the Delle Nazioni Hotel is definitely the attention to detail in wanting to build an experience tailor-made for our Guests.  Hoping to meet you again extend our warmest regards,  Grazie & Arrivederci  Elisabetta

title: Don’t stay here
review: I stayed there for 2 nights in April, the room was very clean, beds are comfy and bathroom is clean with plenty of towels. The hotel is situated 150 meters from the entrance to the Firenze SMN railway station and about a 15 min walk to the Piazza del Duomo. The room had a small terrace with a table and a couple of chairs overlooking the train station and you can see the Duomo and the bell tower from it.  Breakfast was OK. It had assorted pastries, scrambled eggs, cheese. butter and jam. The coffee machine in the breakfast room worked well.  The only problem was the lack of AC in the room as they only turn it on in summer. It is nearly impossible to sleep with the windows open as the noise from the tram and the trains is quite loud.

title: ideally situated
review: I along with my 13 year old daughter nearly got killed because this Hotel has NO security and it’s right across the street from the main train station where there are hungry and aggressive African migrants one of whom snuck into this hotel and emerged from the shadows it was sheer luck that my daughter and I weren’t killed or robbed I left immediately

title: Outdated but clean
review: Dear Mrs. Julia,  We were appalled by your review and it is so difficult to answer.   Our hotel is full of cameras from the entrance to all floors, further your phone call in full panic at the reception (for having wronged digit the internal number calling for more than an hour and stating that the front desk does not answer calls) we checked the video recordings and we did not see any attack to you.  We also sent one of the porters to check and he reported that there were some black customers on your floor, as we have an international clientele.  From your reviews shared on Tripadvisor also on other hotels or even houses of culture we cannot understand how a person who lives in a metropolis like New York is not able to move carefully in small cities!  We suggest you to take advantage of trips organized in groups with a tour leader to rely on.  Thanks and best regards,  Elisabetta

title: Worth considering for a short stay
review: tram ride T2 from aeroporto to main station , opposite the hotel.  Currently one euro fifty cents for each person fare singles on tram : breakfast rice and peas, scrambled eggs , cheeses , hams , steak bits with peppers , yoghurts , fruit salad , flakes, muesli , toast . fruit, cakes  , pastries , fruit juice coffees and teas ; we had balcony room fifth floor .overlooked main station and mountain scvenery and Doumo roof tops ., hotel next door to indian supermarket , ideal for water /beer .reception very helpful , to get to michealangelo park ( opposite side of river get bus number 13 ) rear of station bus stop tickets for ninety minutes from paper shop , turn right of hotel door .  opposite station .... bar in hotel , no tea / coffee maker in room :  air condition on in summer…

title: Not a bad place
review: From the train station in Florence, it's a 6 minute walk to the Hotel Delle Nazioni, a clean, well appointed accommodation for couples and families visiting Firenze. Wifi is accessible, coffee available and it's ideal to eat breakfast in the morning. The rooms are serviced daily. Our small balcony had a beautiful view of the Tuscan hills. Check in and check out times are good. Television size is very small but that did not concern us. Highly recommended.

title: Ok hotel
review: Location was in a sketchy neighborhood.  Directly across from the train station, so that was nice, but the whole area around the train station is pretty bad.  Room was warm/hot our whole stay.  Left windows open, room was still too warm.  Bed was a slab of granite.  Overall the hotel was clean.  Free American breakfast.  Had to walk long distances to see everything but the train station.  Next time, I'll get closer to the river.  Much nicer area up there.

title: nice location
review: Hotel Delle  Nazioni  We had weekend at this hotel, it’s good location, about a 10 minute walk into centre of Florence. Train station is across the road and tram station which could be a bit noisy at night, but with windows shut didn’t really affect us.  A three star hotel was ok for the money, bedroom was spacious but could have done with a dressing table for clothes it had the room. No tea or coffee making facilities which was a disappointment.  Breakfast was included in price, it was ok could have done with better quality ingredients.  Overall good hotel for money

title: Nice location but dated rooms.
review: the hotel was very close to the train station and all the attractions were in walking distance. But there was an older man at the reception who was asking additional money for everything but then I met Fabio and he was wonderful and restored my faith in the hotel.

title: Mixed....
review: I do not understand why European hotel rooms (that are within reason) do not invest in good bedding. These beds were large but so rigid with huge firm pillows. Otherwise-location is awesome, room is large, shower is hot, breakfast is great, service staff is nice.   It isn’t the Four Seasons, but it’s worth the money if you don’t have back problems. In hindsight I might’ve stayed elsewhere (if I could find it) due to my own back problems. But, again, I will say... Europe just does not really care about comfortable bedding.

title: Average All-rounder
review: My wife and I stayed here mid March as part of a Gate 1 tour. I will start off by saying the location in relation to the train station is excellent. If you are arriving by train, you are literally a hundred yards away from the hotel with an adjacent full grocery store. Very convenient. It is in reasonably close proximity to all the major attractions including the Duomo. The ponte vecchio bridge is a little bit of a hike. As for the actual hotel, it was clean but be mindful that European showers are small, very small. Our room had a shower that measured 2 ft by 2 ft. Might be an issue for some. The biggest downside to this hotel is that it's across the street from a major metropolitan hub with constant noise of trains. If you are a light sleeper, this probably is not for you.…

title: Great hotel, great location
review: We stayed 4 nights in a family triple room this was probably too long; one or two nights as a base would have been enough as we could not sleep due to the constant noise.  We were on the quiet inner side so didn't have street noise, but we had constant scraping of furniture above.  Early in the morning (6 am) the neighbour showered and we all awoke thinking someone was in our shower.  This happened throughout the night.  By the 4th night we were like zombies.  Despite earplugs the walls are so thin it was like an audio massacre.  On 2 mornings the guests opposite had their doors open from 6 am and were talking to each other across the rooms.  There was no storage at all in the bathroom, neither shelves nor hooks to hang wet towels.  Only 1 bed had a bedside table, we had to…

title: Good hotel
review: This hotel was perfect for our group of 3 adults on our first visit to Florence. Just across the road from the railway station so not far to walk with our cases. Very helpful on reception, gave us maps, info, and helped with our online check-in when we left. Lovely clean room, small safe in the bedroom, clean bathroom. Good choice at breakfast, lots of bread, pastries, cakes, yoghurts, fruit, cheese, ham and a couple of hot choices too, set us up well for the day. Short walk to all the main sights, shops, and restaurants. No tea or coffee in the room but this was available in the bar area. I’d recommend this hotel as a great base to explore the city.

title: Terrible experience
review: Good hotel in front of the train station, so very convenient. It was a nice hotel, the hotel employees where friendly and helpful. Our room was not very nice. We had no view. Breakfast was good and had variety of food.

title: Good location
review: Unfortunately my husband and I did not have a good experience at this hotel. Let’s start with the positive. One star alone goes to the hotel’s incredible location. They are a block and half away from the train station and a 5 min walk away from some of the major historic sites. I never once had to access public transportation during my stay. That was great. The second star goes to housekeeping. The lady did a great job and was always friendly, accommodating and efficient in her work. Now let’s talk about what went wrong. Although the room itself was very spacious, it was bare. No tea maker or mini fridge. The beds had a thin foam mattress that was incredibly uncomfortable and left me with a soared back for two days. After having a terrible sleep the night before when I went to…

title: Fábio and Marco
review: This hotel is right by the train station, very convenient. However for a hotel that calls itself the “internet hotel” (its claim on their front doors) it has the worst WiFi out of all the hotels we stayed at in Italy! Breakfast buffet was decent, rooms are clean and ours had a good view. We arrived at 12:30, check in was at 2pm. They did not let us check in one min early, but did have a room to lock our suitcases in if we wanted to leave and come back.

title: proximity to train station
review: Our stay could have been a disaster as we miscalculated our dates and arrived a day early but once we found the problem Marco and Fábio were quick to fix it and got us to our rooms at no added cost and without hassle. Both saved out holiday and saved our wallets without charging us an extra night. Big thanks to the boys and enjoy the wine.

title: Good hotel
review: 14 people turn up pre booked, all our group were split up reception attitude awful, told many of the party we were upgraded with balcony. All rooms dirty ,tired and we all felt ripped off.  One particular couple complained and was told you have a balcony with a city view. It actually was on the top floor overlooking railway lines and rooftops ,the balcony iron work was rusty.  Another couple complained as the balcony door didn't close not good for security as the balconies are all connected by a very low rusty iron rail,so easy access to other balconies.  Two bulbs were out, the bathroom needed a total refurb, and the roof leaked all night dripping rain entered the room . This complaint resulted in a one night refund...... We went away to enjoy the city which we did we would…

title: Nice Place
review: Dear Customer, we have already  discuessed in hotel and replied to your review  on another web-site. You are writing incorrect things about  Hotel where there are people who work hard for satisfing our guests. You do not deserve our consideration. Sincerely, Giovanni Mariella General Manager

title: Close to Station
review: Location: just beside the train station and walking distance to all tourist spots.  Breakfast: buffet with lot of choices for non heavy breakfast eater like me. Bread & croisant, rice, scrambled egg, ham&cheese, cereals, fruits, yogurt and hot drinks.  Room: medium size but it's ok as long as it is clean. The bathroom is new. Everyday they changed the bedsheets and towels.  They clean it everyday as if it's always your 1st day in the hotel.   We asked for baby crib, but it was made of wood and noisy.better ask for a 3rd bed or a room with extra bed.  Staffs are accomodating especially the ones during breakfast.

title: Great Location but Noisy
review: The hotel is nice, the breakfast is good, the location is excellent, the staff is very helpful. The hotel is very close to the main train station and the main attractions. The only problem we had is that the hotel does not turn on the air conditioning in October and the room gets very hot.

title: Nice staff/rooms but ....mosquitos.
review: Stayed here for a few days with family while exploring Florence and nearby Siena. First off, the location was brilliant! Directly opposite Santa Maria Novella train station, bus station just round the corner, and airport shuttle station just behind the train station. The city centre is just a few minutes walk away. For anyone who is arriving by train or bus, or is travelling onto another destination, this hotel's location is perfect! The service is very professional with friendly and approachable staff, spacious rooms, super clean everywhere and the breakfast spread is very decent indeed! Would happily stay here again. Recommended!

title: Near train station
review: the hotel was located just a minute from the Firenze SMN station. The staff at the reception were welcoming and prompt with my questions and requests. The guys working in the breakfast cafeteria and bar at night were friendly and always kept the food trays filled. We couldn’t figure out how to adjust the AC unit and the porter was sent quickly to our room to show us how to use the AC remote. The only reason I keep my rating at 3/5 is the mosquito problem. My family and I stayed a total of 4 nights and we woke up with new mosquito bites on our arms and faces every morning. I had to get bug bite medicine from the train station pharmacy to stop my sister from scratching herself. We never opened the windows so I am not sure where they keep coming from (maybe the air vents?). We were…

title: Good value for a solo traveler.
review: One of the strongest points on this hotel is it's excellent location from train station. Located in the city centre brings quality night life and restaurants. The staff is helpful and friendly. We even had a kitchen staff person bring us tea and expreso when we got late from a tour, even though the service had ended. Has an ATM nearby. Excellent hotel.

title: Check your room.
review: I arrived before check-in time by train, and they let me store my luggage and walk around town while waiting for my room to be prepared.  Room was basic but comfortable and suited my needs adequately.   The television didn't seem to work, but I don't travel to watch television anyway, so no big deal.  I was able to walk from the hotel to sites like the Accademia and the Uffizi gallery, Ponte Vecchio, and a lot of cultural sites.   I prefer to walk as much as possible so I never made use of the nearby public transit.  The breakfast was adequate, except they were missing a lot of fresh vegetables and fruits, but that seemed typical for Italian hotels of this level.  There seemed to be a weird smell in the lobby restroom at first, but I discovered that same odor seemed to be…

title: Comfortable and clean
review: My wife and I booked the Hotel Della Nazioni for two nights (Oct. 15-16, 2018).  We selected the hotel because it was close to the train station and had positive reviews.  However, an incident we encountered at check-in left us with a negative attitude toward this hotel,  When we arrived we were asked to pay the room tax in advance and in cash.  The woman at the desk said the tax was 24 euros and I handed her a 50 euro note and she gave me the change. She then handed me a receipt that said 16 euros.  I pointed out that the receipt was different than what she charged.  She apologized and she gave me back my 50 euros. I gave her back the 26 euros I received as change.  I then handed her 20 euros and she gave me change of 4 euros.  So far so good!  Our room was not ready so we…

title: Happy with it
review: Dear Mr Charles,  Thanking you for the time spending to write your feedback, we are very sorry that your stay was not according with your expectations.   We are really sorry that you are still in doubt after having shown you three times how the counts went and above all the control at the change of shift between the two employees showed that there were no surpluses of money. Elisabetta promptly informed me about the incident and she was crestfallen  We have no difficulty admitting any kind of mistakes and running for cover, the front desk staff has been with us for almost 10 years and I have no doubts about honesty or competence.  An employee does not risk being fired for 20 Euros!  We think that your resentment is due to the fact that we have refused to change your reservation by shortening your stay, losing the promotional rates obtained at the time of booking.  Your choice of booking through our website, gave to our guests the opportunity to get a greater discount and in case of availability to access to a free upgrade.  A little advice, when you make a reservation, specify on your search, whether you need special services to meet your needs and especially check if the category and the price reflects what are you seeking for, the package you chose was very convenient considering you came in October peak season. The mentioned hotel by your wife is another category with “other tariffs”!  We hope you will reconsider your stay here; we can take the opportunity to restore your confidence and to assure you of our best attention to your specific needs,   Best regards Giovanni Mariella General Manager

title: A great Clean Hotel
review: We arrived in Florence, from Pisa airport.  Public transport links were easy to use and the hotel is very close to the train station.  Check in was quick and efficient and we were very happy with our room, which was on the third floor, situated at the back of the hotel.  We hardly noticed any noise from the train station.  The room was a good size, with a comfortable bed.  We had fresh bed linen, each day.  The shower was powerful and hot water was in good supply.  Choice at breakfast was enough to give us a good start each day.  The staff replenished food promptly.  The hotel is perfectly situated for all the main sites, and as a good value base, it fit the bill.

title: Close to train station
review: We were happy with this hotel and would recommend it to others. Room was clean and check in was easy enough with some info. Everything is in walking distance and is close to the train station for trips to Pisa and further afield. Breakfast has enough to get you going for the day. Also a bar if you want a few beers. But the little bar a few doors up is really good for a beer with the local commuters.

title: Again the BEST view, location, staff, home away from home without breaking the bank
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Excellent Location
review: BEST rooftop VIEW. Stayed 2 years in a row, rooms are spacious, staff that tries to please guests-HOSPITABLE especially Antonio were outstanding-friendly, knowledgeable, speak & understand many languages. Breakfast buffet is generous, varied. Reasonable rate, located walking distance from rail so dragging suitcases for women is not a difficulty. Plan ahead to walk during off busy times to avoid crowds. There’s a lot of shopping at the train station,close proximity w food everywhere, market, restaurants with varied prices & menus in Florence!

title: Great location
review: Dear Kibble,  The BEST VIEW…… We like AGAIN THE BEST VIEW!  On behalf of all the staff at Delle Nazioni Hotel, GRAZIE MILLE for your very wonderful words.   With your feedback you have undoubtedly given us an extra boost to continue to perform at the high standards that our guests have grown accustomed to receiving.   Thank you again and CIAO  Elisabetta

title: Very Good
review: This hotel is 5 min walk from main train station. hotel itself is pleasant with staff being helpful we stayed on the 5 floor with views over the city and dome. Breakfast was adequate one thing we found was wifi strength was weak and lifts can be slow but overall a really good hotel

review: just opposite SMN station. there are also few restaurants nearby to choose from. 15mins walk to Duomo and Battistero where more restaurants and shops are also located. The room is not that new but it is spacious, clean and bright. toilet is clean and spacious.

title: Very close to the Santa Maria Novella train station
review: Dear Carla,  Thank you for taking the time to leave your comments regarding your recent stay at Delle Nazioni Hotel.   We are very pleased to see that you have enjoyed your stay and that our hotel suited all your needs.   It is also great to read that you found our rooms clean and comfortable at a great value, as these are our main areas we focus on.  On this positive note, we wish to take the opportunity to welcome you back soon and assure you our best attention to your needs once again on you next visit.  Grazie & Ciao

title: Good Location
review: I stayed at this hotel as part of a groupon deal and it was my second city it Italy i was visiting. I did some research on all the hotels and this one was the one I was least worried about due to the pretty good reviews, so I new it was going to be pretty decent but it went beyond my expectations exponentially. The location to the train station is absolutely perfect and extremely convenient. If you meet Andrew or Fabio or Antonio any three of them you are lucky, they are fantastic!The first day when I checked in with my friend I left my phone down stairs and I was going crazy because I though I lost it and they called us as soon as I was about to turn florence upside down to find it and I was so thankful, the lobby was full of people and I honestly though I had lost it for good…

title: Hotel in Florence
review: Dear Zhouie,  Simply perfect!  We like ...SIMPLY PERFECT!!!  Your nice review and fine words are the best reward, we know we have a great location,  but what makes special stay at the Delle Nazioni Hotel is definitely the attention to detail in wanting to build an experience tailor-made for our Guests.  Hoping to meet you again extend our warmest regards.  Arrivederci,  Elisabetta

title: Convenient stay
review: CONS: Big hotel with not much character. Can be a bit noisy if you are in a lower floor exterior room. Although the walls feel as if they are thick, we could hear other visitors arguing next door. The street is not interesting and a lot of people (even those not as pleasant as one would like to see when on vacation). Fells like an efficient business hotel with no charm. Clean but sterile and 942857 character. Hard mattresses.  PROS: Rooms bigger than your average European hotel. The AC worked great and the bathrooms are nice and have been recently renovated.Friendly and helpful front desk help. I requested a room change to an interior room and they help with that, no complaints. Breakfast is generous with good coffee, fruits, eggs and the basics.  one block from the train…

title: Very Average
review: Stayed two nights. Enjoyed it. We were a family of four. The hotel is at a walking distance from the  santa maria novella railway station. Before leaving station see exit sign and exit via alamanni. Take that route. Few layers of stairs. Get down. Cross the road.  Keep to your left until you see Delle Nazioni written in big red colours. At night it glows green.   The check in was very smooth. Just gave them city tax. Positives :1) clean and spacious room. 2) toiletries provided and clean towels. 3) daily maid service.4) cheerful staff at all places even cleaning ladies.5) pizzarias and Chinese food shops in minutes walking. A grocery shop too.6) Excellency a.c. we slept like babies.  Only negative WiFi  was very weak. It was ok for us as we are not internet people..just wanted…

title: Sooooooo Convenient
review: Dear Baswati Family,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a nice review!  We are more than happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and you appreciated every aspects of our property and we managed to satisfy your expectations.  We will certainly share your appreciation with all our employees!  We really hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back soon at Delle Nazioni Hotel!  Best regards,  Giovanni Mariella

title: Great location
review: Stayed in a room for three, which was a decent size.  No coffee/tea making facilities in room and no fridge either.  TV was very small.  Furniture etc is very basic, however the room and bathroom were very clean.   The staff were pleasant and helpful.  Check in and check out were quick.    The hotel is just round the side of the main railway station and was very easy to find.  It is reasonably located for the sights of Florence.  Breakfast consists of a buffet with (cold) fried rice, runny scrambled eggs, very hard rolls, toast, a couple of different hams, 'plastic' cheese, sugared croissants and some other pastries.  No bacon or sausages etc.  There are coffee machines for those who want coffee as well as machines dispensing orange juice.  Would I recommend it to others or stay…

title: Great location close to train station
review: We had booked a triple room and it turned out to be quite spacious and tastefully done.Bathroom was quite big and shower area was large.Breakfast was appetizing and offered quite a variety.A/C was working efficiently.Staff was helpful.Another big plus was the location...right next to Florence Railway station Could have done with some tea/coffee/water in the room but I guess they are non exsistent in European budget hotels Overall a satisfying experience particularly after mediocre hotels in Rome and Venice

title: Nice hotel great location
review: Dear Noorullah,  We really thank you for your review and we are happy to see that you completely understood the meening and the atmosphere of our Hotel.  We work really hard to transfer to our guests the feelings we have and the mood of the hotel and of the staff so that all of them can feel part of us and we really appreciate when someone like you can see all this.  Hope to have you here again and make your experience be even better than the last time.   Many hugs from Florence,  Elisabetta

title: Handy for the Railway Station
review: Excellent location on road alongside Florence Railway Station. Had a roon on the 5th (top) floor with great view across railway station and Florence buildings. Staff are very helpful. Breakfast provided a great selection. Rooms were quiet and very clean. Not many children when we stayed but staff were very welcoming.

title: OK, but noisy and needs an update badly
review: We booked this hotel because of the location and we weren’t disappointed. Very handy for sightseeing and right next to the station. The hotel itself is very clean although the rooms are functional rather than cosy. Excellent bathroom in our room. We were on the 3rd floor facing the station which was a little noisy but nothing that kept us awake. Breakfast could be better but we didn’t go hungry. It would be nice if there were more healthy options - non sweetened yoghurt and fresh fruit rather than tinned. But, for the price we paid it really was value for money and would definitely stay again.

title: Convenient location
review: This hotel is located conveniently near the train station. Staff was very helpful. The main problem was that the walls of the rooms are paper-thin, and hence, the rooms are continually filled with loud noise from the hallways and other rooms. The rooms are also very coldly appointed, with almost no decoration other than a few framed record album covers from the the 60s and 70s. Though our room was large, for some reason the bathroom was separated by a space-saving sliding door, which made tons of noise upon opening and closing.  The entire hotel needs a serious update. For instance, they call themselves an "Internet Hotel", which may have been cool in 1995, but simply looks silly and dated now. Worse yet, the computers they offer are running Windows XP, a 15 year-old, abandoned…

The hotel is well maintained with an efficient friendly staff.  The bedding was comfortable with adequate room.  Inclusive with our 2 night stay was their daily breakfast buffet in a roomy comfortable setting.  Breakfast consisted of juices, coffee, teas, scrambled eggs, asst. pastries, cheese, and ham, cereals, a rice dish.  We would definitely stay at this hotel again should we ever visit Florence again.

review: we stayed on 3rd floor. some room has balcony some room doesn't. room is clean and well equipped with latest technology. location wise perfect, Florence central train station just 3 minutes walking distance. The Cattedrale di Santa Maria del Fiore is the main church of Florence, Italy. Il Duomo di Firenze, as it is ordinarily called, was begun in 1296 in the Gothic style. it's just 12 minutes walking distance from hotel.

It was nice to have a hot breakfast with eggs.  Front desk was not as welcoming as other hotels in Italy. First impressions are everything to a traveler.

review: Dear Customer,  Thanks for the time spending to write your feedback and sharing it on Tripadvisor.  We are delighted to read that you enjoyed all our facilities we have on offer at the hotel.   We receive so many positive comments for our Front Desk, it is very unusual to hear a such negative feedback, but we have passed your comments on to Residential Manager, who is addressing it to whom it concerns.  Thank you again for your time and we definetely look forward to have the opportunity to  welcome you back in the near future,  Grazie & Arrivederci,  Elisabetta

title: Aaaawww. Convenient, Easy, Pleasant.
review: I had a very pleasant stay here, my room and bed were comfortable, I had a bath in my room! Balcony as well. The staff were friendly and helpful, the hotel was kept clean and tidy. It was right next to the train station and not far from all the main attractions. There is a fantastic restaurant just 2 doors down. The breakfast was very well done with a good selection

title: Good location but WiFi sucked!!!
review: A balcony room was great and although we experienced cold, wet, windy weather during our visit it was still nice to be able to go outside for a few minutes and admire the view. Breakfast was basic but still good, the room was clean and beds comfy. We tend to spend only the minimum time in our room so it was all we wanted/needed. The lifts are very slow, reception staff were great. Only a very short walk from Firenze rail station and easy walking distance to loads of historic/notable attractions. Great eateries, laundromat and convenience stores also close by.

title: Clean, good breakfast, no frills

title: Good location
review: Hotel is across the street from the rail station where you can go just about anywhere. And Florence just like Rome. It’s a walking city. The hotel & rooms were nice & comfortable but the room can be stuffy. No air circulation. My Mom & I opened the window which helped some but I wound up getting insect bites by morning. Furthermore I don’t get how my room smelled like smoke at times. I have asthma & allergies which isn’t great for me. I’m not sure if there are any nonsmoking hotels in Europe at all. Overall the rooms were nice, breakfast area was a decent size & food was good.  And a big thing, we were able to change the settings on the TV to English when an old American TV show or movie was on. Unlike the previous hotel we stayed at before arriving in Florence where the only…

title: Good Location Only
review: Would stay here again. Room clean. Breakfast was great. Staff friendly. No frills basic 3 star hotel, next to train station. Could hear street noise but it wasn't too bad. Beds are way too soft for my personal liking. Nonetheless would recommend.

title: Nice hotel in good location
review: I picked this hotel for the location but I didn’t realise how good the location was till I arrived it’s across the road from Santa Maria novella train station and is 15 mins walk to most of the main attractions the best steak house in Florence is 2 mins walk down the road too. Lovely helpful staff even got a free upgrade to a room with a balcony which I recommend getting if you can as the view is quite good the duomo and the mountains etc etc the only down side the breakfast lacks variety but is ok to start the day! Would use again!

title: Clean and in a convenient location.
review: Dear Reeceyb,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us at Delle Nazioni Hotel and we are thrilled that your stay was enjoyable.   Our staff take great pride in putting our guests at the heart of everything we do and our team are always very encouraged when a guest has left their stay feeling brilliant.   Your feedback is of great value to us all.  We are glad you found our location was a good position for attending all the famous Florence landmarks and we really hope that when you come to Tuscany’s capital again next time you will choose Delle Nazioni Hotel  Once again thank you for your great feedback, our team and management are always really thrilled to know that we made our guests feel brilliant!  See you again soon & ARRIVEDERCI  Elisabetta

title: Great location for exploring Florence
review: This hotel is a pleasure to stay at. Room is quite spacious, large wardrobe, wide desk, chair and bed side table, a nice rack for your luggage. There are enough shelves and drawers to satisfy your needs. Bed is quite comfortable. The air-conditioning is effecient, whether you want a cool or warm room. The bathroom is nice and wide with a large wash basin, bidet and shower with sliding screen. Room gets cleaned everyday. Breakfast is nice.  The hotel is just five minutes walk from the train station Firenze Santa Maria Novella. If you need to buy any groceries or bottles of water, go to "Conad" supermarket,  on your left just before the railway station. At the small Indian store on the left of the hotel, you would pay a bottle of water three times what it would cost you at Conad.…

title: Great location, walking distance to most sites
review: Dear Maeve,  Thanks for your beautiful words, we are really pleased to hear that we are your favourite Hotel in Florence and moreover that we have satisfied all your needs for the third time!  A big big huge from all staff and thanks again for your radiance feedback, we look forward to welcome you again on 2018 at Delle Nazioni Hotel,  GRAZIE & ARRIVEDERCI,  Elisabetta

title: Too small rooms
review: The staff is very friendly and must speak a dozen languages! The lounge area is great for sitting and having a drink in the evening. We were glad for the hot breakfast after staying in budget places without even coffee. The room is not large but is very quiet and the WiFi worked well. Wish there were a bigger shelf in the bathroom or at least a hook to hang things on. It is convenient, right across from the main train station, but there is a large construction project going on in the street and then with the crowds from the train station (and Florence is VERY crowded), the area is very congested and difficult to navigate with luggage. Be patient getting there; it is worth it.

title: Great Stay, Great Location
review: We loved how conveniently located this hotel was from the train station. Staff were very friendly and accommodating.  When talking with one of the staff members about visiting the countryside of Tuscany, he mentioned that he grew up there and suggested a few things to do. We ended up not going due to time constraints, but it was very thoughtful of him to mention some ideas. Hotel was very clean. Our floors were laminate wood and appeared newly updated. Housekeeping staff always arrived and replaced all dirty linens. One of them even folded a pair of shorts I left behind and put it on the bed. We did have some issues with our air conditioner remote control not staying on one setting. Could have been user error though. Something we noticed they did along with another hotel we…

title: Good hotel great location
review: Florence is our first stop during our vacation. And seeing the city from the hotel is quite easy. First, it is near the station, exit on the right side of the station, turn right then go straight ahead and you'll find  the hotel on the other side of the street. We arrived a bit early, that's why we left our luggage first. They gave us a map so that it'll be easier to explore the city. We explored the city just by walking around. After lunch we went back to the hotel to freshen up. We had a big triple room with balcony. Ac's good, bathroom a lil bit small but it's ok. Breakfast is good too. They might serve instant cappuccino or coffee from the machine but at least you have your own choice of drinks. Staff are courteous too.

Things to watch out for- 1) Periodic maintenance could have avoided the problem that we faced for 2 nights out of our 3N period ie Bad Odor. Of course the issue was attended promptly by providing a substitute room, but these are least expected issues during a limited vacation period  !!! 2) No electrical kettle, which is a basic feature in all hotels (including budget hotels)these days 3) The tram lines are very close to the hotel that causes vibration sound inside…

Breakfast was also a good experience with good food options. Close to rail station and easy walking distance to the sights of Florence. Many restaurants and cafes nearby offering good choice of food.

title: You pay what you get for

We were right near the Hop on Hop off city seeing bus stop. The station has a shopping centre in the basement if you need to pick up stuff. The staff were friendly.  Free Wifi and a spacious clean room with a view, made a good trip, great!

We would recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget and still wanting a very nice place to rest your weary head after a busy day in Florence.

title: Great location, they upgraded us to a larger room for free, plenty of space
review: Great staff whose friendliness and willingness to help more than makes for the few shortcomings of the hotel itself. The rooms are basic but functional. the bathroom basin is rather small for comfortable use, but the shower is great. A very comfortable bed with bed linen changed daily is a plus. No facilities are provided in the room (fridge or coffee/ making), but the WLAN works well, although the connection must be renewed every 24 hrs. The biggest criticism is for the most basic, read boring, breakfast!! The location is most suitable for walkers, practically all Florence magic sites are within 30 minutes walks, and the Main Station is literally across the road!

I was expecting a warm welcome. But i guess they're just not as hospitable and warm as i wished they would be. Anyway, the guest room floor was still as dirty as they were when i first stayed here last july. I wonder how they clean the floors....our room was also assigned at the 2nd floor and it was so noisy down there. We can hear the trains coming and leaving...the pillows are also very thin and was given only 1 per bed. Toilet is also too small and lacks space for 4 people's…

We regret that this has prevented good communication between you and the front desk to inform the staff that your accommodation was noisy and that you needed more pillows. We always reiterate our customers to advice our staff of all their needs, we always do our best to satisfy them.  We hope you will reconsider to stay here again so we can take the opportunity to restore your confidence and to assure you of our best attention to your specific needs,   We look forward to welcoming you back when you next visit in Firenze.

title: Nice stay   Close to train
review: The hotel is bang opposite to the Firenze Santa Maria Novella railway station on Via Luigi Alamanni. Check in was easy, we reached in the evening and stayed just for one night. The elevator is bit dated and slow, you may take the staircase by the side of the reception, if you are on the first or second floor. Our quatro room was on the 1st floor. Basic room, nothing much to write about.  Wifi is free and mostly fast. There are many eateries near the hotel where you may try some Italian or even Asian dishes.  If you  are on a short visit and need to take the train, this probably is the best location in the city. Otherwise, you may explore other options.  The  SM  Novella railway station is a big and quite busy rail station of this part of Europe which is a reminiscent of the…

title: Old Fashioned Room but Good Breakfast
review: The hotel is just 40-50m from Santa Maria Lucia termini.. 30m from bus ticket booth.. 80-90m from bus stop.. And top of it, there is Conad supermarket 30-40m from hotel (just besides termini exit on hotel side)..  The staff is superb.. They gave us a room with extra cot with no extra cost (our room was prebooked) as we had infant with us.   We forgot the adapter at Rome so the lady staff at the reception gave it to us with some refundable security amount..   The breakfast is cold buffet breakfast as in all hotels in Italy.  The rooms are spacious,  hygienic and the AC worked as blower too.. So some respite in cold nights..  There are vending machines on 2nd and 3rd floor (our room was on 3rd).However we bought all requirements from conad supermarket.  Go ahead and don't think…

The bathroom was very outdated and the presence of a cistern above the toilet produced an odd odour that was hard to ignore. On the upside the TV had USB functionality such that we could use our hard drive. Moreover, the buffet breakfast was the best we had in Italy.

There is no mini-bar/kettle in the room, but there are vending machines on the corridors. The breakfast is delicious with different types of pies, breads and cereals, scrambled eggs, yogurt, etc. Definately look for the back rooms because the front ones are a bit noisy because of the trains, (if you are the sensitive type of person for street noise) I did have a problem with my room in the first night, but I talked about it with the front  desk clerk and she understood it and changed it without…

No hair conditioner, no lotion. Our TV did not work and someone came to fix it and replaced it and said there is only one station in English.  Sky…

title: Brief business stopover - but preasantly surprised
review: Dear Mrs Pamela,  Thanking you for the time spending to write your feedback, we are very sorry that your stay was not according with your expectations.   As we explained at the Front Desk, as three stars hotel we are not obligied to have a porter, our staff is at disposal to help to carry up the luggage when available.   You booked through a travel agency that visited our hotel and knows the list of our services, we have satellite TV but no pay TV, the served breakfast and the 7 steps to climb to reach the reception.  In the room price is included the continental breakfast but we offer a free hot and cold buffet with various types of croissants, sandwiches, toast bread, scrambled eggs, three kinds of cereal, fresh and packaged yoghurt, sausage, ham, cheese, fruit salad, fresh fruits, tomatoes, beans  .... Moreover on request cappuccino and expresso from the Bar machine free of charge.  A little advice, when you make a reservation, specify to the travel agency  whether you need special services to meet your needs and especially check if the category and the price reflects what are you seeking for.  We hope you will reconsider your stay here, we can take the opportunity to restore your confidence and to assure you of our best attention to your specific needs,   Please, do not hesitate to contact our Front Desk or the Reservation Department for any needs you might need,  Kind regards,  Elisabetta - Guest Relations Manager

title: Well well well
review: Excellent location, just few minute walk from the train station. Rooms are simple but clean. Wi-Fi is free n fast. Enough choices for breakfast. Staff were very friendly , our train didn't  leave till mid afternoon and they let us store our luggages in the hotel.

title: Stay for the location!
review: Hotel is conveniently located close to the main rail station (and so the whole city centre is easilly accessible by foot).  This means it is easy to catch a taxi from the main rank in front (NE corner) of the station.  I had room 508 which was the end room overlooking the rail station.  It seems to be considerably larger than the other rooms with windows from the wardrobe lobby looking over the back plus several windows and a patio door opening onto the balcony which has excellent views of the rail station and Duomo roof (a very pleasant view to wake up to as dawn breaks).  Room had large double bed plus a small single - so more than enough for me on my own.  Bathroom has bidet plus shower over the bath (so maybe difficult to climb into for those less mobile).  Good selection at…

title: Good standard hotel near the main rail station and trams
review: We had a fantastic stay here, there was a very high standard of cleanliness; we were provided with fresh towels and the sheets were changed daily. In addition, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, in particular the front desk and housekeeping staff. Furthermore, the location was perfect; a stone's throw away from the main train station, and a short distance from piazza Santa Maria Novella and a short walk to the Duomo. All in all, a very positive experience.

review: Dear Customer,  THANK YOU!  You have given us the greatest motivational tool any General Manager could wish for!   The proof that our extra efforts do make a difference.   On behalf of all the staff at Delle Nazioni Hotel, who provided you with the great service all our customers have grown to expect from us,  Grazie Mille for having stayed with us, it was a true pleasure having you., we do hope to have you back soon,   Kindest regards and ARRIVEDERCI!  Giovanni Mariella - General Manager

title: Good choice except one disadvantage - ants!!
review: Staff are excellent. Street facing rooms are very noisy due to trains and trams. Aircon is efficient but noisy. Wifi is reliable but delivered in 2-hour sesions so you have to keep logging in! Breakfast is adequate although the canteen has no windows just a small frosted door onto an upstairs outdoor platform. Lifts are ok if you're patient.

title: Perfect location, near SMN train station, and places of interest, very friendly staff too
review: Dear Jackie,  MILLE GRAZIE for your review.  We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay here at the Delle Nazioni Hotel in Florence.   Your review is very valuable to us and we have shared your feedback with the rest of the team that send you a big huge   We are pleased of informing all guests that we have choosen sessions of 2-hours Wi-fi for a stronger signal for people inside the hotel, when guests are outside do not need the internet connection. The connection is always free of charge  We look forward to welcome you back to Florence for a new experience,  MILLE GRAZIE & ARRIVEDERCI  Sincerely,  Elisabetta

title: nice and central hotel
review: We stayed in Florence for 3 nights staying at the Delle Nazioni. We arrived by train about 9 o'clock at night and found the hotel directly across from the station.  Reception staff were extremely friendly and helpful and reception and bar area quite nice. We went to our rooms and on entering were a bit taken aback by the starkness.  Our room was quite large with just a bed and bedside tables with no lamps etc to make it look inviting.  However after a nights sleep and a fantastic day in Florence we returned to find both the towels and bedding had been changed very clean and functional.  If you want luxury this is not the hotel but it's is in a perfect position to sightsee.  As in previous comments I was kept awake the first night by the noise from other rooms the plumbing sounds…

title: Great location, clean, but a little noisy.
review: Dear Thompas,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a nice review!  We are more than happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and you appreciated every aspects of our property and we managed to satisfy your expectations.  We will certainly share your appreciation with all our employees! We really hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back soon at Delle Nazioni Hotel!  A big huge from Florence,  Elisabetta

title: Delle Nazioni Hotel
review: a nice hotel with a very god service , nice clean hotel and room and god breakfeast, parking is close and in a closed parking hoiúse with discount vhen you stay at the hotl , so only to recommand, close to the center of Florence and shopping

title: Great location, very noisy
review: Great location - minutes away from the train station. The rooms were clean. The front desk was always helpful. The breakfast they provided while we were there, offered a lot of choice (ham, cheese, fruits, cereal, pastry, yogurt, bread, eggs, coffee etc)  Cons - our room was facing the street - so slightly noisy with the streetcars (metro - traincars) constantly passing by. The beds were standard - clean, but not comfortable (flat pillows and "springy" like bed - you can feel the coils when you lie down). Internet is a little slow, considering when you step in the hotel, the carpet on the ground says "Internet hotel".   Overall - excellent budget/mid-range hotel. I would consider going back, if I visited again on a budget.

title: Decent hotel!
review: The food, if you can call it that, was complete garbage. The eggs looked like they were basically soaked in water and handed to you. The rest of the food looked stale and very unappealing and unfortunately the coffee was crap too. Not only are the rooms tiny but the AC was not working until our stay was almost over and when they fixed it there was dust all over ouyr floor and this was after house keeping came in. Last but not least the hotel claims to be an internet hotel but the wifi makes you sign out every two hours and the connection has been the worse. I got better reception at a McDonalds. The only nice thing is that is it is close to the train station but that can be said about other hotels around the train station. I HIGHLY recommend you go elsewhere for the amount of…

title: N.butler
review: We stayed at the Nazioni Hotel for 3 nights while in Florence. The rooms were small, but clean and the hotel was excellent for its price point. It is literally across the street from the train station and well within walking distance of all amenities. The wifi was dodgy, but the breakfast was pretty good! The hotel is not disability accessible. I would recommend this hotel, especially if you are sightseeing Florence on foot.

title: Very convenient to train station
review: Dear Mrs Erin,  Many thanks for your beautiful review and sharing it on Tripadvisor  We are very glad you spent wonderful time in our city and above all in our hotel which has contributed to render your stay in Florence so special.  We are sorry to hear that you failed to best use our WI-FI system especially now that we have put a different router on each floor for a stronger signal and an unique username and password to simplify access  We hope and look forward to welcoming back very soon and in the meantime, we remain with  Thanks again and all our best regards,  Giovanni Mariella - General Manager

title: Excellent location
review: Hotel is centrally located close to all public transport systems,we stayed for 3days and we were not disappointed. The train station is a 3minutes walk to the hotel. The hotel room was nice and comfortable and a American breakfast was included. Will recommend this hotel very good location.

title: OK Hotel Stay
review: Nice stay at this hotel! Quite simple and modern, with a good breakfast.   Staff were really patient and helpful with booking tours and making inquiries for my family! Unfortunate that our room had a shutter over the window, I can image there would have been a great view of the city!   Rooms were cleaned to such a high standard each day, and the beds are comfortable! Good air con also. I would just recommend a shower curtain as it was difficult to shower without wetting the whole bathroom!   Best location, within walking distance of the whole city! And right beside the train station.   Consider staying here if you are going to Florence, won't regret! Thanks for pleasant stay

title: Well Located, Charming, Experienced Staff!

We are so sorry to be not useful for the shutter, all windows can be opened, there are pull chord or electric bottons near the window, please, do not hesitate to ask information or help to the Front Desk, as you wrote the staff is always at disposal. title: Quaint
review: This is a fairly decent hotel (if on the cramped and small side) and it was in a really great location. It's just across the street from the train station and in walking distance to many of the best attractions, including the Uffizi Gallery, The Statute of David and the outdoor leather market. The hotel has a really nice internet cafe (which all of the kids loved) and great place to eat breakfast in the morning.

title: EXCELLENT DUE TO LOCATION AND ROOM SIZE
review: Dear Stephanie,  Many thanks for your kind review, we enjoyed so much that your holiday in Florence has been a beautiful experience.  Hoping to have the pleasure to welcome you in our hotel in the near future, we send many hughes  GRAZIE & ARRIVEDERCI Elisabetta

review: When I booked this hotel, I was taken in by the very nice pics. It looked high-end and very modern. It was a shock to learn that it was more of a hostel-type room. Very plain and cheap furniture. It was clean and staff were nice. Included breakfast was good but the room was sub-par! It should be rated a two star only.

title: Great location
review: Dear Customer,  Thanking you for the time spending to write your feedback and sharing on Tripadvisor,  I am very sorry that your stay was not according with your expectations.   I am very surprised of your review but I am wondering why you did not come down at the front desk to show us your problem. Our Hotel meets all requirements for a three stars  The Front desk assigned you a large room, the rate was really cheap considering the package you got. All the rooms with balcony with view are Superior, the rate is different.  The images correspond to reality, moreover on Tripadvisor you can find the pictures posted by other users  I would like to suggest you for the next time prior to book a room anywhere to check which accommodation will meet your approval for a better stay  I hope you will reconsider to stay here again so we can take the opportunity to restore your confidence and to assure you of our best attention to your specific needs,   We look forward to welcoming you back when you next visit in Firenze.   Best regards,  Giovanni Mareilla General Manager

title: the location is the best
review: Big hotel opposite the station. We came here with 4 bikes and although the hotel doesn't provide room for bicycles the receptionist went out of his way to show us a spot in the basement of the hotel where we could store our bicycles. Very good service. The hotel is a bit outdated, but comfortable. I had a room with a balcony which was nice. Good bathroom and shower, nice breakfast. Wifi was OK, but access could be made easier. It took a long time before figuring out the username-password combination and even then this had to be filled out time and again. Wifi in hotels should be easily accessible.

title: convenient location
review: Dear Customer,  We are so glad to read your feedback following your recent stay at Delle Nazioni. We do hope that we get the chance to welcome you back again in the near future,  GRAZIE & ARRIVEDERCI  Elisabetta Elisabetta Argento

title: Travel with friends
review: This hotel is located jus few steps away from the train station.  We had a quadruple room is ok for a family but they are faced to the main street and you had all the noise from the trafic and the trains from the street. They need to improve with good sound proof windows. The room was clean.  The breakfast (included in our room) was ok, nice options. Just over the average.  They help us with storage our luggage because we arrived before the check in time and also we departured after the check out time.  Is a good option to be near to the main atractions as the Academy Gallery, Ufici Gallery, the Catedral, Ponte Vechio. And also you can take the bus #13 (you need to buy your tickets before) only one block from the hotel to visit the  Piazza of Michelangelo.

title: Good Location near Train Station
review: Dear Szabohzl,  Thank you very much for your kind words and for sharing your experience through Tripadvisor.  It is with immense pleasure to hear that you found everything about Delle Nazioni Hotel amazing, location, accommodation and service.   We will be sure to share your lovely words with all our team.  We sincerely hope to welcome you again soon.  GRAZIE MILLE & ARRIVEDERCI  Elisabetta

title: I would spend a little more on another hotel
review: We stayed in this hotel in 5th to may 8th it is very close to train station and buses. It was not my ideal hotel the street is so busy and dirty specially because it's near station even we saw a man peeing on the corner. So dirty. And hotel is non smoking. It's like only non smokers are good guest smokers the hell with them, so no respect to smokers. They should have which they had it a patio for smoking but who cares we had to go to the street and smoke there. So I don't care for this hotel and I won't recommend to anyone mostly because of the location. Always stay away from near train station hotels.

title: Nice hotel right by train station
review: Dear Jano,  Thanking you for the time spending to write your feedback, we are very sorry that your stay was not according with your expectations.   We are stunned about your review, first of all, the choice of the location was made by you, the station area is cleaned 3 times a day, therefore, it is not to be considered dirty. If someone does not bring respect peeing on the walls instead of using the public toilets inside the station and inside the shopping mall without considering all the public exercises there are in this are, is not the fault of Delle Nazioni Hotel, unfortunately, this happens in all cities of the world.  As you can see in all our web sites we specify that this is not smoking hotel, this not means that the smokers are not welcome but only that there rules to follow, as all over the world.   We adapted our hotel to customer requests, even smokers do not like to sleep in a room that smells like smoke. Sorry to do not have a free space for smokers but we are located in the downtown surrounded by other palaces.   We would like to suggest you for the next time prior to book a room anywhere to check which accommodation will meet your approval for a better stay and have a look of the services list.   Hoping to welcome you again in our hotel, we are at your complete disposal for any inquiries you might need prior to book,  Sincerely,  Elisabetta

title: Exceptional staff
review: We stayed here two nights the end of April and the hotel was fine.  Positives- friendly staff, very short walk from the train station,  10% discount to a delicious Italian restaurant around the corner that we had 3 meals at in the 2 1/2 days we were there, the room was clean and nice a big.  They also had a very good breakfast. Improvements that would up the rating- the pillows were as hard as a rock and only had one for each of us ( I ended up using a rolled up blanket), the bedspread was very old and thin, no fridge or coffee machine in the room.  Bathroom and shower were tiny but no big deal.  I think with just  a few small improvements the hotel would get a much better rating overall.  I would definitely consider staying there again as the price was reasonable.

title: A hotel with a heart!
review: Dear Anne, Thank you for taking the time to write such a nice review!  We greatly appreciate your time to leave us with your detailed and honest feedback, as it is a learning opportunity to improve and make the necessary changes.   We take this opportunity to inform all customers that we are renovating some bathroom and we're making some rooms with independent  air conditioning.  As you can see from the list of services offered we do not have refrigerator or coffee maker but the customers can ask to our staff to put their articles in our fridge, moreover we provide our Bar with an elegant machine for free hot water and teapots to make tea, coffee, mate...  We are sorry to learn that you had problems with the pillow and bedspread, both solvable informing the front desk.  We are delighted that you enjoyed the restaurant's suggestion and we are very proud that our team delivered a great service to you and that we met your expectations.  Thank you again for your time and we definitely look forward to the opportunity to welcome you back in the near future.  GRAZIE & ARRIVEDERCI, Elisabetta

title: Great location
review: The front desk, the management, they are exceptional. Warm greeting, safe and secure. Breakfast was free and good - except the coffee. The coffee could be better. Across from the train station, 10-15 minute walk to the Duomo. Excellent value. I'd stay there again.

title: Good location
review: Dear Lemonslove,  Can’t tell you how happy we are that you found Delle Nazioni Hotel to your liking.   It’s always so encouraging and gratifying to receive such feedback.   Grazie Mille for having stayed with us, it was a true pleasure having you.   We do hope to have you back so, ARRIVEDERCI and thank you again!  Elisabetta

review: I had been in the apartment of the hotel with my family and stayed a couple of days here. Specially I like the most is it's location.  Here are few of the pros -   1. Awesome location,less than 300 yards from railway station. Less than 400 yards to Dome 10 minutes walking to river 15 minutes walking to Uffizi Gallery  25 minutes walking to Ponte Vecchio and Palazzo Pitti  2. Several restaurants near by. Hotel offered 10% discount to one restaurant just few steps away from Hotel.  3. Spacious room with kitchenette with oven top, micro oven, refrigerator and cooking utensils  4. spacious bathroom and very clean  5. Awesome complimentary breakfast with lots of varieties  6. Very friendly staff with awesome guys in reception who helped us to provide all information of the important…

title: Good location but bad overall
review: Dear Sandip,  We really thank you for your wonderful review and we are happy to see that you completely understood the meaning and the atmosphere of our Hotel.  We work really hard to transfer to our guests the feelings we have and the mood of the hotel and of the staff so that all of them can feel part of us and we really appreciate when someone like you can see all this.  Hope to have you here again and make your experience be even better than the last time.  See you soon & regards,  Elisabetta

title: 3 nights in Florence
review: I loved Florence and one of the reasons why I loved Florence was this hotel.  Conveniently located next to train station, Free Wi-Fi, plus computer room if you need to do business, minutes from the Duomo and other sights. Friendly hotel staff and decent breakfast.  The room was spacious and clean, the bathroom was up to date and clean.  They had offered maps, a detailed hand out of museums, churches and other sites with times of operation and price if any to enter.  They also gave you a discount to the restaurant next door which was great because they serve great food at a reasonable price anyway, but with the discount, you could have more.  If you stay in Florence stay at the Delle Nazioni Hotel.  It is worth it.

The breakfast was ok, however it lacks sausages and bacon which I really like .  Overall we were very satisfied during our stay at Delle Nazzioni!

title: Good place at reasonable rates
review: Location (5 out of 5): The hotel was located just diagonally across the train terminal, approximately 3 min walk away, which was great. It is also within walking distance to the main shopping area (about 15 min stroll). This allowed us to save on transportation. There is also a supermarket just across the hotel (outside the train terminal) if you want to purchase fresh fruits, DIY salad or fruit juices.   Service (4 out of 5): Front desk staff was friendly and welcoming. They all spoke English so communication wasn't a problem. Check-in was quick. I approached them for hot water to make coffee (no electric kettle in the room - see below) and they were helpful in getting hot water from the coffee machine for me. Noticed that there were Asian (Chinese speaking) staff on duty so…
