title: Super Accommodation in the centre of Florence
review: We are a traveliing family of 2 adults and two kids and when we were about to check in the hotel, they were about to give us two double rooms on two different floors. My husband was about to let it go as we normally use one room for the entire family as kids co-sleep with us. But anyone with the right mind would find that way too impractical.   Luckily, we pressed on. The reception staff was just way too busy at that moment to attend to our needs but then she asked us to wait so she could offer a solution.   After the peak time in the hotel passed, they were able to listen to the situation and managed to find us two rooms in one floor, not adjacent to each other. If only family rooms were vacant!   We asked for the baby cot but they were able to provide only after 8PM probably…

title: Spacious rooms
review: Dear Sir/Madame,  Thank you for the nice words spended and for taking the time to write a review about your stay in our Hotel. We are really sorry that you have to wait a longer time for the check-in, usually when it comes as family it is specified in the booking especially with kids, we did not know that you were a family until your arrival, as you saw we did our best to satisfy your request. Hoping to have the pleasure of welcoming you again in our Hotel, we promise no troubles   Best regards, Elisabetta Argento

title: Good Choice for a Budget Hotel
review: I guess my title begs the question of where the center of Florence lies, but right next to the Santa Maria Novella train station is good enough for travelers. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough (for those looking for accommodation in this price range). I have brought three tour groups three times now and recommended it to an English friend who thoroughly enjoyed his stay. There is free wifi throughout the building and half a dozen desktops in the reception lounge. The breakfast is excellent: you have a choice of cereals, bacon, eggs, sausages, toast, cheese, etc., with tea, coffee, or juices. The Nazioni has been modernized and represents excellent value for money in a central location.

title: Great hotel
review: Dear Mr David, We really appreciated your review, after three stays at the Hotel Delle Nazioni, you are our best testimonial of the services offered: rooms, breakfast, internet connection, cleaness... You had the opportunity to verify the changes, group after group We are working hard every day to improve our hotel to offer a better service. We look forward to welcome you in the near future, Sincerely, Elisabetta Argento

title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
review: My boyfriend and I visited Italy for a week and we stayed in Rome (Hotel Impero), Florence and Venice (A Tribute to Music). Out of all 3 hotels, we both loved Delle Nazioni the best - not only because it was the cheapest, but because it was so fab that we found it hard to believe it's a 3-star hotel!  Location: We chose this place because of its proximity to the train station; it's a 5 minute walk from Firenze Santa Maria Novella. We did get lost at first (we're not that great with map reading) and we almost missed it because it's in this nondescript building, but once we found it, we felt it was very easy to find our way around the area.   Room: Once again, we got the highest floor and a room with a huge balcony (complete with a coffee table and 2 chairs) with a fantastic view…

title: Average hotel, decent breakfast spread.
review: Took the train from Venice to Florence.  Got a taxi to take us to the hotel and laughed along with the driver when we realized that the hotel was across the street. He had to go around the block because it was a one way and we tipped well to make it up to him. In the hotel we had to wait because there was a tour bus from France that was checking in and because we had to get our bed changed from a twin room (our fault).  Room was large and very clean.  We had a patio with table and chairs. One night we just brought wine and sandwiches to the room and sat out on the patio after a long day of sight seeing.  Breakfast could be chaotic. The ugly happened when we returned one evening and the woman at the front desk said her colleague "Michael" would be happy to get us a bucket of ice,…

title: Excellent hotel, no complaints, very close to the train station.
review: Dear Madame,  Many thanks for the time spending to write many nice words about our hotel and rooms. We are very sorry for the misunderstanding about the bar that is allowed only to our staff for many reasons and it is forbidden to the public. Hoping to welcome you again in the near future we remain, Elisabetta Argento

title: Ideal for the walking tourist
review: I stayed in Hotel Delle Nazioni for two nights on a recent trip to Florence. The hotel is in an ok location, right next to the station which is very convenient...but a bit of a walk to the centre of the city. Nothing to complain about if you don't mind walking twenty mins or so. The room my boyfriend and I stayed in was pretty big and had two large windows over looking the station. The down side was the noise of the busy road below, which didn't turn out to be a huge problem for me, but my boyfriend was frustrated by it. The staff were average in terms of service, there were a lot of guests and at times it seemed a bit of a ship em in ship em out kind of deal.  A pretty good selection for breakfast, I didn't get to eat much of it as I was suffering from the flu...but if I had…

title: Good location but not much else
review: The first time I was in Florence in April/May 2006, my friends and I stayed in Hotel Delle Nazioni. This is a 3-star hotel located on Via L. Alamanni, the left side of the Santa Maria Novella railway station.   The hotel claimed to be close to all of the city's major sights and attractions but this is not really true. It takes about 15 - 20 minutes to walk to the Duomo and other attractions. However, the hotel has reasonablely-priced large rooms; we paid only Euro 90 for a double room. This price was not bad because we got a spacious, modern and clean room.     The thing that irritated us was that the hotel was quite a long walk from the city centre and the good pizzeria and restaurants. When we got tired/exhausted from a whole day of sight-seeing, it was quite an effort to walk…

title: Loved this Hotel!
review: When we checked in we were told that we had got an "upgrade" to an apartment on the first floor. We gratefully accepted. Massive mistake. The room looked nothing like the website, although extremely clean. There were shutters on the windows that let in the slightest light in and couldn't be adjusted. The "sound proof windows" as stated on the website is an utter joke as I had to sleep with earplugs I brought from home for the entire three night stay. The mattress was comfortable, but the pillows were bits of foam. No joke, foam. Uncomfortable and weird. No coffee or tea facilities in the bedroom, 10channels on the tv all in Italian and the breakfast average. You have to leave your key at reception every time u leave your room which is highly inconvenient when returning and the…

title: Location
review: My sister and I just got back from Italy and only stayed one night in this hotel and we wished we would have booked it much longer.  The staff was friendly, the room was spotless and the breakfast was fabulous!  We could see the Duomo from our balcony.  I can't believe how affordable the rooms are.  It certainly is not a luxury hotel but if you are looking for a clean, affordable and convenient place to stay...then look no farther!  Hopefully we will get to go back to Florence and when we do, we will definitely stay here again.  :-)

title: Delle Nazioni Hotel
review: Dear Mandy,  we really thank you for your review and we are happy to see that you completely understood the efforts and the atmosphere of our Hotel.  We work really hard to transfer to our guests the feelings we have and the satisfaction of the hotel and of all staff so that all of them can feel part of us and we really appreciate when someone like you can feel all this.  Hope to have you here again and make your experience be even better than the last time.  Enjoy your life Elisabetta Argento

title: Good Hotel with bad air-con
review: Delle Nazioni was more of a modern hotel, which was surprising, but nice. The room was small but enough for a couple, the bathroom was tiny and uncomfortable. Breakfast was average, but there was free cappuccino. Location was great, just in front of the station and close to the main sites.

title: Good location for shoppers and train travellers
review: In November 2012 I stayed for a week at the Delle Nazioni in Florence.  When planning my trip I used the reviews on this and other such websites to guage the quality of what was supposed to be a mid-range hotel. The reviews seemed reasonable and the price for a week was good for a room with a double bed and bed and breakfast.  After arriving by taxi outside the hotel, my first impression was not great, the building did not look great from the outside and the area seemed a little rougher that I was expecting but inside the hotel, it was actually quite nice.  I arrived in the evening and was checked in quickly and efficiently by the guy on the desk. There was an additional charge of 3 euros per day, that I had to pay on arrival and that was a tax imposed by the city which I was…

title: Just opp the train station, great rooms and excellent service
review: Hotel Delle Nazioni is located about 200 meters from the Santa Maria Novella train station so it's a perfect hotel if you're arriving to Florence by train or by the airport bus. There are a couple good restaurants (favored by the locals) on the same street as well as good supermarkets to buy your necessary water and wine bottles, prosciutto and Italian cheeses. It takes about 10 minutes to walk to the Piazza del Duomo and 15 minutes to Ponte Vecchio.  The double room in the hotel was good in size, typical hard European mattress in bed, wooden floor, good bathroom with a shower, spacious closet, free WiFi, no fridge. There was even a small balcony with a view to the Duomo and a table and two chairs, great for the summer time. The only negative issue in the room were ants, which…

title: Good management, room smelled and you can hear neighbors
review: Delle Nazioni Hotel  The hotel is just to the right of the train station. It will take about 3 mins walk to the hotel from the train station. I got a room with balcony. The view was excellent and the room was big and spacious. The bathroom was nice and there is a bathtub in the room too. The staff at the front desk was very friendly and check in was easy and without hassle. There is no kettle in the room but the staff was very helpful and gave us hot water for coffee and cup noodles. Internet in the hotel is also fast and stable. The best thing is the breakfast is really great! Although there is not alot of variety, but the scrambled eggs was one of the best I have tasted. It was really an enjoyable and great stay. To summarize Pros 1) Hotel location was great. Attractions are…

title: Good and convenient
review: Convenient location near the train station and within walking distance to the Duomo.  Had a small issue with our room.  They offered to move us but we stayed in the room and they took care of the problem immediately.  They also apologized and left us a bottle of Chianti while we were out.  The staff was wonderful and helpful.  Free wifi is a bonus and the continental breakfast is adequate with a number of choices.

title: Best 3 star hotel in Florence
review: Dear Mrs Lou,  Thanks for your beautiful review, your words have been very useful to improve our efforts for a better service. We appreciated your comprehension in the face of an unexpected event that could be solved without problem. We continuously reiterate to our customers that we cannot help you if we are not informed. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you again at the Delle Nazioni Hotel,  Sincerely Elisabetta Argento

title: Convenient and Well Priced
review: The hotel location is good and convenient. It only takes 5 minutes’ walk from the Firenze S.M.N. train station to this hotel. For Outlet shopping lovers, it also takes a bit more than 5 minutes to walk from the hotel to the bus station with the bus going to the The Mall outlet. As most tourist locations in Florence are focused, it is very convenient to directly walk from the hotels to those places based on the map.   The room is clean and spacious with one more little bed besides our double bed. Nice staff there and free wifi is provided too. The buffet breakfast provided is very good, serving with a number of choices of food.

title: Great location budget hotel
review: My wife and I just spent an extended stay at this hotel. We had stayed here for 4 days last year and enjoyed it so much that we decided that we would return this year for a longer stay. We used it as a base to explore other areas of Tuscany. It is an extremely well managed hotel with an experienced and very competent staff. It is clean and modern with a very convenient location. You can walk from the train station or the bus station. The city center is just a 5 minute walk. The hotel has tv with 2 english stations. They have free WiFi that worked very well. They also have 5 computers in the lobby area for your use for free. They have a substantial breakfast buffet that is open for 3 hours each morning. Some rooms have an amazing view of Florence. The Florence information center…

title: Very friendly hotel  Great Location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great location and friendly staff
review: my husband and i stayed here for 3 nights in october 2012.  Excellent hotel with the friendliest and most helpful staff.  Nothing was a problem, they recommended an excellet restaurant 2 doors down and the food was delicious, top class not to mention the litre of house wine for six euro.(you wouldn't get a meal of this quality in ireland.  The hotel is located a few steps from the train station and it is very quiet considering its location.  It is walking distance to all the fantastic architecture and markets.  George the bar man and waiter was extremely charning and I will go back there with my family for a weekend soon.  Rooms are spacious and clean.  No complaints. A great selection for breakfast also. Ken and Frances from Ireland.

title: A friendly hotel in a perfect location
review: Very convenient, next to SMN station and several restaurants and bakeries around the corner. I appreciate the staff's attentiveness to our needs. Make sure to ask for rooms on the 4th or 5th floor. Ronaldo, Joshua, and Marcos were very helpful!

title: Good choice
review: I was there for a business travel and the location of the hotel was perfect! Next to the train station, close to the center and with many pubs,restaurants and supermarkets around. The rooms were very clean, the breakfast had a variety of italian dishes and caffè but what makes this hotel special is the stuff...Always smiling, kind and available to help me with any problem...In my oppinion it is the best choice in Florence!

title: Comfortable with Great Location
review: Although the hotel location is great (next to the train station), the wi-fi was poor, and the shower wasn't fully water proof and the bathroom get's all wet. Our room had some kind of pipe between the walls and it seemed like it was raining all night.  The breakfast is nice, has a lot of different stuff and the staff was nice..

title: Convenient....
review: We stayed at Delle Nazioni on a friend's recommendation and are so glad we did! It is conveniently across the street from SMN train station, but is quiet. Within walking distance to most sites. Our double room was large and clean. We had a very comfortable bed and enjoyed the large, hot shower. Breakfast buffet and free wifi added to great experience. Would definitely stay there again.

title: Super convenient
review: This hotel is located spitting distance from the train station. We lugged 4 bags between the two of us from our train, down the street and to our room. As I've noticed..hotels located next to a train station don't seem to be in the most friendly areas...but it works. The hotel looks really nice from the outside and into the lobby...The rooms look nice..but that's just cosmetics. We had to switch rooms after the first night. They put us in the street side room, and all night we were listening to trains, sirens, and people. The gladly switched us to the opposite side of the hotel the next day. The floors are hardwood, so you can hear everyone on your floor in the hallways, and the people above you. The shower is very small, but had good pressure. The drains however were very slow,…

title: short  break
review: This hotel is right next to the train station, a few minutes away from Duomo, there are tons of restaurants near and if you have the chance to book a room on the top floor with a balcony, you'll absolutely love the view at night! Cute, clean, convenient.

title: Great location!
review: The front desk was very friendly and helpful. Our rooms were much better than we anticipated for european hotel, large comfortable bed and big bathroom The view from our room was fantastic - we saw the rooftop skyline of Florence with the cathedrals in the foreground.  Breakfast was good and plentiful.  This property is next to the train station which made it so convenient for day trips to other cities. We would most certainly stay there again!

title: Convenient and friendly
review: This hotel is very close to the the Railway station so its position is excellent.  Everything else is within walking distance.  The rooms were clean and tidy.  Free wifi was available.  Breakfast was included!!  There was a very large selection.  We are a family of five and occupied two rooms.  Our only suggestion is that it would have been great to have our daughters room on the same floor as ours.  We were out all day sightseeing so we only used to to sleep at night.  The staff were always friendly and happy to help out.

title: a good hotel
review: A nice hotel - good situation, being just beside railway station, bus station and information centre. Only ten minutes walk to the Duomo.   The hotel is very clean, with helpful, pleasant staff. The bedroom was spacious and the beds comfortable, but a little more drawer space would have been good - also a chair or two.   The lift is horribly slow!   The breakfasts were okay (and apparently in Italy you don't normally get great breakfasts anyway - so I've been told) but fresh fruit other than rock-hard kiwi fruit and apples would have been appreciated. But on the whole it was a good experience.

title: Great Location
review: the location is perfect..just next to SMN station so easily to access all places. staff was friendly. free wifi  available all the time. breakfast was sooooo limited.  the elevator is sooo slow. clean.  never forget to validate ur bus ticket cuz ull have to pay fees of 50euros and the police is sooo tough,wont discuss with u and will treat u in a bad way.

title: Acceptable
review: This hotel is the worst place I've stayed in all my travels, had a room on the 3rd floor, they made up 2 single beds side by side as single beds for a couple?? The mattresses were pretty much falling apart and so well used you almost fell through, woke up to bad back and neck pain. The bathroom layout is ridiculous if you have a shower you wet all the floor you need to stand on to use the toilet, the toilet had a broken seat and didn't flush (they fixed the flush after complaining several times). The aircon cannot be controlled in the room you have to call reception and they can adjust it for the whole floor, which was a pain when it sounds like a grinder and nobody else wants it turned off. All and all a very frustrating experience and I was glad I only spent 2 nights there but…

title: Delle Nazioni Florence
review: Dear Guest,  We are very sorry that your stay was not according with your expectations.We were surprised of your review but we are very sad that you have not informed us about your problems. We prepare the beds according the reservation we receive, we got a request for a twin beds not for a double, but for our staff was a great pleasure of making a double bed after your arrival. During this week, the Hotel Delle Nazioni is fully booked but none of our guests had this kind of problems. From your description we believe that your room had bathtub with a glass cover for the water and not the shower as all our rooms have the shower boxes. Another surprise was the description of mattresses, we've all changed earlier this year, maybe they are too new and hard for somebody. How you can read from other reviews, we are always available to satisfy the guest's requests, we are available to change room according with the availability on several occasion. After this, we really thank you for your review and we hope that in the next future you will like to be our guest again so that we can make your stay to be better than the last one. Best regards Giovanni Mariella

title: Good location
review: Got a very basic room which was not decorated fancy but was extremely clean. I was very pleased with the cleanliness of the room.  Breakfast was regular- pastries, cheese, meats and coffee.  Not a bad area.

title: A great value hotel
review: The hotel was very convenient especially since we took a train from and to Rome. Plus, we decided to go to Pisa on one of the days. Our rooms had great views of Florence. The breakfast at the hotel was substantial and got us ready for the day. Ronaldo (Rolando) who mans the internet bar was great and very acommodating.  The restaurant next door, Ristorante Il Portale, recommended by one of the hotel staff was good.

title: Great location
review: We booked this hotel as we were arriving to Florence by train and it is very close to the station.  The room was large and spacious. Huge bathroom. Clean towels. TV and wi-fi. Breakfast was a good selection.  It only takes about 10 minutes to walk into the centre of Florence.  We will most definently book again.

title: Comfortable beds! Amazing view!
review: This hotel is across the street from Santa Maria Novella train station and the view from the upper rooms of Il Duomo and the city are great. We stayed here our last night in Italy as it was convenient arriving by train from other parts of Italy and then we were able to catch a 5:30 AM bus to the airport. The room and bed were comfortable and adequate for our needs. The hotel is still within walking distance of all the sights as well as the train and bus station.

title: Dank dark room. Uninspiring. Average quality.
review: My Husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and we really enjoyed our stay. Our room was very nice.  The view was the best part! Not only did we have our own private balcony, we also had an amazing view of The Duomo.  Just stunning! We took so many pictures from our balcony only because the view was that good.  The beds were sooooo comfortable! We were so surprised by how comfortable, they almost felt like memory foam.  The bathroom was small and the shower was a little odd but we were able to get the hang of it.  The location is great, you can walk to everything in no time and the train station can be seen from your room-it is that close. The staff was very nice and helpful.  The breakfast was good too, they even offer scrambled eggs which were very good. A/C was great…

title: Close to everything
review: I stayed a few nights at this hotel recently in Florence.  In short - it is your standard basic no frills budget style accommodation.  If you are happy to go without the luxuries and just have the basics in order to save yourself some money - then this hotel will be fine.  The room - very basic.  Nothing much in it but there is a bed that is decent enough to sleep on, and a small bathroom.  The room is air conditioned which is good because Florence can be very hot in the summer time!    The breakfast - nothing amazing.  I wasn't too thrilled about what was on offer.  It was all basic, bland and just downright unappealing.  But I ate what I needed to sustain myself until lunch time as it was included in the price - so it would be silly to go out and buy breakfast (food is very…

title: Excellent stay!
review: The hotel in Florence, the Delle Nazioni Hotel ( three stars) , was convenient to the train and fine for the Florence sights. It was a larger hotel and not the feel of the smaller Boutique Hotels. The breakfast was not great but acceptable. This hotel is fine for convenience, but not for luxury. I would rate it two stars, not three. The management was very helpful.

title: We will be back!
review: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Hotel Delle Nazioni and I will definitely stay here on my next visit. The staff were extremely helpful and willing to answer any of my questions about the city. I found all the staff friendly and very efficient. In many hotels I had found some staff were not enthusiastic when asked about tours and where to go, however the staff here were very happy to help. When it comes to location and convenience you cannot go past this hotel! It was the easiest location I ever stayed in, literally 2 minutes walk from the station. Being that most travellers to Florence come by bus or train, this hotel is ideal. What is best is the fact that it was not noisy from the train station at all. This hotel is on the quiet side of the station, and unlike some cities…

title: It's okay if you are into awkward showers
review: We spent 6 nights here and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.  The hotel decor is what i came to recognize as European contemporary- modern flooring (no carpeting in rooms or hallways, which is maybe a little louder but certainly cleaner), no hotel room art, etc.  This is not a luxury hotel, but the price reflects that.  Our room was always clean, the beds were great, the blackout shades just awesome for sleeping late or napping.  We, too, had the bath with hand-held shower. Once I got the hang of washing my hair sitting down, I enjoyed the experience so much I've begun doing it back home!  The free breakfasts were good, the food plentiful and replenished up until the last minute.  The staff was fluent in English and very helpful, especially Josh, who made our stay especially…

title: Three star Youth Hostel
review: Convenient to the train station, but was a 15+ minute walk to the center of Florence and most attractions. Wifi was available and there were computers available for use in the back lobby. We stayed in a room on the top floor with a balcony. It was great to look out and people watch! The TV was small, but who goes to Florence to watch TV?  The bathroom had a garden tub, which was great to soak in after walking all day. The breakfast had more options than the other places we stayed at in Italy, which was a nice change.

title: A very nice hotel conveniently located close to the main train station
review: It is now 6.17am and there has been a party all night in the room below.  Lads chatting and laughing raucously all night.   Not the hotel's fault but I would pay extra for a quiet night's sleep next time.

title: Good hotel, enjoyed staying there.
review: We arrived in Florence at 6:30 am on a night train so I'd booked us in from the night before, and emailed the hotel to let them know when we were arriving (to which they replied that that was fine). We were a group of 5 and I'd booked a tripe and a twin room, and I stayed in the twin room. The room was clean and air conditioned, I'd asked for two single beds but they gave us two single beds pushed together with one king-sized bed cover for both, but they rectified that for us later on the day we arrived. The bathroom for the twin room was a bit too small, not much room and the shower was basically a shower head and sort of two barrier things for cover, and the water fell on the bathroom floor where there was a drain. This caused that bathroom floor to be wet for most of our stay…

title: Very Pleased!
review: We recently stayed for seven nights. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast is served between 7am and 10am on a buffet style help-yourself basis. We thought the variety and quality of food available was good. The room was cleaned to a high standard daily. It is located very close to the rail station. We had a great holiday in Florence, it's a wonderful city: we would recommend both the city and this hotel in particular. Hope to go back.

title: Good rooms yet awful Internet

title: Ok. Good location.
review: We stayed for 6 nights. The rooms are fairly modern with good working AC. Bathroom was well equipped with a good size tub  The big minus was that despite the hotel lists itself as an "Internet hotel". it's free Internet is setup to time your session out shortly after you stop using it.  Hence if you travel with a Internet capable phone, tablet and a laptop; you will have to log on in each device;every time you want to get online. Not even my bed and breakfast in Rome had such a poorly designed wifi service. Also the elevators are very slow and very hot. Normally a minor issue unless you are here in the summer. There is a €3 per person, per night "city tax" that must be paid in cash

title: Central and friendly
review: Our room was decent. The bathrooms are very nice with a full tub. The Internet is indeed free, but will continually log you off. It is also very slow. I found their network very frustrating as I required Skype to communicate with my family on a daily basis. The location is fantastic and is a very short walk from the train station. It is also within walking distance of major florentine sites. The tax was frustrating and I was bothered by the fact that the hotel staff demanded it in cash. (I don't know if this is standard.) The elevators are small and slow, so keep this in mind if stairs are out of the question for you. The coffee at breakfast was good, some of the rolls were tasty, but otherwise breakfast was not fantastic. This is an ok value if you are willing to deal with some…

title: Good location
review: If you are arriving by train very central and within easy walk from the station. From the platform take a right and right again - you can't miss the sign, 3 stories high. Room more than adequate size and there were 3 of us! Clean and bright with air conditioning. Staff very friendly - adequate free Internet and reasonably priced vending machines. What would have been nice is shower cubicle in bathroom (is a hand shower over bath).

title: Great location, rooms ok
review: Hotel was in conveint location and was clean and staff friendly. Bathroom facilities were adequate, however when flushing toilet took forever for cistern to fill and very noisy.

title: A great option
review: Located four to five blocks from train station. Upside – clean good sized room, no bugs.  Good location as most venues in Florence were within 15 to 20 minute walk.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was basic, but good and filling.  Apples and oranges available.  Also Espresso was available via vending machine or barista. Downside – European style bathroom, tub with shower hose.  Recommend for location and friendless.  Would stay here again.

title: Superior Staff Make This Hotel Noteworthy!
review: We were a group of 5 adults staying in 2 rooms (a twin & a triple). The hotel is ideally located about 2 min walk from the main station in florence (santa novella) and about 10 min walk into the centre of florence. Rooms were clean & spacious   Positives; Location  Clean & good size rooms  Good service & friendly staff  Good buffet breakfast  Decent value Store room for luggage in case of late flights.  Free Wifi  Other than the fact that the lifts were slightly slow, I cant think of many issues we faced.   Overall, this hotel is ideal for anyone looking for a nice 3* hotel & planning to walk around florence and arriving/leaving by train.

title: The best Hotel
review: Dear Brother & Sister Travelers, My lovely wife (Ruth) and I wholeheartedly recommend the Hotel Delle Nazioni in Florence based upon our two night stay there in June of 2012. While there are many facets to this recommendation (not least the hotel's superior access to the Internet and World Wide Web, ease of access from the Firenze S. Maria Novella - Grandi Stazioni, AND its larger-than-is-typical-for-a-European-hotel showers!!!), chief amongst them is the quality of the hotel's staff! A splendid young gentleman at the hotel's front desk (his name was Flavio -- if the hotel and you are both lucky he will still be there when you visit!) not only made us feel welcome upon our arrival, but -- when we asked on our second day if we should make arrangements the night before our WAY too…

title: Not worth a look
review: Spent 4 nights at this hotel in June 2012. What a great hotel!  Third time in Florence and this is our best accommodation. We were given a large double room which was a nice surprise, with lots of storage space.  The room was very clean and the sheets and towels were changed every day. The place was cleaned well and we even got new soap every day.  The staff were always very friendly, (the same cannot be said of most of the other customer service we received elsewhere in Florence, but that's another story!).  The breakfast was excellent, great choice of pastries, scrambled eggs, toast, jams, chocolate spread, honey etc.  Also ham and cheese and yogurts.  The vending machines dispensed lovely cappuchino's and the other machine had orange juice.  There is a bar area with several…

title: Great location, great room!
review: Location is amazing for this hotel - located right across the strees from SMN train station (can catch trains to venice, rome, pisa, etc). There is also a bus terminal at the station. Located on a street with some shopping, lots of restaurants and a nice stroll. If you leave the hotel, turn right, hit the first traffic light and turn right there is a bus stop. Bus #2 takes you to the main piazza's in 10 mins.  The front desk staff were pleasant, the internet was free and the breakfast was good.  The worst were the rooms. Firstly, the walls were paper thin. You could hear any conversation in the hallways. The bathrooms were under average. There is no shower curtain in the bath tub so the water makes a mess everywhere. The shower head nozzle was so low, I had to crouch the entire…

title: Loved The Location - Great Helpful Staff But A Few Problems
review: We arrived with train from Venice and walked straight into the hotel! Location was perfect. Just down the street there is a super market, and after that: all shopping until you find Florence's greatest renaissance art. Room was perfect and had a balcony overlooking a wonderful scenery. Great place to sit for an afternoon snack with a good book after a long day. Breakfast was very nice and staff very friendly. Internet was extremely slow. No noise.

title: Dirty, bad service, small, loud!
review: Location was great as it was close to the SMN Termini. The room was a reasonable size and the beds were very comfortable. No noise what so ever. A few problems that made the stay not as good as it could have been: bathroom smelt musty and damp, very unpleasant. The air conditioning was controlled from reception. Our room was very hot and when we asked for the air con to be turned on we were told others had complained it was too cold so we had to suffer in a hot room. Breakfast on our last morning was a shambles. Tables had not been cleared, there were no plates for food and only one coffee machine was working. Not acceptable having to have breakfast cereal in a cup! Staff were not doing their job and keeping up with the many guests in the room for breakfast. Not acceptable in my…

title: recommend for active travellers
review: This is the worse hotel I've ever been in! 50 characters will not be enough to explain all problems with this place. The water was rarely hot, the walls were thin so you can hear the slightest steps from walls, ceilings and more. The toilets would only flush every so often and if other rooms flushed, it'll pass through your pipes waking you up every time. The room stayed humid making the sheets sticky and moist. They make you return the room key every time you step out since there is only one key. Don't let the "free" wifi bring you in, the internet connection is slower than 56k! A hostel would be a better stay than here!

title: Great location and service

title: Perfect place to be in Florence
review: We stayed at the Delle Nazioni for 4 nights whilst in Florence. We found the location excellent, right next to the main train station. Also, hotel in within a short walk to most of the major tourist attractions. Breakfast was the best continental breakfast of any hotel we have stayed in while in Italy - good selection and it is topped up regularly during service, Reception staff, particularly Fabio, were extremely helpful throughout our stay. Room was large, clean and very comfortable . An improvement would be to have an actual double bed instead of 2 twin mattresses put together, but this seems common practice in most places abroad. The free internet is also a massive plus point.  We highly recommend this hotel as the ideal place to stay whilst in Florence - we would choose…

title: Nice hotel with free Internet
review: I can totally recommend this place to people travelling to Florence. The hotel can boast of its location as it has fabulous proximity to the main Florence Santa Maria Novella station terminus. Also busses, trams stop and ply almost as good as under the hotel. Although that does not make it a noisy place though. The property is nice and huge. The lobby and common areas are well kept and the rooms are nice, spacious and well appointed. Wifi is available in lobby. Staff are very helpful and quality of service is worth appreciating. Although its a stand alone hotel property not affiliated with any chain of hotels, it definitely does not make you feel that, they're pretty professional. Fabia and Marcos at the reception particularly were pretty informative and helpful. I'd love to…

title: Amazing stay and service
review: We stayed here for a conference and it was a clean hotel with friendly staff. Fabio at reception was vey helpful with directions and even suggested some local restaurants. The hotel was very close to all the attractions in Florence.

title: Average, good value for location
review: We stayed at Delle Nazioni Hotel and loved it. Very clean rooms, nothing fancy-has everything you need. The location is ideal-right by the SM Novella train station.  We emailed Fabio prior to the trip and he was very helpful. When we arrived, he checked us in and helped us set up all of our tours and was great and spent a lot of time with us. He was amazing and helped make the trip even better than it was. The internet is always available and slow sometimes but it was great to have.  Shan and Dan

title: Ok hotel, good location and good price
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Location location
review: We had a spacious clean room on the third floor. No luxury, no frills, but all we needed for our stay. Breakfast is OK, very basic, as usual in Italian hotels. Location is good, close to city centre and station.  If you're not planning on spending a lot of time at the hotel or wan't the hotel to be an experience in itself it's a great hotel.

title: Handy to the train and bus stations
review: Just back from spending 4 days in hotel delle Nazioni , really enjoyed our stay, the location of the hotel is brilliant , it is perfect if like us you are using public transport, the train station is just a cross the street as are the bus stations, lots of resturants and shops close by. The hotel is spotlessly clean , staff helpful and friendly , breakfast a little basic , but it was fine. Will defiantly return to Florance  so much to see and do and will also defiantly return to Hotel delle Nazioni .

title: Nicely located hotel with free internet
review: We chose this hotel for a one night stay because we were arriving by train and leaving from the bus station, both of which are just a few minutes away. It's also a short walk from the Duomo and other tourist attractions.  The room was clean and tidy with a balcony but we were not high enough to have a view of the Duomo. Free WiFi in the room was a bonus. Excellent downlights made it possible to read in bed - a rarity in hotels anywhere. The shower was a bit minimal with no shelf of any kind for your soap and shampoo.  This hotel sems to be a favourite with school groups and we expected to be kept awake by the hordes of teenagers running up and down the stairs. Thankfully, however, they seemed to have rooms at the rear and didn't bother us. Traffic starts at 5.30am and was fairly…

title: Hotel Delle Nazioni a good value with great balcony views
review: This hotel is literally right across from the train station, making it very convenient if you are arriving or leaving via train.  That also means that its immediate neighborhood is what you would expect near a train station; however, you are only a 10 minute or so walk to the Duomo.  The hotel is clean and modern.  A real plus was the free internet, accessible either via a room with 6-8 computer terminals in it, or via wifi on your personal device.  I used the wifi on my iphone and had no problems with it even in my 5th floor room.  About the room - I was lucky enough to have the top floor, and one of the rooms with a balcony and a view of the Duomo.  It was pretty spectacular - there is even a small metal table and chairs on your balcony so that you can sit and enjoy a drink…

title: Location! Location! Location!
review: This hotel is very  conveniently located across the street and 1 block from the train station. Being that it is on a very busy street, I had problems sleeping due to the noise. Trains and busses run well into the night.Our first night there, some crazy man was screaming at the top of his lungs down on hte street at 4:00 am. It was very cold when we were there, 30 degrees, and I could not get any hot water to take a shower, in the ridiculous contraption they called a shower which was just a nozzle coming out of the wall with two fold-up doors that you close around yourself.  The hotel does offer free wifi which is nice, the breakfast was pretty much inedible to myself and my daughter (who is vegan), and we preferred to go down the street to many of the excellent bars to get our…

title: Second stay here...good quality place
review: The hotel is right beside Santa Maria Novella train station, it's just 2 minutes walk to the hotel! This hotel is big & cozy. They provide free WiFi as well! Breakfast is simple. Value for money as well! We stayed for 2 nights.

title: Good Value, But a Poor Check Out Experience
review: This hotel is a decent value and very close to train and bus stations.  I stayed here over a year ago and recently returned with my parents.  The hotel offers good sized rooms that are clean and comfortable.  The breakfast that is included is good.  A variety of breads, pastry, hams, cheses, yogurt, ceral, beverages, etc.  The computer lobby is nice and free.  The only down side is that the noise from the street is constant.  It never bothers me since I am always so tired and crash pretty hard, but for light sleepers it might be an issue.  Over all the hotel is a good value and a safe option for all types of travelers.  The staff is nice and answered all questions we had.  Upon checking in they let us know that they were moving us to triple rooms(even though we were a single and…

title: didn't like it at all
review: I checked out of the hotel after experiencing an enjoyable stay at Hotel Delle Nazioni. The room was spacious and the toiletries were provided in abundance. The breakfast was average, but a good value. The location was ideal because it is approximately a five minute walk from the Santa Maria Novella Train Station.   I should warn tourists that I experienced two separate incidents of being confronted by vagrants who were quite aggressive. I received assistance from a very friendly Italian man in one situation and I ran to the police station within the train station in the other situation. It was rather scary, but I was not harmed.  My experience at check out was rather poor. The gentleman at the front desk did not speak to me when I checked out. I told him 'Grazie, I had a…

title: well positioned, room ok, proper breakfast.
review: We booked out hotel through "Go-Today".  Every aspect of their management of our first trip to Italy was managed perfectly.  This hotel is literally across the street from the train station, although we were never bothered by the sound of the trains or traffic or the unseemly type of people who sometimes hang around transportation centers..  It is not a 5 star hotel, but we were not there for a spa get-a-way.  I'd probably give it a 3 star. We were looking for a clean, safe and comfortable place to use as a base for our tourist adventures and this place fit the bill.  The reception personnel were always extremely gracious and attentive.  They went out of their way to provide service and information.  Our room was quite large by European standards.  It was very clean and well…

title: Poor Customer Service.
review: we had a nice stay. the staff was friendly (they changed us a couple of rooms until we made up our mind). breakfast was good in quantity and quality. the room was ok. bathroom could use some investment.

title: Very convenient to train station
review: I need to start this review by noting that I am not picky with hotels at all. All I expect is a plain room that is quiet, I don't expect a designer room or for anyone to go above and beyond for me. Having said that, I was very disappointed with the customer service in this hotel. I had stayed at this hotel before, and this was my second time. At around 9PM a gentlemen showed up to do some construction work directly outside our room, which was located on the 5th floor. My girlfriend and I both thought that it must be a quick repair job and the noise would stop eventually. Unfortunately, this was not the case and the construction continued until at least 11:30pm. Some might think that this is not a big deal, but when you have to be up at 5AM for an early train, it is a huge…

title: perfect location and awesome breakfast!
review: Our room was very nice. Not a 5 star but for the price it was excellent. We walked from train station, felt safe, great restaurant next door also. Service was fantastic and food amazing. We walked all over Florence with no problems at all. Highly recommend. Also emailed before we arrived with a few requests and all were met.

title: Easy to find, close to station
review: The location of this hotel is directly beside the train station, so you can hear the trains all night and it's also kinda sketchy neighborhood. Lot's of homeless people.  It's a decent (but not overly uncomfortable) walk to any sights. The room was very stuffy and always felt like the heater was on, although the hotel said it was not. The room was clean in the "as long as you dont REALLY look at it" way. Once we actually started looking around we saw foot prints on the walls. literally.   Pro's: Decent breakfast in the morning, and the hotel had a lift, internet center, and free wifi. The easy walk to the train station was nice when we were coming/leaving Florence, although at night we were worried about being robbed.

title: Excellent experience !!!!!
review: Dear Guest, We thank you for the time spent to write your experience in our hotel. It is very important for us in order to improve our service. We are very sorry that your staying at the Delle Nazioni didn't satisfy your expectations but we wonder whether your review was really addressed to us or may be you have mistaken yourself with another hotel. You wrote that you heard trains all night: we would like to inform you that Santa Maria Novella Central Train Station and tramvia stop at midnight and they restart in the morning. Florence is a quiet town moreover our hotel is surrounded by two police station ( one is inside the train station the other one is close by the hotel). You met homeless people in the night but not so many as in other cities: we consider them unlucky not dangerous. Hoping  to welcoming You again in our Hotel, in order to prove you the better of our services and  the best Florence, Best regards

title: Great for a travel group, couple or solo
review: It is about 100 yards from the train station just past the small parking lot entrance. Good breakfast buffet, including scrambled eggs and granola. Staff speak excellent English. Rooms are average size. The newly renovated one on the 2nd floor had a great shower but poor mattresses. The rooms on the 3rd and 4th floors from 2 earlier visits had better beds but older showers. Lots of hot water. Rooms warm in December and early November. All rooms were quiet.  Prices are better if you reserve on the internet. They have some good deals for 2 and 3 day stays.  Good little grocery store between the station and hotel. (across the street from the hotel) We found the restaurant in the station was basic but good, and did not break the bank. Handy to stop at near the end of the day.

title: Not a Stellar Hotel...
review: The location is so perfect , espacially for my girlfiend and me who carried pretty heavy luggage . Second , I can always saw lovely smile while I need help from reception, that made me feel very warmly . Last and also the most important is the room , it had pretty large space , comfortable bed and clean bathroom . The utility were quite rich , it had fast internet connection . By way of conclusion , this hotel had completed my trip in Florence !!!!!!!!!

title: Wonderful experience.
review: Hotel with excellent location right outside Florence railway station, within easy walking distance of all the main tourist spots, maybe the Platz Michaelangelo is a wee bit further. There are a couple of restaurants within metres of the hotel. Or walk to the square behind the church and there are some excellent restaurants plus an Irish pub The Fidlers Elbow (great atmosphere) The hotel itself is very clean, rooms are good and linen changed every other day. Continental breakfast is okay with a bonus of scrambled eggs if you like. What it lacks is a good bar, the stock ran out of lager within two customers that is if you can get someone to come and serve you. The reception seem to double up and will come only if they dont have any check ins/outs  I would stay there again but now…

title: Great choice for Florence
review: Buongiorno,             Just wanted to let you know how much we enjoyed our stay from 7th November to 12 November. It was our second time this year staying there and we also had 2 traveling companions with us. They thought is was even better than we described. From check in to nice clean modern rooms, to the very good breakfast each morning, to the excellent maid service, thank you. One of our companions was an 81 year old woman. She needed help with several things and your staff handled everything for her. They were wonderful. Don't let me forget the wonderful and convenient location as well as the movie like views of the Duomo. We are already looking forward to staying at the Delle Nazioni on our next visit to Florence. Grazie                                                   …

title: Dirty spoons, forks and very thin towels, noisy because of tram but very well located
review: This place was awesome! The location was perectly citutated right across from the train station. It made traveling around Tuscany and Rome so incredibly easy!! I wont stay anywhere else in Florence, it is a great hub location for your travels around Tuscany, and this hotel met all our needs. The rate was extremely fair. The breakast in the morning was easily ready and available whenever we were. Everything was hot, ready to go and tasted great even the cappuccino. The hotel had several lovely Trattorias only a few doors down. The bathroom was stocked very well everyday. The cleaning crew made everything nice beore we got back everyday. The staff was wonerful! So curteous, thoughtul and kind. They offered an INCREDIBLE wine tour in Chianti that gave a wine tasting, olive oil,…

title: Very modest but not too bad
review: First of all there are seveal steps you need to go up before you reach the reception desk . It was a trouble for our group, especially to those who carry heavy suit cases. The room didn't have a minibar !!!!.The breakfast was rich but the plates, forks, knives, cups,spoons...etc were not clean...Being next to the train station, there is a lot of traffic and noise mostly caused from the city tram line which seemed to run until midnight and then started again around 5 AM.  I would stay another hotel If I could...

title: Great hotel near Firenze SMN
review: Great location, close to the train station and the bus station - easy walking distance to all the sites.  The rooms were clean and we had clean linen every day, staff were helpful and friendly.  Free wi-fi was a bit slow but hey it was free.  Only downside was the breakfast - didn't like anything about it.  Rooms were small and the bathroom was a little cramped but we weren't there to spend time in our rooms.

title: very clean and convenient
review: Clean and modern hotel just a few minutes walk from the main train station and the major sites.  Spacious room and bathroom with a balcony (a proper one with table and chairs!) and view of the Duomo (5th Floor).  Breakfast buffet selection was excellent and free internet available on computers in one of the cafes.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Only problem was the air-con was a little noisy and we couldn't leave it on all night because of that.  Otherwise an excellent hotel, would definitely stay there again.

title: good hotel for short trip
review: THis hotel is right across the street from the train station. Very convenient if arriving by rail. Walking distance to almost all sight s of Florence, and very close to tour pickup spots. Many good , small restaurants near by, most have price fixed tourist menus which seem a good bargain. We had a nice room with a balcony. Bathroom had both tub and shower. Very nice breakfast included- Assortment of breads, meat, cheese, eggs, cereal and yogurt.  Room was very clean and front desk staff was helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Good location and value
review: We stayed in this hotel considering the location is very close to the Firenze SMN station and the SITA bus station which took us to the Mall. We got upgraded to a double superior room with the balcony, very nice and spacious room. We just found out that hotels in Europe mostly only have 1 storage room to keep the guests luggage and it has no cctv and the guests can put and take their luggage by themselves. We were not convenient with this, considering we got LOTS of shopping bags from the Mall. Thus, when we checked out we asked the lady in reception (forget to ask her name) if they have private room to keep our luggage and stuffs (our train was in the evening), and this lady gave us a small telephone room beside the office which we can use to keep our luggage privately (no one…

title: Near the station
review: Its a great hotel in terms of location - especially if you are arriving into Florence by train. Its in the street right behind the train station and all the main sights are just a 10 min walk from here.  The hotel offers free wi-fi and the service of the staff is very professional. The hotel gives you a business hotel feel, which is good, cos its clean, well lit and efficient. The breakfast could be better for the class of hotel.

title: First Italian hotel that disapointed
review: We stayed here for 2 nights in an "apartment".  This meant a small table, 4 chairs and a built in cooker/microwave in the corner, in a family room [1 queen, 2 singles].  The room was no bigger than some of the rooms we had stayed in across Europe, and smaller than some.  To get to our room you could not use the lift so we had to cart our bags up the stairs to the mezzanine area above reception.  There was no porter service for this.  We did receive the wifi signal in our room.  Our room overlooked the breakfast terrace so was not private.  The breakfast was good value and the staff were very efficient and prompt to clean up.  The recommendations for dinner from the reception staff were fabulous.  It is very close to the station.

title: Terrific!
review: You had to shake and adjust the whole threshold to get the deadbolt to catch. Sort of looked like the door might have been kicked in before. Compared to other hotels we had been in, the breakfast wasn't good. The only hot item was  scrambled eggs and they were terrible. Most surprising: terrible coffee. But the breakfast room staff worked hard. Room 219 has such a bleak view of the fire escape that the room felt like a dark cave. You have to CLIMB over the edge of the tub to get into the shower; although we're fit, it's tricky. The free wifi codes that last 24 hours were convenient.  We wish we hadn't thought it was a benefit to stay near the train station. It's not worth it.

title: location, location, location
review: We have stayed here several times in the past. The location and staff keeps bringing us back. The hotel is conveniently located close to the Santa Maria Novella train station and a 10min walk to the city center. We are always delighted with the staff, who are very courteous and helpful with suggestions, particullary the General Manager, Mr. Giovanni Mariella. The hotel rooms have been renovated, are clean, spacious, airconditioned and comfortable with large bathrooms as well. The breakfast area is clean, large and well tended. The buffet breakfast consists of breakfast cereals, eggs, cold cuts, breads, fruit, juices and coffee.  The hotel is a terrific value for the money, particularly in Florence. We look forward to our annual return trip!

title: Close to train station, free internet access, clean.
review: We had a wonderful experience even if we only stayed 2 nights, room was nice and they gave us a room in the 5th floor and a veranda where we can see the view of Florence.  The hotel is near all the tourist spots and just across the station.  The staffs are very helpful especially Ronald who have been so nice to us since our first day.  He gave us direction and tips where to go.We saw him entertaining all the needs of the guests.  I will recommend this hotel to our friends and will definitely go back to this hotel.

title: Old Building
review: Hotel is a 5 min. walk to train/bus station. I was assigned to Room 107 upon arrival and requested a new room. Hotel was booked so request could not be accommodated. The following morning I again requested a room change and the hotel manager accommodated my request. Hotel staff moved my luggage for me. Continental breakfast is simple and basic with nice selection. Coffee machine dispenses beverage of choice (macchiato, latte, expresso, hot choc., hot water). Hotel has 5 computers for internet access, so request your access code from front desk. Beware that users often change the settings, so you may have to reboot the computer. This is rated as a 3 star hotel so the city tax is 3 euro/night and must be paid at check IN.

title: Clean and Comfortable
review: It's a centrally located hotel but very old building. The lift is old rooms are old bath is small. Had to bath in the toilet rather than using the bath. Good points there is free wifi and location is near to the train station. But the area is still a little dodgy with wierd people walking around at night around the train station. To sum it up in one word what you pay is what you get.

title: staff do their best,but their best is not enough
review: We were at Hotel Nazioni Florence for four days. The hotel is conveniently close to the railway station with good super markets around it. Staff was friendly, helpful and English speaking. Our room was quite large and the bed comfortable. The air conditioning was effective; it would have been nice if the room had a refrigerator as August was really hot. The breakfast was substantial, though one missed having some fresh fruits on the buffet. Not too many good eateries around the hotel. All guided tours leave from within walking distance from this hotel.

title: Convenient location, helpful staff

title: Great value, great location, excellent service, excellent breakfast.
review: We stayed for three nights at the Hotel Delle Nazioni. A very comfortable hotel which is conveniently located, hardly a five minute walk from the main train station. Our room was fairly large and had an effective air-conditioning system, although the same could not be said for our son’s room. The hotel changed and upgraded his room without fuss to one that had a better air-conditioning system. One of the advantages of this hotel, as compared to some of the others that we stayed in in Italy was that Hotel Delle Nazioni provides you with free wifi internet access as well as use of a small cyber café in the lobby. The rooms were clean and had fresh linen and towels every day. The rooms do not have a refrigerator, which we found lacking as we could not chill our drinks and water. A…

title: Better to stay in a Hostel
review: We moved to this motel after one awful night at Hotel Martelli which was only around the corner.  It was excellent value. We had a comfortable, spacious, quiet room.  The breakfast was great value, good variety, fresh. The coffee at the lounge bar was cheap at only 2.50 euros and good.  Reception staff extremely helpful. Sorry to read some poor reviews when our experience was so very good. Would absolutely highly recommend and the location for holiday makers is great as within the block we had the railway station, hop-on hop-off bus and tour bus departure point.  Good value and good service. Five free internet computers in lounge bar for travellers without laptops.

title: A good value and very near th etrain station
review: I chose to stay at this hotel based on other reviews, location, and price.  Unfortunately, I had a horrible experience that will change the way I book my travel accommodations.  The room that we were given was on the 2nd floor.. It was what you would expect from motel in north America in terms of appearance.  Picture a flat sheet thrown over a mattress (no fitted sheet).  Sadly, I went against my gut instinct to change hotels and stayed the night with my husband and 7 month old daughter.  I could no sleep all night due to itching what I thought were mosquitos.  In the morning, there were red spots all over myself and my daughter (bed bugs).  In tears, I went to reception and asked to check out.  The lady calmed me down, and asked us to see another room as we were unable to get a…

title: Pleasantly surprised!
review: Dear Valuable User, We are very disappointed about your deceitful  review. You write about bed bugs but there weren't any of them. Have you never seen them? Or have you just heard about ? When you talked about the problem to the Receptionist, you were immediately given another room; I personally checked the former room and I haven't not found any bed bug. It is untrue that the Hotel is as dirty as you say: rooms are simple but respectable. It is untrue that the website shows only rooms located on the 5th Floor: there are pictures both of standard and superior rooms as well as of Self catering Apartments. When you surf on internet through websites about our hotel, you should pay more attention to what you are looking at.  It is false that the Staff is as you describe it: you should give yourself full attention as well to the reviews we have received from our guests. Lastly it is absolutely untrue that we don't serve fresh croissants: you have never had your breakfast. As I already said, we are very disappointed about your review; do enable me to say that it is incorrect that you could write you did. Maybe you didn't think about it but such a review can compromisse the work of many people. Best regards,

title: Clean and Modern hotel
review: The hotel is a three star hotel. However it has clean comfortable rooms. Close to the station it provides a good continental breakfast. The staff are excellent, friendly and helpful. The only drawback is that it is a tad far away from the town centre. Good Value

title: Close to train station, hard-used city hotel
review: The hotel was recently refurbished and was clean with a spacious room and bathroom. The staff were friendly and the rooms were cleaned efficiently each day. The hotel is about a 10 min walk from some of the main sights so put your sun cream on before you leave the hotel! The room we stayed in had a balcony with a good view of the tops of some of the main sights. Breakfast offered a good selection and is on until 10am giving you time to sleep in if you need it. If you arrive in Florence via coach from Pisa airport, the coach stops at the Central station which is just across from the hotel. This means once you arrive, you are only across the road from the hotel and wont need to search the streets in the heat for your hotel. We found the price of the hotel to be very reasonable.

title: A little gem... Very good value, clean and comfortable
review: We used this hotel as a stopover to catch the train to Venice the next morning.  It's somewhat centrally located - easy to get to the Duomo, little bit more walking for the Uffizi, but not too bad.  We learned that you don't need to arrive at the train station too early to catch your train, especially if you have e-tickets.  We got there about 40 mins early and had to wait around for about half an hour.  But it was only a 5 minute walk from the hotel.  This place had a ridden-hard, put-away-wet, appearance.  It was clean, but is in serious need of updating and maintenance - peeling paint, new mattresses, exposed heaters, etc.  The staff works hard, is friendly and was helpful with touring the sights.   Breakfast was good, but there was only one guy replacing empty plates,…

title: Very nice hotel
review: My Mother and me stayed 7 nights in this hotel in June 2011 in room 502. We were absolutely pleased with the wonderful service, clean, comfortable rooms, and good price. We were fortunate in that we were given a room on the 5th floor with a balcony overlooking the city, the Duomo, San Lorenzo, Santa Maria Novella, etc. (See attached pics.) Room was clean, bedding and towels changed daily. Street noise and traffic noise wasn't a problem if the balcony doors/windows were shut but it was a bit noisy if they were left open. Our air conditioner worked really well.  Staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Elisabetta from the front desk.  Breakfast was also very nice with plenty of choice, the best I've ever eaten in Italy. I didn't like the coffee from the coffee machine…

title: Nice hotel and great service
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great hotel, helpful staff and fantastic location!
review: Staying two days at the hotel gave me these two expressions: very nice and friendly welcome at the arrival and a great service at departure. When we arrived the garage that we had booked was closed for any reason. But that made no problem. The car was picked up and parked in an another garage. At the departure the car was delivered at the hotel entrance five minutes after we asked for it. I also forgot some important items at the hotel. They were sendt to my home address and arrived there before myself. The hotel itself has a perfect location a few minutes walk from the dome and the culural center(s). If we visit Florence again we know where to stay!

title: It is very noisy if you get the wrong room!
review: Dear Tripadvisor reviewer, We wish to thank you for the kind words  for our hotel. We always try to do our best for our clients and our staff has been carefully trained to help any guests at its best during their vacation in Florence.  Our target is to reach the best value for money in a standard hotel like the Delle Nazioni. We read carefully each of reviews we get and from our clients we have learned how to improve our amenities. Thank again and we look forward to see you in Florence in the future Giovanni Mariella General manager

title: Great Location
review: My boyfriend and myself arrived at Florence Santa Maria Novela train station after catching the train from Pisa airport, and it only took us two minutes to find and get to the hotel from here! It's at a fantasic location and only takes around 10 minutes to walk into the centre of Florence.   We booked the double delux room and had a great view of the Duomo from our balcony. The room was quite big and everything was clean. Although it's an Internet Hotel, we couldn't really access the web on our phones as the signal was very poor, but as we walked downstairs it got better and the signal was perfect at the bar on the 1st floor (next to the wi-fi lounge!)  Staff were VERY helpful and friendly - nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was also very nice and just what we needed to…

title: Reccomended
review: This hotel faces the back of the SMN train station. Our room on the 3rd floor is very very noisy, and I'm not a light sleeper at all and I can't sleep. Besides trains there are buses coming and going all night and I literally felt like a homeless person sleeping on the street.  The noise problem is worsened by some kind of piping/plumbing problems the hotel has with their bathrooms. When other rooms use the bathroom, you can hear so clearly.  The front desk staff appeared unhelpful and disinterested. No smiles.  The Internet was advertised as free. But the wi-fi didn't work in the room on the day we were there. Went downstairs to try the lobby area. Apparently no signal there either. People were trying the free computer in the back of the lobby and none of them worked that day. …

title: This hotel is all the luck of the draw with room allocation
review: I can't say enough nice things about this hotel. It is conveniently located (right across from the train station) and a few minutes walk from the center of the city (the Duomo). Clean, well lighted, comfortable room with free internet access and in-room safe we also had a filling breakfast each morning, a little bar that served drinks and wonderful, helpful, 24-hour front desk staff. It's true the hot water shower was a bare trickle at certain times of the morning because there were many groups of young people staying there but that was really the only drawback. We were three adults staying in the room and our charge, which included breakfast, was an average $183 US per night. It was especially convenient to have in-room internet access and I never had a problem getting online…

title: Nice people, nice hotel, and Great location.
review: If  you are fortunate to get an inside room - they are large and quiet. Get an outside room and they are super small, exceedingly noisy and unpleasant. Other problems.  My room had the thermostat set at 30 and it could not be altered.  The cleaning lady was very pleasant and said broken in about 6 languages.   The desk staff (in particular the head male) were exceedingly unpleasant and would not move me to a room where the temperature could be made bearable. Eventually I waited for a change of desk staff and they realised how unpleasant it was and changed the room. Other items including the coffee machine in the dining room were also broken. The male receptionist at the desk also managed to damage the handle on my suitcase. There are no porters available and a flight of stairs…

title: Good staff, very poor hotel
review: We arrived by train from Rome.  Walked out of the station and went about 75 yards to our hotel.  The lobby was very large and clean.  The check in was a breeze and very informative.  WiFi is available in the lobby and it is free.  They have large couches that you can sit on and check your email.  They also have PCs that you can use and they are also free. Our rooms were comfortable and overlooked the court yard.  The windows were functional and had shutters that you could open and let in some fresh air. Breakfast was breads, eggs, sweet rolls, cereal, cheese, lunch meat, coffee, and juice. The location is very convienient to resturants and attractions.  We walked to everything.

title: What a fabulous hotel!
review: We chose this hotel after reading so many positive reviews but we were rather disappointed. Stay away from rooms 134 and 135. When weather is bad the drains smell and being in these rooms feels like being in the sewers. the stench is unbearable.  Hotels' good points: location. helpful staff Hotels' bad points: something is seriously wrong with the pipes...there was constantly a horrific noise coming from the pipes in the bathroom. It kept us awake. It was horrible and constant. The rooms are tired-looking, old and not very clean. But I guess there is a new section in the hotel that looks nicer and newer. It is not on the first floor, for sure. Price of 70 Euros per night was ok-ish. Wouldn't pay a penny more.

title: Clean, friendly service, convenient location

title: A great, clean hotel near train station!!
review: If you're arriving by train, you're at the hotel in a matter of minutes.  Although the location near the train station is not ideal, it's a fairly clean safe-feeling area.  And, Florence is rather small, so it's any easy walk to just about anywhere.  We were in room 411 overlooking the "city" as the clerk told us when we checked in.  We were really overlooking the train station.  It's a bit noisy during the day, but you're not in your room then.  With the shutter down and closed at night, it was certainly quiet enough to sleep.  The room was clean and adequate, though I will caution that the shower was extremely small... my 6'3" husband had literally no room to move.  The hotel has an elevator, the staff is friendly, and there's free internet & computers in the lobby.  I can't…

title: Security is an issue
review: I just returned from a 4 night stay here in December 2010.  This place was awesome for those looking to be close to the train station.  I was a bit concerned about the location and security issues based on other remarks posted, but it was very safe and secure.  The staff were all super friendly and the breakfast was good...mind you it is typical Italian with cheese, meat and sweet pastry.  No pancakes here, my fellow Americanos!  But it was enough to start our day with!  The free internet was a great perk too.  The rooms are a good size for Europe, and the bathroom was bigger than most in Europe.  The water was always hot, the room always clean and the staff always smiling.  I loved it.  The only thing I would comment on is that since it is right near the station (SMN) the noise…

title: Great location and great service
review: The location of this hotel is ideal for exploring. Only gripe we had was on returning to the room each afternoon, we found all the room doors lying open and no sign of the maid apart from her trolley.  This was a real concern as residents belongings were clearly on view.   PLEASE TIGHTEN UP ON THIS ISSUE.

title: Noisy but good
review: Great hotel with very helpful staff.Decorated very nicely.quiet..free internet..deluxe breakfast...perfect location right across from train station.
