title: Great value for the price
review: We stayed only one night in the hotel, so the first impression counted a lot. The triple room was much nicer than we expected (very clean, cute, comfortable, with very nice bathroom) and conveniently the single bed was in a separate area from where the double bed was (just without a door in between). The staff was very friendly and helpful, the breakfast extremely delicious and the internet was free! The area is not the nicest since it is overlooking the train station, but not too bad at all! Very good value for money!!!!

title: Clean adn great location
review: I'm astounded at the poor reviews of this place.  We returned from Florence this past Saturday and stayed here for over a week.  I just have to say that I'm suspecting that those that give this hotel a poor review are Americans that are not seasoned travelers or feel somehow entitled to something they're not paying for.  We had an excellent experience here.  Yes, the windows don't have screens (none do in Europe) and you get mosquitoes... but you can go down to the supermarket that is a block away and get one of those mosquito repellents that plug in to the wall.  They work great. Yes, the walls and floors are thin.  Um... yeah, they are everywhere in these types of hotels.  You want absolute quiet, pay another 100 euros a night.  We had an incident where the upstairs neighbors…

title: Easy for exploring
review: This is a very conveniently located hotel (opposite the train station) in Florence.  The rooms are clean, bathrooms modern ( with new, clean towels) and breakfast good.  The free internet was down for two out of our four days stay there however.  They were kind enough to offer their office computers when I had an emergency email to send.  The staff were always friendly and accomodating.   All the tour buses etc leave from around the corner which made our life quite easy while in Florence.  Main attractions are within walking distance.  CTB

title: very bad service! you never go to this hotel.
review: The Hotel Delle Nazioni was in the right place for exploring not only Florence but Tuscany, and other towns and cities west and north of Florence. The train staion right across the street, two bus lines on each side of the station. SITA lines around the corner for touring Tuscany. LAZZI lines for exploring Piza, Lucca, And towns to the north. Easy walking to the major sites. Oh yes the Central Market is only 3 blocks north of the station. A laundry just around the corner and down the street with a Supermarket on the same street for those yummies you want. Breakfast very good for starting a busy day. Great staff all around and don't for get the free internet.

title: Great location, Clean rooms, smelly bathroom

title: Awesome, Awesome and more Awesome!
review: Brilliant location, right across the road from the S.M.N. train station and around the corner from the bus station. All other attractions easily accessible as Florence is quite compact and easy to navigate.  The rooms were basic but spotless. Towels and bedding were changed every day.  The staff were polite and helpful. Only gripe would be the bathroom.  There was no shelf near the shower and the smell of drains was awful. We bought some scented candles and that improved the situation.  The rooms are all meant to be refurbished but I think this only applies to some of the bathrooms. We stayed on the first floor

title: Good value, clean, no internet access, but adequate and recomended
review: Absolutely no compliants! These people complaining about internet  service and small rooms ate ovbiously more high maitiance than myself!! The rooms are super clean, cool, bathroom huge and very nice. We had a balcony whick over looked the Duomo, excellence view of the city and country side.Room cleaned everday. We were able to check in early and store our bags in a locked room while we explored. Staff was always VERY helpful. This hotel is worth every penny or euro. Location is amazing, literally a walk across the street to the train station.

title: Great location if you need to be close to Firenze SMN station
review: This hotel was a welcome refuge from the last place we had stayed in Rome. We didn’t have to pay for air-conditioning and a better breakfast. We were given a nice room with a view. The front desk service is a little inconsistent, most staff is friendly and helpful but some are rude and inpatient. They were always willing to fill my plastic tub (I bought a small dish pan for feet soaking) with ice without any rudeness or complaint, and most of the staff wants to be of service. Internet was chronically down and everyone was frustrated over it including the staff. If you must have internet this is not the place to stay, it’s not a new issue. One woman allowed me to use the office internet for a short time. I did wonder why the office had internet and the guest computers didn’t.  I…

title: Get what you pay for.
review: The hotel itself was very 70's-style but it was large so we didn't care too much about the decor. My partner and I only stayed one night as we were making our way down from Venice to Rome and wanted a night here to see 2 of the museums. We needed to stay close to the train station, so this hotel was perfect for us. It was about a 50m walk from the station to the front door of the hotel with our large suitcases. If we stayed for anymore than one night in the future we would definatly stay somewhere closer to the main area near Ponte Vecchio bridge, where all the shops and cute cafes were (really gorgeous part of the city).  It was within walking distance to Uffizi (Michaelangelo's David) and the Duomo (really good markets around this area) but there isn't much near the hotel in…

title: good location , no more

title: Great value and good location!
review: We stayed at this hotel for two nights , i booked two connected rooms as i always do when travelling with my kids , the location is perfect near the train station , we were given two rooms that are not even close to each other , so we had to cancel one room , after a long negotiation they agreed to exempt 40 eur. my advise is that if u r travelling with kids book one room for 4 , since the double room is acually two rooms , one with king size bed the other with twin beds , the hotel needs renovation , the furniture is worn out , still it is a good choice from which u can see florence.

title: Central location - expensive parking
review: We stayed here for 4 nights and found that the location was very good.  Since it is next to the train station it can get a bit noisy but when you're in florence the priority isn't sleep, it's exploring the city's many treasures.  The breakfast here was good and the service was adequate though not overly friendly.  Since Florence is so small, you don't need to have something right in the hart of town since it takes about 5 or 10 minutes of leisurely walking to get to most of the sights.  This small walk time is definitely worth the excellent price for this hotel.  Which is also, coincidentally located next to some very good restaurants which are much less tourist traps than most of the places right next to the main sights.  You can see the Duomo and Santa Maria Novella right from…

title: Rooms lousy, location dodgey
review: A good choice if traveling by public transport as all major attractions are within walking distance. If travelling by car other alternatives may be better as parking is 24 euro a night. The room and breakfast was quite basic but ok, but the bathroom contained some bugs.  The reception was nice and the staff service-minded. A plus for free but slow internet access.

title: Forget the Uffizi. Probably Florence's best hidden gem at an unbeatable price.
review: We spent 3 nights at this hotel, never again.  Our room was less than basic.  No airconditioning even though there was one on the wall.  Bathroom, you couldn't swing a cat, to the extent to go to the toilet you had to stand in the shower.  However this hotel was apparently fully booked.  Location near the station was great, but of a late evening the location left a bit to be desired.  Note: as a gluten free person the Italian restaurant nearby was great, also behind the Duomo there we discovered yet again another gluten free restaurant.

title: NO INTERNET. Stinky room.  But great location.
review: We stayed at this hotel in Florence for four nights. The location is great when coming in from the train station but it's a good 30 minute walk to Ponte Vecchio. The internet only worked twice while I was there, and when it was working had to wait for kids to finish playing on the computers. Our room was very basic but no complaints and the bathroom was a decent size. I actually enjoyed the breakfast here, they had the best croissants filled with custard or chocolate. There were alot of young travelers staying at the hotel and they weren't always courteous of others. I enjoyed my stay and would reccomend this hotel to a friend who doesn't want to spend a fortune.

title: Great Location!!!
review: Booked a quad room (family room) over Hotel.com for $130 a night.  Very cheap.  The hotel is less than a 5 minute walk, literally just down the block from the Santa Maria Novella train station.  Hotel appeared to be nice--standard Ikea furniture.  While entering the room, a waft of what seemed like molded guava/garbage/sewage was just thick in the air, permeating, taking a bad hit into our nostrils.  They advertise as an "internet hotel".  However, the WIFI does not work.  Do not go here if you rely heavily on the internet on your trip!  The computers in the lobby have VERY SPOTTY internet.  There are 6 and I've seen up to 3 work and during one night, there wasn't any connection at all.  It's hit or miss.  Out of the 10 times I tried, I was successful twice.  It was very…

title: Good quality and location
review: This hotel was perfect for us since we arrived to Florence from Rome via train and it was a 5 min walk.  This was the nicest hotel we had stayed in during our trip.  The room was large and it had a large bathroom.  The hotel was a 10-15 min walk to the sights which was great. The breakfast was good with eggs, bread, croissants.  The only negative was the internet.  The wifi was not working at all during our stay and there was only 1 computer working out of the 5.  The sights that I would recommend would be the accademia but book the tickets in advance.  The medici chapels was not worth the time.  I would also recommend climbing the duomo to get a great view of florence.  Also we went to Pisa and that was an easy side trip and for us it was worth it.

title: Average Hotel
review: The hotel was good, We were allocated a room on 5th floor with a balcony and view across Florence.   We had concerns based on the recent reviews on Tripadvisor about this hotel. However, we found this hotel to be fine. Most previous reviews were depend on the room allocation and the guests staying at the hotel during your period of stay. The rooms were clean and were regularly cleaned to a high standard. The breakfast offered a good selection. Wifi was a bit slow but this was not a high priority to our holiday. The hotel location is close to rail/bus access and the main areas in the centre of Florence. We did not find anything wrong with the hotel. However, we could not say the same for the other guests, when we were wakened to a midnight fire alarm as a guest had been smoking…

title: Location gets over 5 stars....
review: We stayed here for four nights this month.  The location is OK, it's very close to the station, but it is not particularly near the tourist sites--you'll walk past 30-40 other hotels on your way there.  Our room smelled like smoke (although it's a non-smoking hotel), the walls had a bit of mold from water damage in the past, the toilet ran constantly, and our AC dumped water on the floor (this was fixed by the staff).  The staff were polite and helpful.  The breakfast was pretty bad, easily the worst of the three Italian hotels we stayed in during our trip--basically stuck to toast and jam, as the rest was pretty bad.  It's a fine place, but it's not an exceptional deal or anything special.

title: room smelled like sewage
review: We stayed here for 2 nights and we had a comfortable stay. After the experience in Cesar Palace experience, I was skeptical about this place but it was far better than expected. Most importantly the location was fantastic - it was like 2 (5 min if you really walked slow) from the Florence main railway station.  The staff was very helpful. After we checked in, we were not happy with the room as it faced the boiler etc of the hotel, I was shown 2 other rooms and we selected one which was on the 1st floor facing the street (my son enjoyed it as he loved the trams going past every now and then), if you are a light sleeper, this room is not for you. the breakfast was good too - after the "COLD" breakfast, we were happy to see atleast scrambled eggs and a better spread in Delle…

title: Good value - a decent hotel
review: Good area if you are concerned with being in a centrally located hotel and having easy walking access to places.  Not much of a vibe if that's what you're looking for.   The biggest problem was the bathroom.  Upon walking in, we were overwhelmed with the smell of...sewage.  It was either coming from the toilet water or the bidet.  The toilet continued to be loud 5 minutes after flushing and the light/fan rattled while on.  The shower water got everywhere.  Mold on shower curtains, door handle broken and my friend ended up locked in bathroom...lol.  We hardly spent time in our room and were on a budget so didn't really care much....but seriously...?? The room was basic.  Beds were uncomfortable.  Breakfast was good and front desk staff was nice though. Just a lot of VERY…

title: great hotel
review: We stayed four nights. We chose the hotel because of the short distance to the train station and because of the low price. We arrived by train from Pisa Airport and only had to walk 2 minutes to the hotel.  The hotel room was simple and clean. The view was really bad, but I don't what to expect. The breakfast is fine. There is Wi-Fi in the rooms, and they have computers in the lobby, which you can use for free.  I think the hotel is good value!

title: Great location to the train station...
review: this is all  l have to say about this hotel .......... room dark and unwelcoming shutters on the windows you can't move bathroom small and when you flush the toilet the water in the urn comes out the top and onto the seat ( l told my husband off for not lifting the seat when he went to the toilet but found out later that it was not him but the toilet urn splashing water out over the bathroom not ventilation only a window to open so cold when having a shower bed hard as rocks dreadful ...........had to sleep in the single bed next to the larger bed as is was more softer ( husband not happy).............. no tea or coffee making facilities supplied asked for hot water in the bar area was like mud was in it one staff member very helpful and friendly she worked in the restaurant…

title: You could better have stayed at a youth hostel
review: We stayed here for 4 nights on a recent trip to Italy.  It was booked through a package on go-today.com.  Very close to the train station...less than a 5 minute walk. The hotel is fairly modern, has a nice lobby, friendly staff and a decent breakfast which is included.  There are several computers in a general lounge area for guest use as well as Wi-fi in the rooms if you have your own laptop, though the signal was spotty at times.  Our room was front street facing, third floor with a balcony that had a sneak view of the Duomo....nice surprise!  Street noise and train noise wasn't a problem if the balcony doors/windows were shut but it was fairly noisy if they were left open.  It was April and the temperature was cooler so a warm room wasn't a problem but in the summer months it…

title: Bare minimum hotel. Internet hardly ever worked correctly.
review: Normally I am really the last person to complain about hotels and I am used to traveling and adapting to my environment.  However, it is difficult to get a good nights sleep in this hotel.  This is because of a lack of sound isolation and large groups of young people in this hotel that are seemingly in the habit of making noise in the middle of the night, like they are out on the town, completely disregarding the other guests.  Nothing is done about this by the the rather unfriendly staff of this hotel. Besides that, the connection to internet in this "internet hotel" was extremely difficult.  I really have to say that I was very disappointed in the low quality of this hotel. If I would have wanted to be in a youth hostel, I would have booked one myself, but that was not my…

title: No heat in our room and unhelpful staff
review: We stayed one week at this location. We chose it because it offered free internet and breakfast.  This place bills itself as a 3 star hotel, in my opinion it is closer to 1.5 stars.   Check in: No one to help with luggage. Room key did not work, had to go back to front desk to get a new key.  Room: Small. No carpet. Ugly linoleum floor with holes. No drawers. Tiny desk with no lamp or chair. In front of hotel, noise of buses and trollies all day and night. Unable to turn on the heat in the room.  Bathroom: Tiny. Cracked floor. Shower so small that I cannot turn without knocking the faucet handle, thus changing water temperature.  Internet: Hotel WiFi never worked with my laptop, which worked fine before I left, after I returned, and with other hotspots while I was in Italy. …

title: Excellent location, and good value for money
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Simply Superb
review: The hotel is right across the street from the train station, making it just around 5 minutes walk from both train station and Terravision bus stop.  It is also 10 minutes walk from the Duomo.  The hotel is good value for money at the price we paid, around €50 per room per night.  The only fault that we could find was the intense heat in the rooms, especially at night, since we had no control over the central heating.  Also, the bathrooms are in need of renovation.  Otherwise, the staff were helpful, the breakfast good and plentiful.  The internet service is also a bonus.

title: A very good hotel near central station
review: Amazing location 5mins from station and 10mins from the centre of town. We got a beautiful balcony view over Florence. Our room was trendy, smart and the pictures on the wall everywhere are cool classic old album covers. Breakfast was decent and the Free WiFi worked well. Cant really fault this place.

title: Amazing hotel!
review: We stayed at this hotel and enjoyed our stay. I have directly booked this hotel and got a very good rate. The staff was very good and they have good range of selection for breakfast.

title: Wonderful!
review: this hotel was great! very clean, very well located, friendly and helpful staff, i loved the room the gave us, it was in the 5th floor looking at the city it was quite beutiful, the rooms are very confortable and clean, the hotel is very nice decorated, very modern, the breakfast was good, we though it was really good compared to others.all in all, this hotel is a must when you go to florence is close to everything,clean, and friendly. i will definitely stay here again my next time in florence.

title: Fantastic Location & Free Internet!!!
review: We stayed in Hotel delle Nazioni for three nights.We were meant to stay two,but we thought the hotel was very nice,close to the train station-which was handy for us,being in Florence for the first time.The staff were very pleasant and helpful,advised us what places we should visit and one receptionist even searched for information on the internet about the score in Ireland-France football mach! They also have six computers with internet access for free for hotel guess(in majority of places we stayed we had to pay per minute!) and great cocktail bar for very reasonable prices. If I ever go to Florence again,I would defenitely stay in this hotel.

title: Excellent location, nice hotel
review: Hotel was in a prime location and was right across the street from the train station.  The #1 selling point of the hotel is it's free internet and free 6 computers in the lobby!!!  Lots of city buses right outside the bus terminal.  Lobby was nice and clean.  Breakfast was decent.   Front desk staff were decent, but I didn't ask for much.  We had the family room, which was great because it was 2 separate rooms (no door though) with 2 tvs.  Would definitely stay here again because the location was fantastic.  The area immediately outside of the hotel looks a little shady, but we went out late every night and never had any trouble.

title: It is more than worthy what you pay for !
review: I will comment on the following: Location (station, supermarkt, restaurants, sightseeing), Room (View), Breakfast.  ------- LOCATION: The hotel is close to the main STATION. This makes it very easy to get there, for example by train or shuttle bus from Pisa airport and also after extensive tours through the city, since most busses pass the station. When you take the shuttle bus from Pisa airport, you will pass the hotel before the bus stops at the station a minute later, so that you easily know where to go. It is not far, maybe 100m.  Close to the hotel, there are two SUPERMARKETS which are open everyday until 9pm. There are also two RESTAURANTS: Go to the one that is 50m in the direction of the station, not the one next to the hotel! The better one looks more expensive, but it…

title: Great for a budget stay but don't expect luxury!
review: It gives us a fresh impression when we get in the room . It is roomy and tidy ! A big patio with wide angle view gives you a panoramic view of the city. The bathroom is pretty and big enough. The only minor flaw is the toilet seat is out of  position because of the screw doesn't tight properly. The restaurant that we take breakfast is fascinated and comfortable ! It is highly recommended to live here when you come to Firenze !

title: Good value, great location.

title: Great Location for Access and Nice Hotel
review: We were with a small tour group of 16 people and our tour company booked our reservations.  Hotel is in a great location to be able to walk to see the tourist sights.  Staff was friendly and spoke some English, which was most helpful.  The free internet was good and we were able to check our email.  We were on the third floor and had good air conditioning.  Florence was having record heat while we were there.  Our friends on the first floor did not have good air conditioning and had a lot of noise.  Our floor was quiet and cool.  Very good breakfast buffet with scramble eggs, pastries, meat & cheese.  No fruit though.  Nice large room for breakfast.

title: Great for value & location.
review: In General: I was traveling solo but meeting friends in Firenze. I got a single room, but was assigned a double sized bed. By European standards the room was huge in my opinion. I paid $570 for 6 nights, roughly $95 us per night which i thought was a great rate including free breakfast and internet accesss The hotel is next to the train station so it is not in the most picturesque part of Florence, but who gives a damn? I was only sleeping there. The room was nice. Maid service was good. The hotel staff was professional and as courteous as can be expected when dealing with picky people from American and 20 other countries. In particular, a gentleman by the name of Lucca (I think) who was working the night shift was extremely helpful and very kind and thoughtful. He should be…

title: A Great Hotel For A Great Price
review: This was my second stay in this hotel.  I was selected as the "guest of the day" and upgraded to a top floor room with a balcony.  Which was a great difference from my previous stay here.  I booked on expedia and received a great deal.  I originally picked this hotel for the proximity to the train station, but after having two lovely experiences will continue to stay here in my future trips to Florence.  Breakfast is good except for the coffee from the machine.  It is awful - so stick with tea.   When I stay again I will go for the balcony rooms if possible as the views of the city are not to be missed.

title: convenient location but dont expect anything more
review: WOW! My husband and I, staid in three different cities in Italy and one in Paris during our honeymoon.  We had booked our trip with Go-Today and expected the hotel rooms to be basic and unimpressive. However, Hotel Delle Nazioni was very impressive. We were upgraded to the best room they had available when we checked in for no additional cost. The manager arranged for us to have free fruits and water in our room and two free drinks at the bar for no extra cost. It was the best room we had during our vacation.  We had a great view, a VERY big room wit a king size bed and an extra twin bed. As an added bonus, it is around the corner from the great shopping areas, grocery stores, a laundry mat and across the street from the train station. We had a great time there. Good job Hotel…

title: Worst Hotel of the Trip
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Convenient and decent
review: Hotel was booked by Go-Today and was billed as a standard (3 star) hotel.  It is not.  The only positive was the close proximity to the train station and sites.  While the entrance, "internet cafe" and bar area are nice, the rooms were dismal.  The assigned room was very dirty and right over the street- even though this had been booked months in advance.  We asked to be moved, and were, but not until the following day, which was very inconvenient to us.  Second room was only marginally better because it was around the back and quieter.  It was still very dirty and the bathroom floor was flooded every day by using the shower that had no ledge or lip to stop the water flow.  The breakfast was marginal compared to the other 2 hotels we stayed in Rome and Venice and the coffee was…

title: Very nice hotel with very good location
review: This hotel is a really good base for staying in Florence. Especially if you are travelling there by train from Rome or Venice. You come out of the train station and its literally down the street. There is a quicker exit from the station (someone said exit 5) so use that. Going the long way adds on only 2 min so convenient either way. Rooms quite nice, nothing amazing but spacious and clean. We had a balcony too overlooking the station which despite the view was nice to have a glass of wine on a warm night before heading out. Fairly noisy main road when doors open but the windows have optional metal shutters on them in addition so its v peaceful. 5/10 min easy walk to pretty much everything in Florence and loads of cafes, restaurants, shops nearby plus a small supermarket 3 doors…

title: Good room but a bit noisy
review: We spent 3 nights at the hotel and it was a very good choice. The staff is very nice and helpful, they do everything for our comfort. Our room were always clean.Breakfast is good and enough. It is easy distance with the main attractions and very close to the central station which is important if you go to Pisa by plane and than with train or shuttle bus till the central station. We could hear only the bells of the Dome not the trains. Thank you Delle Nazioni !

title: Great location, great price.
review: I stayed with my family on one of the apartments. Big room, clean and the kitchenete was really usefull. There are 2 supermarkets just round the corner and easy to cook your own food at the apartment. The location is good near the station but thats a bit noisy with the train station in front and the bus station round the corner.

title: Great Location....

title: Excellent value
review: The Delle Nazioni Hotel was a very nice hotel. The staff was very helpful, rooms were clean, the breakfast was the typical European and very good and the internet use was free!! They are centrally located to everything you want to see and do. If you're traveling by train, the station is right across the street and there are a number of good restaurants very close. You're steps away from a small market, as well as the money exchange. I would recommend this hotel to those traveling on a budget, but want someplace nice & convenient to lay there head.

title: very nice hotel and reasonable
review: We were looking for an affordable hotel near the train station and were very pleased with our stay. Our air conditioner worked well which is essential in August, they treated us extremely well and having a grocery store nearby was great. The free Internet was wonderful after stuggling to get phone cards and pay phones to coordinate. Of course there is sometimes a wait for computers in the evening. The breakfast was a wide variety of pastries/cereals but the room is not air conditioned so it is hot and made us nervous to eat the milk products that were out for several hours. For the money we paid it was a very pleasant stay.

title: Convenient location but basic facility
review: we stayed here for 5 nights. We didn't have tables or chairs on the balcony like in the photos but the hotel was clean, very nice staff, no problems. the internet section is also very nice, most hotels you have to pay 10.00/day to get internet but here it's FREE! Breakfast was good too. Might be little noisy at night because you are right across from train station, perfect location though. We walked everywhere!

title: Would recommend
review: Apart from convenient location and free wifi, everything offered is very basic. The breakfast was poor -- tasteless coffee, concentrate juice and cold pastry.There was leakage in the bathroom.

title: Great value and friendly service
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great base for Florence
review: We stayed here for three nights during our trip to Florence, and although it may not look like much from the outside, the hotel was very pleasant. If you are looking for plush rooms with power shower this is not for you, but the rooms were spacious and perfectly adequate. Our only greviance was that the air conditioning did not seem to be working properly and we were very hot during the night. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and the free internet was a godsend considering our previous hotel had wanted to charge 10 euros per hour. The breakfast was fine, a bit basic. However given the number of great places to eat in Florence it was hardly our main meal of the day.

title: Friendly People, Great Service!
review: The hotel was located near the train station, which meant it was a great base for touring the Florence area - particularly easy to get to Pisa for instance.    The hotel room was quite small but kept very clean, and the staff were very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was basic, but there was a good range of food and drink available.  There are six computers available for internet access.  The air conditioning wasn't particularly effective in August however.  Florence was a bit of a disappointment (but maybe that's because we'd done Venice first) but we had some great meals out - head for Via Orsanmichele!  We had three nights in Florence, but two nights would have been enough (unless you wanted to queue for a day at the Uffizi of course).  Views from Piazzale Michelangiolo are…

title: Perfect Location - Excellent Service & Amenities for a Budget Hotel
review: During our stay in Florence(Firenze), Italy, my mom and I stayed at the Delle Nazioni. We were treated very very well by Sandro, Luisa, and Ronald and they are willing to help us with any question and problem we had! If you´are planning to staz in Florence, be sure to stay at the Hotel Delle Nazioni. Great Service, Friendly People! :)

title: Good Location with free wifi and internet lounge
review: Stayed 4 nights during a 2 week self-guided Italy trip. Hotel is located right around the corner from the central train station, and the SITA regional bus station (busses to Siena, San Gimigniano, etc.). Hotel has free internet lounge with 5 workstations. Very convenient for trip planning, bookings, etc. Also many good restaurants, food markets, and a laundromat in immediate area. Most rooms are connected to central AC, inadequate in the hot summer, so we asked and were transfered to the 4th floor, rooms with their own AC. There the AC rated 4 out of 5 snowflakes on Victor's snowflake scale (Victor is our travel partner, who rated all hotel rooms and museums by how effective the AC was in the sweltering mid-summer heat). Bed was comfortable. Shower was very tight but with good…

title: Modern hotel at a central location
review: This is a lovely hotel.  We booked online and requested the double superior with a view.  This is worth the extra money.  We had a balcony with a view of the duomo.  The kingsize bed was great and the room very clean. Bathroom had a tub. Breakfast was included. cereal, milk, juice, coffee, tea, lots of different breakfast pastries, meat, cheese, yogurt, toast and jams.  Front desk staff speaks English and the free internet is great.

title: Excellent value and very close to train station
review: Stayed for three nights at this hotel adjacent to the train station in Florence. Got lucky to get a room on the top (5:th) floor with a balcony and a perfect view of the dome and the belltower! - the only disadvantage with that is the lift that was sooooooo slow (and had a terrible signal when reaching desired floor...)  The room was very fresh, large and airy. Large bed, desk and cupboard with safety box. (Two record sleeves were framed above the bed, just like in the hallway and the brekfast room - quite originally and very nice!)  Tiled bathroom with bathtub and real linen towels!   The lobby area contains a bar and a couple of computers with free Internet.  Breakfast is pretty poor as far as we're concerned (we're Swedish) - no fresh fruits or vegetables what so ever, only…

title: Great Location, Great service,room could be quieter.
review: This hotel is in a great location - especially if you are comiing into Florence through the train station (SMN). It was 2 minutes walk from the station and very easy to find (on a main road). Also very easy walk into the centre of Florence and only a 5-10 minute walk to the Duomo and all of the attractions of Florence. Because of the price of this hotel we were not expecting much (we were in face expecting the worst - we picked it because of the price and location) but we were pleasantly surprised – the room was simple but spacious and clean (there was a little area between the bedroom and the bathroom to put our suitcase) and to our pleasant surprise we had a balcony with two chairs (we were on the 4th floor). The balcony overlooked the road and the train station but also…

title: Near Train Station-Good Location
review: Booked via expedia - was a little bit concerned since we are travelling with kids less than 12 years old.  We got an "Appartment". essentially 4 twin beds next to each other.  The hotel on the inside looks pretty reasonably "chic". The room was clean and functional. I really liked their front desk folks - very helpful in answering all our questions. Biggest draw is "Free Internet offcourse.  If they can somehow figure out how to insulate the windows better - this hotel would be a Total home run.

title: Free Internet and Good Location

title: Modern, great location, friendly staff and at a good price!
review: Nice place, decent room , spacious. Best thing was free wifi in the room which was very helpful . Also very good location as it's near the train station so travelling to other places in Tuscany was very convenient.   Breakfast was average though. Booking directly and for min 4 nights gives yo very good price.

title: Fantastic location and nice hotel
review: We stayed here for 4 nights at the start of our Italy tour. The hotel is located right next to the train station which was definitely a plus point when travelling with lots of luggage, although this makes it a short walk into the centre of town. We chose a room with a balcony which is well worth the extra cost to sit out after a meal in the evening - despite being next to the station the view was great over Florence.  The hotel was modern inside, spacious and clean. Our room matched this, it was massive along with the bed! Plenty of wardrobe space and a safe was included, although no fridge as a warning to anyone wanting to buy their own food/drink. The WiFi was fast and easy to set up, and seemed to connect everywhere in the hotel (there are free-use computers by reception…

title: Perfect hotel for weekend break with friendly helpful staff.
review: The most important thing about this hotel is the location. It's a) 2 minute's walk from Florence's Santa Maria Novella railway station and b) 5-10 minute's walk from the centre of Florence including the duomo, Uffizi, markets et al. Put simply, it's a perfectly placed and very good value Florentine hotel.  Our initial impressions of the hotel (location aside) were very good with friendly check-in staff and we were given plenty of handy information about the hotel and Florence. The room wasn't bad either being cool, roomy and clean. Our only gripes were that there was no view at all from the (shuttered) bedroom window apart from of an internal light-well and that the bathroom was a little shabby. The shower also employed some sort of odd, folding door, wet-room arrangement which…

title: Very Disappointed
review: We have just returned from a weekend break in Florence and would highly recommend the Hotel Delle Nazioni.  It is perfectly situated near the train and bus station and within walking distance of the city centre.  It is a clean spacious hotel with friendly staff who give a great service and are on hand with tips and advice on what to see and where to eat.  On departure I left a set of  keys in the hotel safe and, on returning to the UK, I contacted the hotel who were incredibly helpful, locating the keys and arranging for them to be sent to me so quickly that I received them within a couple of days, which was much appreciated.

title: Great Location, Expensive
review: Location is excellent, very close to SMN Train station. Close to most atrations. Walking distance.  The first room given to me was horrible, tiny, i think, it was 104. I asked for another room, with a better bathroom/shower; and we were given a 2 room. The second room was OK. I travelled with another group. They reserved an Apartment for 5 people. The apartment was OK.

title: Ecellent service and a BIG thanks to the reseptionist and Govanni!!
review: For a 3 star hotel, it is expensive. However, it is at the top end of the 3 stars, with newly renovated, contemporary rooms and marble bathrooms, excellent location next to the station, 10 minutes to the Center, great, attentive service. The only other negative is that breakfast is disappointing, with supermarket quality, processed items. The breakfast room itself gets very dirty, with spotty clean up service. Also, if you have any amount of luggage, keep in mind that, there are about 10 steps from the street level to the lobby with no ramp. This is very annoying.

title: Nice Hotel
review: My friend and I booked this htl well in advance in order to attend the Fitness Festival in May after being in Rimini a few days earlier. When we arrived to Florence it so appeared that the festival had already been held a week earlier! We arrived May 19th and the reseption guy was extremelly helpful -he even telephoned friends to find out more information about the festival (dates, location etc)! I asked if we could stay just the first night and cancel the rest ( 4 nights), as we had arrived for nothing practically. Of course he couldn´t make up the decision so he gave us the assisting manager´s name who would be working the next morning (Govanni).   The next morning I told Govanni about our mistake in dates and he was extremelly helpful in making sure we could cancel our other…

title: A decent place to stay for a few days
review: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights.  The room that we were originally given was towards the front of the hotel, and it was noisy due to construction.  That night, we discovered that the air conditioner didn't work, so it was quite comfortable.  The next morning my husband spoke with the hotel staff and not only did they change our room, they upgraded us to a suite.  After that there were no more issues.  I would definetly recommend this hotel.

title: good hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: I would stay here again.
review: this hotel was in a great location just across from the train station was within walking distance of most attractions as it is in city centre the hotel was much nicer than we were expecting for the price! the rooms were clean the bathroom was quite small and was a bit wary about the shower - but dont let that put you off staying at the hotel - its fine once ur in it!  overall the location was great and the rooms were clean at comfortable - worth the money. florence is a great city - would defintiley recommend this city for a european city break - can be expensive but is possible to do it on a budget!!

title: Good value hotel, would recommend paying that bit extra for superior room
review: The room is nice and spaceous, pleanty of room to store all my clothes, the location was perfect as it is a few steps away from the train station., and free interent was wonderful.  The only things I would cons about this hotel I would say would be:  1- The shower is a box a bit uncomfortable, and not a single shelf to put shampoo and soap on.  2-  I could here peoples conversations in there rooms. 3- The breakfast is good, but I wish they would change it every other day. For people like myself that was there 4 days it gets a little boring always eating the same thing.  I would stay here again if I went to florence again.

title: Clean, Safe, and huge rooms!
review: I would recommend this hotel for most travellers. We had a lovely stay and we are so had a room with a balcony which was totally totally worth it.  Stunning views over Florence and they are all yours. The staff are all friendly and helpful. The clientele is very varied as the hotel is used by touring parties of all ages, so it is likely to be busy, mainly because it really IS good value and a very convenient walking distance from the station (5 mins), Il Duomo (15 mins) the market (10 mins).  We had a good nights sleep, a lovely morning sun-bathing on the balcony and enjoyed a pretty good breakfast the next morning. Get down to breakfast at a reasonable time as they clear away promptish at 10! The only thing I would improve is the speed of the internet which was pretty slow but…

title: Love This Hotel
review: I was very lucky to book this hotel through expedia when they were having their European sale since I was able to get a great deal: stay 2 night get the 3rd free.  I was originally worried that the hotel was near the train station but for Florence everything is near the Train station so you are safe. The hotel is steps away from the train station and all the attractions. I recommend doing the hop on/hop off bus for at least one day (the red bus that you may take outside the train station)  The staff was very friendly and helpful. Always ready to answer our questions day and night.  The hotel was very safe and clean!!  FREE BREAKFAST in the morning and they were extremely generous and kept on refilling.  FREE INTERNET!!!  ROOM: The room was very large and clean. We had a main…

title: Free internet access was great!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Beware - more a youth hostel than a hotel!  Only the top floor rooms are adequate!
review: The staff here was very, very nice.  The room was clean but I would give our room 2 stars.  The bedspread needed to be tossed.  It has seen its days.  When you sat on the toilet your feet are in the shower.  I would stay here again, but not in the class of room we stayed in.  The hotel is right near the train station and close to many things.

title: great place from which to explore the city
review: For those who are considering staying here, please be aware that it seems that a lot of the positive reviews are from people who stayed in rooms on the top floors (these have balconies).  These are much nicer rooms than those on the lower floors and much quieter!  The rooms we stayed at to begin with were very basic and very noisy.  The hotel is right next to the station, so is certainly convenient for those arriving by train - turn right out of the station (when you are facing away from the tracks).  There is a lot of road works in front of the hotel - it looks like they are installing tram lines.  And yes, the roadworks were noisy in the mornings.  The first rooms we slept in were so very disappointing - being very small singles, with cramped bathrooms, tricky plumbing and the…

title: A pleasant surprise at a good price.
review: Right across and slightly up the street from the central train station, and so really near to everything I never had to use the city's public transit; don't worry about noise from the station as just closing the windows keeps it quiet. Guests get to use a free internet cafe in the hotel. The staff are nice, factoring in for the fact that Italians, like the French, aren't always the politest in the world. The rooms are quite big, at least mine was; the breakfast is nothing extravagant but ok; otherwise there are tons of cafes nearby and even a couple of supermarkets on the corner (though expect to be charged for shopping bags unless you've brought your own). I rather enjoyed my stay here and wouldn't hesitate about returning again.

title: Top Location,great value
review: Newly re-done with marble everywhere in subtle rich brown shades.  A balcony off the room (although view of train station) with chairs and table.  A luscious basket of fruit, Florence City Guide and bottles of water.  We received 4 free drinks at the bar, a nice quiet area near the computers with a view of the lobby.  The breakfast was delicious and included meat and cheese which we did not eat.  The help is amazing and surely ought to be paid a big bonus as they race around serving drinks, helping with the computer and carrying luggage and other tasks.  Best hotel of our trip by far.  It was convenient near the train station, easy to catch a bus from and the desk was always patient and ready to help.

title: Not one that I will ever return to
review: Friendly staff, Room was very clean, The hotel is located opposit the central station in the middle of Florence, It is a very good value for money hotel with free internet and a good breakfast buffet.

title: Great location, very, very noisy!!
review: I stayed here for two nights last weekend. I was first given a room with a balcony  (room 425) on the fourth floor. I didnt have high expactations of the hotel after seeing the photos on trip advisor before booking the hotel. But the hotel didnt even manage to meet my already low expactations. I booked the hotel throughflight centre and they rated it as a 3 star. I have stayed in a number of three and four star hotels but I would not say that this is one of them. The door leading to the balcony in 425 had a broken lock. All someone would need to do is give the door a gentle push to get access to the room. When I complained about this, I was told that all the rooms with balconies would have the same issue and I was given one without one. Here is my assessment of the hotel  Pros:…

title: Great location and value for money
review: Dear Tripadvisor user,  I regret to learn you did not have a satisfactory stay at the Delle Nazioni.  All your comments are currently under investigation but let me assure you our property is not the one described in your comment.  As per the majority of our comments we usually meet the expectactions of our guests. The Delle nazioni is not a luxury property but a comfort anc clean offer near the railway station.  The breakfast has been always considered more that adequate for our standard.  Anyway I accept all your comments and I will work hard to avoid any single complain in the hotel.  Best regards.  Giancarlo Carniani Managing director

title: Good value and conveniently located hotel
review: This hotel is in a great location in the city.  Only a 5 minute walk from the station.  Friendly staff, clean.  Having free access to the internet was great.  The breakfast was poor, wasn’t at all what I was expecting.  Not very much choice.  Croissants, toast, plain yoghurts, poor choice of cereal, and the ham and cheese was not refrigerated so was warm…yuk…   We were told that the construction on the tram outside was opening 1st March…maybe 1st March 2010, hence was extremely noisy and from very early in the morning.  Our roomed seemed to be situated next to the entire hotels pipes.  So every time anyone flushed the toilet our room vibrated.  If I had been staying more than a few days I would of asked to be moved, but it was too much hassle as we were hardly ever in the room. …

title: Good Hotel; Bad Location during Construction
review: Excellent choice for florence,  right across the street from main train station and close walk to all attractions.  Hotel staff was excellent,rooms were large and extremely clean. I have no negatives to say about my stay.   Seay   Dalton, Ga

title: Pictures great! Room is so-so
review: This is a nice hotel in what would normally be a good location in that it is close to the train station. Unfortunately there is some heavy duty construction going on outside the hotel which begins early in the morning and continues all day.  We were told that they are installing a "tram" to provide public transit to the train station. From the looks of the construction this could be a long term project. We enjoyed the hotel, the free internet access and the breakfast which I thought was better than some reviews have suggested. We were not happy about being awakened at 6:15 by construction sounds directly outside the hotel.  We enjoyed the hotel. Our room was large (by European standards) and well maintained. Other than the noise and construction outside the front door it was a…

title: OK Hotel
review: Dear Tripadvisor reviewers,  The construction going on in front of the hotel will be over in just a few days (on February 9th the road will be reopened). Unfortunately works have been heavy in the last week of january exactly because everything should be ready very soon. On March 1st there will be the opening of the new tram service which will bring a modern, fast and silent service connecting the centre of the city to the suburbs. This work will serve all new lines connecting also to the airport soon. I thank you for the nice words against our hotel and, as General Manager, I can assure there will be no more sounds. I have to say works starts at 8.00 in the morning and not at 6.30 and also our reception desk will be able to provide inside rooms (we dispose of a large number)) for all those clients which the may encountered problems in these last few days of the construction. I will post a picture on Tripadvisor next week in order to show the status of work which are really nearly to the end.  We are trying to build a new city, with less traffic and less cars...you will enjoy it.  Best regards.  Giancarlo Carniani Managing Director Hotel delle Nazioni - Firenze

title: Geat staff and rooms
review: The best thing about this hotel is how it pictures!    Here is the good and the bad.  The good: The breakfast was great.  Good hot eggs and decent selection to get you through 2-3 days.  We stayed there 3 days and I never had a complaint about the food.  i wish they had better coffee, but at least there was hot stuff!  The internet was nice.  It was free with the room so I was happy to catch up, check email, and plan out a few things without being charged by the minute.  The Staff was super nice.  The woman at the front desk was EXTREMELY helpful and courteous.  She was very smiley and patiently asked all of our questions.  Thank goodness for her!  THe rest of the staff was great too, never had a complaint.  Everyone was pretty nice.  The bad: The room wasn't all that great. …

title: Convenient comfortable and clean
review: Stayed three nights in November.  The hotel is conveniently placed out of the very centre of the city next to the main rail and bus station.  Walking to the Uffizzi takes about 20 minutes not hurrying. You are 5 minutes from Il Duome etc.  Room was a bit tired and some of the fittings were coming off the wall but we had a balcony on the 4th floor which would have been nice if they were not digging up the whole road for the new tramway!  Staff were welcoming and English speaking.  There is free internet on a half dozen machines and a hot spot in the lobby.  Breakfast is included. This is just as well as I certainly would not pay for it!  There are a couple of drinks machines that produce the worst coffee I have ever tried to drink and horrible not fresh fruit juice.  There are…

title: Pretty decent, maybe overpriced
review: Just across the road from the train station, 5-10 minutes walk from the Duomo, and just round the corner from the bus station.  Very convenient if you are on the Terravision bus.  Lots of work going on outside laying tram lines, but the hotel is well insulated and the work only goes on in the daytime.  Rooms are clean and comfortable; clean white sheets and towels every day.  Great choice for breakfast.  Only bad point was no shower screen which meant water splashed everywhere and caused some mould on bathroom wall.  Free use of internet in reception area a bonus.  Would book again.

title: Excellent location
review: This was a decent hotel, and we were very grateful for their free internet and 5 pcs to choose from since I had forgotten to pack my recharger. The breakfast was also quite good, well cooked scrambled eggs and an okay selection of other things. During our stay, there was a ton of construction going on at their front facing street, wish I had known sooner. The bathroom left much to be desired, simple things like an effective shower door and towel racks or hooks. Would I stay there again? Maybe, but I'd definitely look around first.

title: magnifico panorama!
review: It is right across the road from Santa Novelli train station & withing 10 minutes walk to all the major attractions. We had a 1st floor room which was VERY clean & very large. The only downside was that the street noise was very audible from  the room which was very noisy. The staff were ok, but not very welcoming. They have six interent terminals for free use, which is an added bonus. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

title: Great location-ok room
review: We booked this through Expedia at a rate of $125 per night including all taxes and fees. I monitored rooms in Florence for about a month, and this was a VERY cheap rate. The rate I bought said "upgraded" room, which I was skeptical about but figured couldn't lose at that rate.  GOOD - VERY close to the train station. Basically, just exit out the right side, take a right turn, and it is less than a 2-3 minute walk away. The top rooms overlook the train station. Nice thing is it is far enough away you don't get any loiters in the area, the noise level was very quiet in the room, and there are lots of grocery stores nearby for cheap snacks/ drinks. - 5 minute walk to all main tourist attractions. - Friendly staff that spoke excellent English. - We actually did get that "upgraded"…

title: Great Service-Big room
review: We booked this hotel as part of a "build your own" trip through Gate 1 travel. This hotel had a fantastic location-VERY close to the main bus station and easy to walk to. We arrived early and our room was not ready, so they locked up our luggage in a storage room so it would be safe while we went sightseeing. The room is OK. Very spacious, very Ikea furnished, very NOT cozy. Plain walls, plain furniture, small TV. This was fine for us, since we werent there to hang out in the room. However we had the shower. It was about 2 by 2 feet and had this weird folding accordion plastic door type of thing which when opened swished water all over the bathroom floor. For the one night we were there, we dealt with it. They have free internet in their internet lounge and I believe free wi-fi…

title: Very good for the price
review: I stayed in the hotel for 3 nights, the room was big, very comfortable, clean and we had a computer in our room, which we found very useful to plan the rest of our trip!  The people at the reception were very kind and helpful, we felt very pleased to have chosen this hotel.

title: Fabulous Location
review: Hotel was easy to find and right beside the train station. We were able to book in earlier than the minimum check in time. Room was a good size. The A/C worked but we were unable to open the window blinds so we couldnt see the view. Bathroom was clean but we were unable to close the shower door so the bathroom partically flooded each time we used the shower. The free inernet cafe was a bonus. The staff were very friendly and helped us with everything we asked.

title: Great Experience
review: we stayed at the Delle Nazioni hotel for 3 nights to celebrate our 29 th wedding anniversary  it was very clean and newly refurbished the staff wer very helpful. the breakfast was ok and there was a outdoor terrace for smokers. we went to Pisa on the train £8 return only one hour away it was the hilight of the trip seeing and going up the leaning tower of Pisa. In Florence there is a great chinese restaraunt near the dome and a square with live music all within walking distance.

title: Fantastic Hotel, Fractional Price!
review: Florence was the second leg of our two week honeymoon, and we stayed for two nights at this hotel.    The staff was very helpful and friendly when we checked in, and we were given a room on the top floor (fifth for Europeans, sixth for Americans).  We had a porch and the view was great.  You can see it in the pictures already posted, but to our left were the mountains (don't look down because all you see is the train station).  To our right was il Duomo and downtown Florence.  The porch had a great breeze and we spent part of both nights on the porch relaxing.  The hotel decor is very bare, with hardwood floors and very little decoration in the rooms.  That was not a negative for us.  My wife, a light sleeper, fell in love with the foam mattress and slept wonderfully, but…

title: Perfect
review: Fantastic, Central hotel for the price that we paid. 3 star facilities for the price of a 1 star hotel! The best hotel we stayed in on our 7 week trip across europe!  Pros: ------- - Central location, spitting distance to train station  - Awesome clean spacious room with colour tv, balcony, airconditioning and massive double bed.  - Massive bathroom with bidet!  - Excellent full hot buffet breakfast  - FREE internet on computer terminals in lobby that actually worked!  - Whisper quiet room (mostly - when the local council is not  ripping up the road right outside your room!!!)  - Friendly, helpful reception and staff  Cons: -------- - Leaky airconditioning system....drip...drip....drip...  - flimsy shower "curtain"  - Mold on walls (small patch near aircon unit)

title: Excellent hotel with fabulous location.
review: Before I go away I always check the Tripadvisr reviews so as always I did before going on a romantic get-away a couple of weeks ago.  This hotel deserves to be 4 star - it was clean, modern and the staff (especially the lady on reception in the evenings) were fantastic!  The hotel is PERFECTLY located for Florence sight-seeing, eating and general soaking up the atmosphere.   Our flight home wasn't until 7pm at night so having checked out at 12 noon we were able to leave our bags in a locked room then after walking all day we picked them up and literally walked across the road to the train station! Perfect.  Couple of tips for travellers new to Florence:  1 - As you walk OUT of the hotel turn right, everything is right, on our first night we went left, walked for ages and found…

title: Bad Hotel
review: Husband and I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights - 21st to 26th June.  First allocated a standard triple room on 4th floor.  This was clean, spacious, had a balcony and fantastic views of the Duomo and city over the rooftops.  Downside was that the aircon was non-existent and after sleeping overnight in 29 degree room heat we asked to change rooms.  Reception immediately offered us another room which was much smaller but had effective air con.  Room two was a standard double on the 1st floor.  A clean, light room that looked a bit tired.  Ensuite was small but adequate.  The soft  furnishings had obviously been updated recently but bizarrely none of the paintwork throughout (walls/ceilings) had been freshened up to cover marks/stains.  Big downside was the lack of fridge/mini-bar.…

title: Fantastic views!!!
review: Dear Tripadvisor reviewer,  We thank you for your kind review which had our best attention. As you may learn from other reviews we encoutered a problem which caused a big damage on air conditioned system on the 4th and 5th floor of the hotel and we apologize for that.  All your comments are very interesting and we wish to clarify a few fact, which may help other guests in judging the hotel.  - The fact we do not have minibars is a choice. On the 1st, 3rd and 5th floore there are distribution machines for beverages and snacks. In a three star hotel is not compulsory to have minibars, and we trust a distribution machine is better for clients (which then will not have to pay ridicolous fees for beverages from the minibar). - It's the first complain we get about it and the rest of our clientele just love it. - Regarding Milk temperature I have to point out that we have three bottles of milk on the buffet, two colds and one at normal temperature. It has happend in the past a few clients were asking for milk at normal temperature, especially for the children. - We will anyway accept your suggestion and have a sign to indicate the temperature in the different bottles. - Finally fresh fruit. The standards for a three star hotel (a budget property like we are) do not include fruit. Our breakfast is considered much above expectactions from the majoirity of our guests. For instance you will not find many three stars in Italy offering eggs. Anyway, in order to cover the problem and considering that people would rather prefer a fruit instead of a croissant in very hot periods, the management has decided to include apples and peaches for the period June/July/August.  It's our believe to accept clients suggestion if we can do better for our guests.  Best regards.  Giancarlo Carniani Managing Director

title: Great stay for the money!
review: Bad hotel,, horrible! We arrived last friday (june the 20th), and Florence was boiling for the weather, very hot and humid. In our room the air  conditioned didn't work, was broken, we didn't sleep. the day after someone repaired the apparatus but the air was not cool.  We paied 450,00 € for 4 night to have a room in a kind of basement flat and not so clean. Breakfast was not  so good with sub-bran product. We calculate that we can go in a 4 star hotel (ex Ambasciatori next to ours) at the same price. The advantages: internet free and the closeness to the central station. I want to suggest a tipical Tuscan restaurant, very good also for the price Ristorante Fagioli - 50122 Firenze (FI) - 47/R, CORSO DEI TINTORI - tel: + 39 055 244285. Closure: August, Saturday and Sunday.

title: Good Internet Hotel
review: Dear Triapadvisor reviewer,  We are sorry to learn your stay at the Delle Nazioni was not as expected.  It is true, because we already tell the truth to our reviewers, we encoutered some problems in a few rooms last week due to a air conditioned broke pipe, but we also understand our staff did change your room immediately.  Anyway we are sorry to learn you were not satisfied also with the second room and we have to point out our hotel has no room in the basement and all rooms are from 1st floor to 5th floor.  Also regarding breakfast we would like to point out all our good come fresh in the morning and we are deeply sorry to learn you did not enjoy our breakfast which is considered far above average for a three stars from the majority of our clients.  We then do not agree with tour advice to stay at our competitor next door. If you read all reviews you will see that hotel as a position on Tripadvisor which is far below ours.  Probably the whole of your stay has been influenced by the problem encoutered with the air conditioning which had our total attention.  We apologize if your stay has not been satisfactory but we do not agree with your 'Bad hotel' reputation against our property.  Best regards.  Giancarlo Carniani Managing Director Hotel Delle Nazioni - Firenze

title: Decent hotel
review: I had previously stayed in a single room last October at this hotel and was comfortable - rating the room at reasonable for the price.  I took my wife with me on my next trip and booked a double room at budget rates. When arriving at the Hotel Delle Nazioni we were surprised to be given an upgraded double room with complimentary drinks, balcony view, fresh fruit, welcome pack, etc. The room was excellent and surpassed all our expectations, making our short 4-day visit to Florence one not to be forgotten. I wished we had booked a longer stay as we both enjoyed the place so very much. The room service, the desk staff and restaurant staff were all as pleasant and as helpful as I have found anywhere.  The free internet service was also very helpful, allowing me to communicate,…

title: great hotel recommended
review: The main advantage of this hotel is its superb location, the hotel is within the walking distance from the Florence center. Everything else was pretty disappointing, starting with the fact that they do not have parking for the car so I had to pay EUR 3 per hour in the nearby public garage, the rooms (and especially bathrooms) were dirty, hotel personnel was not kind or helpful and the breakfast was not very good either. But considering the low price and good location this hotel would be a good choice for travelers who do not seek for great comfort and for those who are using hotel room only to sleep and spend most of the day walking around in Florence.

title: just the right spot
review: Dear Tripadvisor user,  Thank you for your kind review which has my best attention. We are very sorry to learn your stay has been not satisfactory. Regarding the car space we so not advertise in any site parking facilities for our property. We do have a garege service underneath the hotel which is not own by our management and the rates you will find in the garege are those of all establishment in Florence. Rates are determined by Florence local governement and we do not have any permission to modify the charges. With reference to your room I am very sorry the conditions were not satisfied. I am currently investigating in it in order to avoid any further problems which are not usual for our property as you may notice from the majority of our reviews.  Best regards. Giancarlo Carniani Managing Director Hotel Delle Nazioni

title: A fabulous base for seeing all that Tuscany has to offer
review: Just returned from a 5 day stay in Florence and couldn't have asked for a better hotel. 5 mins from train station, friendly staff,good sized room,fresh towels three times a day and even better we had a room with a balcony with superb views over Florence.Bathroom was also good size with shower and bath. Breakfast although nothing special was more than adequate. Although our room was on the main street you couldn't here any noise from the street below. Free internet access is also available to guests All the main sites were well within walking distance I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great hotel at a reasonable costs. Thanks to all the staff for a wonderful stay.  Mille grazie

title: Very Happy with stay
review: This hotel has been recently refurbished and is clean and comfortable. It's a 5 min walk to the train/bus station and about 15-20 mins to the Duomo. There is a small supermarket across the road and some restaurants virtually next door. My room was by the main road so it was fairly noisy and we struggled with getting the air con to work. The only other downside was there was different groups of school kids staying throughout our stay. Unfortunately, some were extremely noisy at night. Breakfast was basic but tasty and it was nice to get scrambled egg instead of just the usual cold continental breakfast.

title: A pleasant stay
review: Dear Tripadvisor user,  I wish to thank you for the good words against our hotel and we are happy you had a nice stay in Florence.  It is true during march/april our hotel sometimes offer availability to school groups and our staff is always very careful about those groups.  We are sorry to hear they are sometimes noisy and we will be most careful about that in the future.  We look forward to have you back in Florence,  Yours sincerely,  Giancarlo Carniani General Manager Hotel Delle Nazioni

title: Perfect location
review: Hotel was clean and comfortable.  It had a great location near the train station and tourist sites in Florence.  We stayed on the top floor and had our own balcony overlooking the train station.  From there we could see the hills and beautiful countryside around Florence.  Staff was courteous and breakfast is similar to most you get at hotels in Italy.   Only downside was spotty internet access.  Some days it was very fast, others somewhat  slow.  It was a nice touch to have free internet though so I won't complain too much.

title: A great place and extemely helpful and friendly staff
review: A very pleasant stay in a great location, we stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in a double room.  The room was very basic but comfortable with everything you need for a short stay (after all you only sleep in the room - bed was comfortable)  Hotel is right next to the train station and a pleasant walk to all of the major attractions.  We flew into Pisa and got the bus from Pisa to Florence which stopped outside of train station then going back to Pisa we jumped on the train.  Florence is lovely and we would defintatly go back and even consider staying in this hotel.  Hotel staff very friendly and the breakfast had a good selection and there was free internet access.

title: You Get What You Pay For
review: We booked this hotel purely because it was located handy for the town centre.  What a pleasant surprise to stay in such a warm, welcoming, well run establishment.  It is located on the block next to the one where the bus station is. This is where you get off the bus from the airport. In fact, you pass the hotel on your way in from the airport...  We we apparently chosen for a "free upgrade". This may have been a bit bogus, but was welcome all the same. The room was spotless, with cable TV, a kitchenette, a table and 4 chairs as well as a couch that probably folded into a bed.  The staff were most helpful, friendly and accomodating. The self-serve buffet style breakfast was perfectly adequate. It was scary to watch the american teenage visitors playing "how much can you cram on…

title: pleasant staff, super location
review: We stayed for 5 nights 18th/23rd Feb 2008/Room 411  Rooms are tired but very clean, staff very welcoming, especially front of house. Giovanni Mariella and front of house team first class, nothing was an issue. Well Done.  Well placed for access to all tourist sites, amenities and the excellent transport serices available at your hotel door step. At £60 POUNDS PER NIGHT its good value including a continental style buffet. When you consider charges levied by some hotels in the area its ideal for tourists, as you should be out most of the day enjoying all that Florence has to offer.  They are currently digging up this area of Florence to site Trams but do not let this put you off. We would go back.  A & I Smith, Ayrshire, Scotland

title: Friendly Staff and Good Position
review: Across the street from the rail station, around the corner from the bus depot, easy walking distance to main sites, and extremely pleasant and helpful staff.  We would stay here again.

title: Good for the price
review: It was out of season when we stayed at the Delle Nazioni but the cool weather was truly offset by the warmth of the staff.  Nothing appeared too much trouble.  The hotel is situated near to the main rail station which is very convenient as we had flown to Pisa and then journeyed to Florence by train.(a very simple exercise) All the main  tourist sites are within reasonable walking distance from the hotel.  The hotel is clean and comfortable and provides free internet access.  Breakfast was buffet style and perfectly adequate and catered for all tastes.  Our room was clean and the bathroom spotless.  We slept soundly  on a very comfortable bed.  The reception was efficient and the staff extremely helpful. We had no problem with language as all the staff we encountered spoke…

title: Pretty decent stay at the "Hotel delle Nazioni". Would go back!

title: Experience was worthwhile!
review: My husband and I stayed a couple of nights at this hotel during a visit to Florence in January 2008. The hotel is in a great location for travellers as it is only a few minutes walk from the central train station and bus station and is within walking distance of all the city attractions.  The hotel was lovely and clean and the photographs on it's website are a good reflection of how it actually is. We booked a basic double room and were very pleased with the size, space and presentation of the room which had a large double bed and a cozy and spacious shower room which was extremely clean, too.  There we had also lots of choice on TV, internet access and very attentive service at both the front desk and in the rooms,  The reception staff were bright and friendly and they helped…

title: Great stay!
review: A group of friends and I stayed at the hotel for a week.  Not only is Florence beautiful, but our hotel experience was awesome as well.  We saved money on transportation because it was right near the train station and in walking distance from the major sites to see.  The hotel staff was friendly; I got to pratice my Italian and they their English.  It was a nice exchange.  The rooms were clean and the service was above average.  If you're looking for a no headache vacation in Florence, try this hotel!

title: Fab Florence
review: We stopped for 3 nights at the Delle Nazioni Hotel in Florence and let me tell you that I had  great weekend there.  The location of the hotel is just perfect: close to the train station and at the same time close to all the sites that I wanted to visit. Our room (215) was clean, breakfast was excellent and the staff very friendly and helpful, they actually spoke very good English! We could spend the evenings in a most pleasant way at the bar or in the lounge of the hotel where we met nice interesting people from all over the world. I really enjoyed my stay there and I will come back with my family and friends. I think it is a great hotel and I  recommend it to anyone!

title: no smoking at delle nazioni
review: We arrived here on the 21st January for a short stay (5days 4 nights)  When we booked our rooms on line through ryanair we were very lucky to get 4night for the price of 3. The hotel is central to everywhere you could possible want to go to in Florence. For example the Train station is opposite we went to Pisa for the day and this only cost 10.50 euro return (well  worth it). The Dumo is just 10 min walk away and the rest of the sights are within 30 min walking time. It is well worth the walk as you see lots of sights. The hotel was very clean and the staff make you very welcome. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff you only have to ask. The maid comes in twice a day and turns your bed down, she also leaves a chocolate for your pleasure.  Breakfast is included in the price…

title: Terrific location and value!
