title: I have to do this
review: I was pleasantly surprised recently at my stay at this hotel. I arrived Dec.1 for 3 nights. I was in a quiet room on the 4th flr. , #410. The hotel is conveniently located a few steps from the train station and close to all the major attractions and shopping. This hotel is priced well. The buffet breakfast is terrific. The breakfast room is bright and cheerful  and the hotel is pleasantly decorated. I found the staff to be wonderful. Helpful with directions and accurate in answering all my questions. It was a great experience and  I look forward to returning soon.

title: Great find in a great city
review: I stayed for 3 nights in November, 2007.  I really wanted to like this place.  In fact, I did.  That is what makes this review difficult but I feel that I must be accurate to let fellow travelers know about my experience.    What I liked:  Within a block of the Florence train station so very convenient.  Has two elevators.  Has wireless internet in the rooms (although I couldn't get it to work on my laptop for some reason).  Also has 5 computers in the lobby area which are available for guests free of charge.  Has a wonderful hot and cold breakfast in the mornings.   I had a single room (twin bed) and it was small but still had sufficient room.  Bathroom was average size. Had 3 English tv stations if that matters to you.  Within walking distance of all the sites.  In fact, rooms…

title: Would stay here again
review: Dear TripAdvisor reviewer,  We have already been in contact directly and we have take serious steps in order to solve a problem which was really unexpected.  I thank you for the good words towards our services and as I did mention in my email I deeply apologize for what had happened.  Our hotel take maximum care about this problem you experienced.  The room you occupied  and all nearby rooms had been fumigate and re-opened only after a few days. Beds and mattresses have been destroyed and replaced by new ones.  I wish anyway explain what bed bugs are to whom may read this review and remain intimidate by it's contain.  Bed bugs was something forgotten in italy since the years after the war, but in the last few years, mainly travelling with luggages and coming form Asia have reappeared in Europe.  Please do understand it has nothing to do with dirty room or cleaniless of our property, which I do understand you appreciate.  By the way in order to avoid future problems, together with the fumigation programme we have also planned to change all carpets in the room before the end of the winter.  All management and staff are working hard to avoid future problems and wish to reassicurate all our possible guest that we will have made any efforts to avoid this kind of problems during future stays.  Best regards.  Giancarlo Carniani General Manager Hotel delle Nazioni - Firenze  We do a compleate disinfestation

title: Modern and clean
review: This is a great budget hotel, a 2 min walk from the main train station F.S.M.N.  When you come off the train, exit the station at the right hand exit.  If you walk down a few steps and look to your right you will see the hotel signs.  We had a triple room which  had 4 beds and a table and chairs.  The bathroom only had a shower, which was fine for us and the room and bathroom were cleaned every day.  The hotel is on a main road, so if noise bothers you, ask for a room at the back of the hotel or take ear plugs.  The breakfast selection was limited to cereals, toast, ham, cheese, scrambled eggs and pastries but all very tasty.  All of the major attractions are within walking distance from the hotel.  They will give you a great map when you check in.  The hotel recommended a great…

title: great hotel

title: Fair
review: This hotel was just perfect for our one night stay in Florence.  Right next to the train station, which is super convenient.  We were able to even make a quick trip to Pisa after we checked in since we were so close to the station.  Only 10-20 minutes walk to the Duomo and museums too, so we were able to see everything we wanted and more in just 1.5 days (including Pisa).   Free internet use, with 5 computers provided.  We loved this as we could contact our family easily!  Excellent breakfast in the morning, with hot and cold items.  Friendly staff, who spoke excellent English.  Our room was big (I think it was one of the "family" rooms) and the bathroom was nice too - but only a shower, no bath (not a big deal, but just made it a little harder to bathe our baby).  Quiet too. …

title: Room needed a makeover
review: We stayed at Hotel Delle Nazioni as part of our honeymoon.  We left with a sensation that we could have found a better place for a little more money.  We arrived via the Eurostar and were able to find the hotel easily as it is just west of the train station.  Check-in was fairly straight-forward although you had to carry your own bags up the initial staircase before getting into the small elevators.  Getting to our room (#404), we had to navigate thru some very small hallways.  The room itself is quite "snug" but livable.  The queen-size bed took up much of the room.  The room was a bit dark and "aged" like the hallways...a contrast from the hotel lobby.  The AC Unit was quite powerful and unlike some people's prior experience where the hotel shut it off at night, we did not…

title: A solid 3* Hotel -very good value!
review: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in August 2007 and to be honest I was a little disappointed with our room. The bathroom was small and dark and was out dated. The bathroom definately needed to be renovated. The shower screen was useless and meant that the bathroom flooded when you had a shower. There was no refridgerator in the room. The room was in need of a new bedspread and a paint job. The good points for the hotel were that there was free internet access in the lobby at all times which was great. The breakfast room was large and bright and clean. The breakfast food was nice and fresh with both hot and cold options. I would not stay in this hotel again until the rooms were freshened up.

title: Great value and location!
review: Initially we had booked a double room for the 3 of us via Expedia, but after reading the reviews here we decided to "upgrade" to a triple room and so glad we did! It was very spacious indeed.  The hotel is in a good location, just opposite to the train station. The vicinity has a post office and a hypermarket by the station and on the road leading to the hotel there are a couple of restaurants and bars, some of which sell fresh ice cream. We loved the "Il Portale" restaurant just half a min walk from the hotel, which has some amazing food.  Watch out for the big portions though!  The room itself was clean and had working air con (although it wasnt too powerful), with a television featuring some 20 channels including Sky News and CNN. The furniture was new which shows that the…

title: Outstanding Value
review: This hotel was in a great location especially if you needed the train station. Everything within Florence that we wanted to see, was in walking distance of the hotel. The staff were always friendly during our stay. The breakfast was well worth having. If you do have the breakfast, try and sit outside on the terrace for more of an italian feeling to the morning.  The room was basic (as we expected for the price) but clean. The carpet was stained however we were never really in the room other than to sleep, so this did not bother us one bit.  The air conditioning was there all the time if we needed it, which was fab, as otherwise it might have been a tad warm.  The area where the hotel is located is ok, but there was nothing really to see around it, so walking was always needed.…

title: great location,average hotel
review: Pros  Location was absolutely excellent. Easy access to all areas.   Price was hard to beat US$80.00 per night through Hotels.com  Breakfast was excellent  Staff was courteous and helpful  Internet free for use  Room was clean   Cons  Air conditioning was at times non-existant  Sewer smell present in room at parts of day.

title: Only one issue, but a big one
review: The hotel is sutuated in a perfect locaation, just across the street in the central train station. The area generally safe but during night time one must be carefoul, thats why the hotel door is closed and to enter you must ring the bell. The hotel personell is very polite and ready to respond to every question. They help us to arrange a fantastic restaurant for dinner in Fiesole. But i must say that one night they let us wait about 15 minutes because they had only 1 person on duty and it was busy.... Breakfast is normal. The rooms are clean , with central a/c wich is functioning only after 15/06 so if you go in Florence in a hot May as whe did you are in trouble. In general is a good hotel but for short - buisness trips

title: Delle Nazioni not great
review: I agree with previous reviews that the breakfast was wonderful (lots of selections, very nice eating area, etc.)  Also, the hotel is VERY convenient, particularly for day trips.  Really, we only had one problem, but it was a BIG problem.  We had a room at the end of a hall.  In the middle of the night, we would wake up in unbearable heat.  Now, I use a blanket in the summer because I am always cold, so if I say that it was hot, I mean Tuscany hot.  Our window opened out onto a flat roof, so if we opened our window someone could just walk into our room.  We didn't care.  We would turn out all of our lights and open the window.  We said something to the people at the front desk about being hot, but they just smiled at us.  After this went on for a few nights, we went to the front…

title: Friendly staff, clean hotel
review: First the good.  It's only 500 feet from the train station.  Nice lobby, nice breakfast room and decent selection of foods for the same.  And that's where it ends.  We had three rooms in this hotel for our large family.  All smelled musty and moldy.  The Air conditioning could not cool the rooms nor get the dampness out of the air.  The carpets in all rooms were FILTHY.  You actually blackened the soles of your feet walking barefoot on them.  The bed covers were pilled, coming apart at the seems and sticky to the touch.  The walls clearly have not been painted in years.  There were rat holes (yes, rat holes) in the bathroom tile.  While we did not see the vermin, the souvenirs they left behind were evidence enough.  The beds do not have abox spring, but rather wooden slats that…

title: Good Hotel Close to the Train Station
review: My sister and I stayed here in March for 3 nights.  Upon arrival the room was not ready yet, but the staff was very helpful and gave us a place to store our luggage and a map of Florence so that we could explore while we waited for our room.  Once we checked in, we were very happy with the room.  It was clean and spacious.  A bonus was the internet access that the hotel had.  And the breakfast was more than sufficient.  Being close to the train station made travel easy, and even though you aren't in the middle of everything, you are only a five minute walk to most of the sites.  Would definitely stay here again!

title: Great City Hotel
review: This was a nice hotel with comfortable rooms.  It’s great for accessing the Internet because they have an Internet café right there.  The room is just ok and has the basics.  All of the staff were really nice to us.  The location is ok if you want to stay near the train station so that you can jump on buses and get around the city with ease.  The breakfast was also very basic.  Overall it’s a good place to stay if you are just looking for a quiet stay without a lot of extras.

title: Better than a North American Holiday Inn
review: Just returned from a tour of Italy and stayed 1 night at the Delle Nazione in Florence, I was apprehensive before arriving as with most cities its a minefield trying to find a decent hotel without paying the earth, I wanted something fairly nice as we were in Florence just for 1 night for my husbands 40th Birthday. I did email the hotel beforehand to request a nice room and I was plesantly suprised by the hotel, it was contemporary, clean, great location directly opposite the train and main bus station and great location for walking to all the main sights. The staff were all really nice and hospitable and recommended us to a great local restaurant for a fantastic meal in the evening. We were lucky to get a suite with a balcony which was a huge room, the bathroom was a little…

title: Great staff and location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Just one problem
review: A great location, stwo nightfriendly staff, clean rooms. Had a great stay perfectly close to the station.

title: Good breakfast, noisy & dirty room
review: We stayed here 7th - 10th May and were very happy with our choice of Hotel. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We were given, when checking in, an invaluable map of Florence and list of all the Museum opening times and costs and the staff were more than happy to book any visits for us. The room was basic but more than adequate and the housekeeping was very good. Towels and bed linen were spotless. Breakfast was excellent with a huge choice available. The location was excellent being so near the station. Alll of the sights were easy to get to on foot. The only thing we had a problem with was  our mis-handled luggage that was couriered to the hotel from the airport, although delivered to the hotel at about 10PM was not put in our room until after 10AM the following day…

title: Love this hotel!
review: The hotel has a friendly staff and good breakfasts, but the room we were assigned, #314, was horrible.  I've never slept so poorly in a hotel due to the noise from the train station across the street.  When we had checked in we had asked for a room on the 4th floor, but were told that those were "superior" rooms and that #314 would be fine.  I complained the next morning and were eventually changed to a room on the second floor away from the noise of the street and the train station.  Both rooms had very dirty, old covers on the bed, walls with holes in the bathroom and water stains on the ceilings, and when my sock fell behind the nightstand it was covered with dust and dirt.  Both rooms also had problems with mosquitoes biting all night. The second room, away from the street,…

title: Couldn't find a better location
review: My favourite budget hotel in Europe by far--would stay here again!  About $140 CAD/nite.  This hotel not only offers free internet (a little internet cafe), but they had the best free continental breakfast (great coffee/cappucinno/hot chocolate machine), and is only half a block away from the Central Train Station.  Florence is a must see and this is the way to do it. Never needed to take a single bus--it's a walker's paradise.  Beautiful and romantic!!  Lots of places to eat from this simple pasta place to pricier restaurants.  HUGE open flea market in town centre--worth walking through for the great deals.

title: Close to the station
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Good experience
review: The hotel is VERY close to the central station (across the road in fact). There is free internet access, rooms are comfortable. Bathroom is slightly wethered! Lovely walk to Duomo and Florence is a great base city for travel to SIena, Pisa and Bologna. Close to a few restaurants and there is a laundromat around the corner!

title: Great location, ok room
review: The hotel is very near the train station which was very important to us in coming and going.  Everything was very neat and in good shape. I especially liked the free computers connected to the internet. The desk staff was helpful, especially Giovanni. The breakfast area was clean, large and kept well stocked.

title: Loved Delle Nazioni Hotel
review: stayed here for two nights, was generally quite happy with what I got. the location is what sells this hotel, literally 50m from the train and bus/coach station, which was good as were were doing a lot of train travelling. The room was fairly standard, in the information we recieved from the website we booked through, it said that while some of the bathrooms had been renovated, some hadn't, and unfortunately we had one which hadn't been.  the lights in there were a bit dim, the shower screen was a little flimsy - it had a kind of youth hostel feel to it, but it was clean and provided everything we needed from it - although if you are expecting a luxurious bath it might not be for you, although i can't speak for the upgraded bathrooms. The toilet flush had a knack to it before it…

title: read review
review: Stayed 3 nights, found the location to be excellent, right around the corner from the bus station and accross the street from the train station and an easy walk to all the sights Florence has to offer.  The desk staff was very helpful in suggestiong dinner reservations and an English Speaking movie theatre.  The morning breakfast is simple and delightful and in the evening you can enjoy a cocktail at the hotel'slounge.  The hotel's decor is modern,crisp and clean. The hotel offers up to date technologies including wireless access and a free internet lounge.  The friendly housekeeping staff did a wonderful job keeping the room spotlessly cleaned.  I found everything to be in working order.  Overall a great value when travelling to Florence.

title: Overall good hotel
review: Ask for room 428 or 4th floor overlooking Florence...unrestricted views ...and the sun streams into the room after 1.30pm!  We stayed  6 nights, the staff were always patient, friendly and helpful and gave correct instructions for trains/buses to attractions.  The cold breakfast and drinks were plentiful and + there was hot scrambled eggs!  Internet was available on 2 screens + Wi-Fi.  The hotel was clean & tidy & well run. Its central location to trains and Bus station is excellent but brings with it, a lot of hangers on arround the station and a reluctantance, on our part to stay out late at night. Excelent supermarket diagonally opposite the hotel near the station for small food items & a Tobaco shop for  bus tickets etc.20 yds from the hotel.   Finally a zebra crossing is…

title: Great location
review: The hotel is located extremely close to the train station which was very convenient for us, and is very accessible to all other major sites in the city. The room was adequate, howevery we did not like the bathroom door which was a very thin sliding door that had a gap in it, and therefore would not close well.  Try to avoid room 314.  Also the walls between the rooms seem to be very thin, since we could hear conversations from the next room. Breakfast was good, and so was the free internet access, and staff were helful. The hotel is very good value for money and we would recommend it for those on a budget.  We did try 'il portale' restaurant a few metres away from the hotel after the many reviews on this site.  However, we were quite disappointed with the quality of the food and…

title: Shabby and stinky rooms
review: Trying to find a good hotel in Florence seemed at first to be a bit of a nightmare. Found this however and it was perfectly fine. The room was clean and tidy and a very short walk from the train station. We had  a triple room which consisted of two singles and a huge double, seperated with a partition wall. Both rooms had a tv, even though the only English speaking channel was Sky News! Breakfast was more than adequate and sets you up fine for a days sightseeing. Tea, Coffee, Juices, ceral etc. If I ever were back in Florence I would definately go back here.

title: Just about OK
review: I stayed in this hotel in November 2006. We booked two rooms. The first room that they gave us was extremely stinky. Apparently there was a problem with the bathroom's flush and they did not notice it... After 5 minutes they recognized the issue and gave us another room on a higher floor.   In the new room it was possible to breath, but they could not get rid of the smoke's smell this time. We were just too tired to complain again.  I would never stay in this hotel again.   Good points: friendly staff, located behind the station (good for us as we were travelling by train). Free internet in the lobby. Bad points: old, dirty, stinky rooms. They have too little personeel to clean the tables during breakfast, which makes the "dirty" impression of the hotel even worse.

title: Super modern hotel in excellent location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Exceptional Service...but a ???
review: Super hotel is excellent location. The lobby is grat, very mdoern. The staff all speak fluent English and are super helpful. The rooms are very clean and quitet and nicely furnished. We had suite which was huge by European standards. overall an excellent deal. One of the best things about them was ability to use high speed inetrnet. The breakfast was awesome.

title: Wonderful Hotel
review: We just returned from a two night stay at this quaint yet modern-styled hotel.  Upon arrival and throughout our stay the staff were friendly and helpful.  Our room was cozy (apartment) and clean.  I loved the wall-mounted TV we could watch while lounging in bed, and the patio we could access (though it was too cold to sit out).  The walls are very thin, as we heard our neighbors up to all kinds of things!  However, no issue with traffic noise.    I would definitely recommend this hotel to any friend or family travelling to Florence.

title: Great Location, Great Room
review: I booked three nights here at Hotel Delle Nazioni, Florence for three nights in first part of December, 2006. I drove a rental car picked at Pisa airport, and used TomTom to navigate to the hotel,right across from the lateral flank of the train station. There is no hotel parking, but there is a paid garage next door. One day costed 21 Euro, no in and out privilege. I ended up leaving the car there for three days. There is a Il Portale pizzeria next door too, and the Florentine Steaks and Seafood soup are wonderful. Yes, I booked the upgraded room, and it is huge by usual italian standard. The hotel is ultra clean throughout, and it is close to any Marriott  Courtside or Residence Inn standard. The breakfast is adequate, but convenient. Definitely a winner for the money.

title: Great hotel
review: Across the street from train station. Hotel did not have reservation when checked-in 11/13 booked (KING) through travelocity, but told no problem at check-in; it was a one night stay (Monday). Upgraded to large suite (?), w/kitchenette, and two other double size beds, flat panel 19" TV, nice bathroom, towel warmer, bidet, small shower, bathroom amenities. Great breakfast and free internet access. Nice hotel! Friendly service.

title: Good central location. Just across the road from the main station.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Fair value
review: It's in a great location just a two minute walk from the S. M. Novella Railway Station. Be carefull of the traffic when crossing the road. 10 minute walk to the Duomo.  Arrived at about 2.30p.m. and given a pleasant reception by the staff who allocated us to our room quickly. The room seemed quite small, rather scruffy and overlooked an internal yard. Given that I had booked a Superior room I asked for a confirmation of the room standard. I was offered an alternative room (411) which was better and a further option to view an apartment the following day which we ultimately agreed to. Throughout the staff were very pleasant.  Daily maid service was very good with sheets and towels refreshed daily.  Breakfast was very pleasant; typical Continental with breads, cheeses and meats. …

title: Only for the Internet
review: Stayed for 7 nights. The position of the hotel was great and very central. Our room was a good sized double with an additional single bed. Bathroom something of a disappointment. A bath was present with a shower over bath arrangement with a wall fixing at hip height and no shower screen or curtain. Breakfast as some other reviews state was breakfast. Very uninspiring for Italy with no fresh fruit and sugary "fruit" drink aka fruit juice.  The staff were polite and helpful and the Internet access useful if not 100% operative. Bedroom was quiet considering the position of the hotel. On one night when the temperature had cooled we tried to turn on some heat and failed.  Reception told us it was against Italian law for hotels to provide heating before Nov 1st!! No restaurant in…

title: Great Value at the Delle Nazioni, Florence
review: We booked this Hotel for 2 nights at the end of our Italian journey.  It was by far the worst hotel we stayed at in Italy.  I had read other travellers remarks on tripadvisor.com and knew that this hotel was a 3 star standard, however we did not enjoy our stay at all.  Being a family of four, we were in a self-service apartment type room on the first floor and the noise from the street was so loud that we did not sleep either night we were there.  Also, because we were on the 1st floor, we had to drag all our four suitcases up several flights of staircases as the lift does not service this floor. My daughter slept on a fold out bed that was uncomfortable and bearly above the floor. They were renovating the room next door and on the first morning, the hot water was only luke…

title: Lovely hotel and kind efficient staff.
review: Dear Sir,  We are very sorry your stay at the Delle Nazioni was not as expected.  We are quite surprised to hear complain for the Self Catering Apartments which have always received good response from the guests.  Thank you for your indication about the noise coming from the street, the apartments were made last winter and a double window glaze has already been installed in some of the them.  We are sure our reception staff would have changed your room to a room on the back if needed.  Anyway thanks for all your advice, our aim is to have our property to be better and better in the future and we will do our best to achieve this point.  Best regards.  Giancarlo Carniani Managing Director Hotel Delle Nazioni

title: Not to picky but....
review: -  Train Station right across the street (noisy) -  20 minutes walking to attractions -  Room for double bed (2 joint twin beds) is not small -  Safety box inside the room/closet -  Weird shower (no boundaries - just curtains), no place to hold soap and shampoo) -  Door is thin (can hear people outside loud and clear) -  Internet access behind the lobby -  Good breakfast - ample and variety, but no fruit

title: A gem (almost) at reasonable price
review: This was by far the worst hotel on our trip.  For one as advertised on their website, there is no parking.  We didn't have a car, but another customer booked a room with them solely for this reason.  Two, no air conditioning in the room.  Yes the lobby and bar is air conditioned, but our room was not.  We were there in the midst of a heat wave throughout the country, and woke up at 3:00 A.M. soaked in sweat and had to lay wet towels on us to cool off.  As well the windows didn't open to let in fresh air.  Everyone else seems to rave about this hotel, lucky for them, but I will definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone I know.  I was there for the evening of June 27, 2006 - maybe this was a bad night for them.    The internet was nice except unreliable.  Most of the sites I…

title: Great Location, Free Internet Access!
review: Dear Guest,  We are sorry if your stay at the Delle Nazioni did not meet your expectactions.  Every day we do our best to assure client's comfort and I am sorry to read your comments about a not positive experience.  I hope you did report problem with the air conditioning to the reservation staff, since hotel is fully air conditioned and nothig like described in your reviews should happen.  Regarding the Internet Point please be informed that it's free and it's fully functioned. We never experience any client complaining about it and we never received reviews about sites not working through it.  Anyway, you have my e-mail here and I will be more than glad to receive informations about sites which were not working and check it.  Best regards.  Giancarlo Carniani

title: It surprised us!!
review: The Della Nazione has a marvelous location.  It is right next to the Stazione as well as the bus depot.  When you arrive in Florence, the hotel is a five minute walk and easily identifiable by its sign.  When leaving(or traveling on to Venice,Pisa, etc., it couldn't be more convenient.  Also, the bus station which has local buses to Siena, etc. is half a block away.       Although station areas often have seedy characters around, the Della Nazione and walk routes had none.  Also, I was aware of no noise from buses or trains until I left the hotel.  All of Florence is within easy walking distance.  There is a marvelous restaurant two doors away from the hotel.  We ate there every night.  A mixture of locals and travelers from the Della Nazione all agreed it was delicious, varied,…

title: it was lovely
review: We have just returned from this hotel.  Literally only four days ago.  The location is excellent.    We arrived at Pisa airport and took an extremely cheap (return fare) bus to Florence Railway/Bus Station, walked for about 3 minutes and we were there!  The staff were helpful, the rooms were very clean, the bed was changed three times during our four night stay, the shower was good.  The breakfast was good.  No bad comment to make at all.  We were on the main road and there was no noise at all (we stayed for a Saturday evening).  There are excellent restaurants on the same side of the road as the hotel.  Excellent value for money we found.  It was very pleasing to be able to take a very short walk to the bus station and book a sightseeing bus.  Again, excellent service and value…

title: Loved our room and loved Florence!!!
review: this hotel is opposite the main train station, literally a 2 min walk.  from the outside it doesn't look all that but as soon as you enter its a complete different story.  its very modern and neat.  staff were very friendly, they knew exactly what they were doing and provided a very good and efficient service.  the rooms were spacious and bright, the bathroom was a little small though.  breakfast was good also.  the internal decor throughout was very nice. its a good base to explore florence, we walked everywhere as everthing was so close by and walkable, there was no need for taxis or buses.  having the station opposite was very useful for day trips - we went to Pisa and Siena which we would definitely reccommend to others. all in all, this hotel was lovely and i would…

title: i will never forget
review: Loved our room...we had a view!  Pretty quiet, considering that Florence is a busy place.  Breakfast was good,.  Hotel is SO convenient, and there is even a nice restaurant (really good mussels) a few doors down.  And a grocery store is practically across the street.  Never used public transit...Florence is so easy to get around in.  We loved this hotel and hope to one day return to it and our beautiful Florence again!

title: Great location
review: Me and my friend booked the hotel at last minute, I honestly did not expect the hotel to be this good. Starting from the crew, lobby, location (very closed to the Duomo and two blocks from train station) , breakfast, bar....was great!!!!!  our room had one queen and one twin bed and xt space for a large dinning table. The bathroom was large and clean, free internet service that was super convinient (we found it really coplicated to find cybercafes in europe) , plus xt computers in the lobby. I will totally come back to this hotel, and i'm refering it to all my friends!!!  They really made us feel comfortable! *you can see pics of the hotel and rooms from the web site, what you see is what you get.  good luck!!!

title: Fabulous Location! Great Room!  Great Value!
review: We booked this hotel through hotwire.com for $106 USF per night and when the transaction was completed and hotel name was revealed I checked here to see what we were getting.   I might have paid more attention to the Aug 13 '05 review with the tip to exit right from the station. We exited left and lugged 5 pieces of luggage around the square for about 20 minutes before locating the hotel.  Our guidebook said that Florence was a big draw for pickpockets and rail way stations everywhere seem to be the centre of it. Still, we didn't feel really uncomfortable in the area.  I can't add much to what's already been said. The staff is friendly, English-speaking, and quite helpful. One desk clerk cheerfully made a reservation for us to the Accademia, right in the middle of the morning…

title: Great Location-Lovely Staff
review: The location of this hotel is superb.  You are right in the city center.  You can walk to all major sights, museums, churches, and other attractions within minutes.  You don't need to drive or take a bus once!!!  The breakfast is FREE and is very delicious.  They offer all kinds of drinks, a variety of pastries, eggs, yogurt, ham & cheese crossaints, as well as other delicious items.  A great way to start off the day!!!  They do have an internet lounge with Macs and PC's and the internet is FREE.  They even have a wireless connection in the lounge if you want to use your own computer.  The room was huge and clean.  The only downside to the room was that the shower was super small.  However, I had no problems with water temperature or pressure.  The value of this hotel is…

title: great value hotel
review: I stayed at this hotel 2 nights while visitng europe and had a great exprienece. It is located one block away from the artesia and eurostar trains, and in walking distance from the Duomo and Uffizi gallery. We did not have to use tranportation at all since everything was in walking distance. The rooms were pretty spacious for europe, and very clean. The staff there was awesome!! The catered to our every need and we did not need a phone card because they allowed us to place calls from the receptionist area. The internet is also located in the lobby of the hotel and is free for everyone. Since I am a student that was extremely convenient. The contiental breakfast was pretty good and offered a variety of foods. Don't be discouraged by the exterior, its a good hotel and I would stay…

title: Very Convenient- Nice Hotel
review: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in Feb.   The location is a great plus for transpotation around the tuscany area and trains to other parts of italy. The 2 min. walk to the train station with connected small supermarket was very convienent for short trips to surrounding Pisa & Lucca. Accross the street from here is also access to the SITA bus terminal for excursions to Sienna & San Gimignano (a must!!)   There are very good restaurants in close proximity to the hotel and just a pleasant short walk to the center of town & museums.  The rooms were large for italian standard and adequately furnished. Bathrooms were a bit crowded and the shower temp. was unregulated.  The air temp in the room was cold trough-out our rainy stay.  The breakfast was very good with a nice selection of…

title: Pretty good hotel except the bathrooms.....
review: Fantastic hotel - Got dropped off by the Terrorvision bus @ the station, crossed the road and checked in.  Could not have been any easy! Hotel was lovely and clean.  Room and bathroom were big enough for the 2 of us. We were in an appartment which has a kitchen, dining room area, balcony and a computer - great with the free internet for planning our next day's itinary!  Breakfast was good, a selection of cereals, bread rolls and cakes as well as fruit juices, coffees and teas. Did not use public transport once!  Santa Maria de la Novella was at the end of the road the hotel was on, and the Duomo, Ponte Vechio etc. not too far to walk.  Recommendations to eat - Bella Donna on Via de Bella Donna, also Via Nazional has some good restaurants. We will be back

title: Better than expected
review: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights after spending 6 days in Rome.  As the previous review indicated, the hotel turned out to be better than what I expected. There are a couple minor problems but nonetheless it was a pretty okay experience.  The hotel is located right next to the S. Maria Novelle Stazione on the left side.  While it is not the best location in Florence, it does only takes about 10-15 minutes to walk to the town center and all major attractions (Duomo, Uffizi, Ponte Vecchio and Galleria of Academia, etc).  Considering there are only a limited amount of hotels available in Florence (unlike Rome) and a semi-decent hotel can easily break your pocketbook, I simply couldn’t complain about the reasonably priced pre-paid rate (less than €70 per night).  As some of the…

title: Good experience!
review: Having had this hotel recommended by a friend, I was slightly put off when I read some negative reviews of it on this site. The Delle Nazioni turned out to be better than I expected. The hotel was fully refurbished inside with friendly English speaking staff. The room was basic, but modern and clean. The bathroom was again clean, however quite basic, with no shower holder. Breakfast was simple but perfectly edible. The only drawback was the area being close to the train station and busy road. At night there were many youths hanging around this area, however we did not encounter any problems and felt safe.

title: Good for Price
review: My daughter and I stayed at the Delle Nazioni for five days booked through "-----".  We were more than happy with our stay.  The hotel is very conveniently located as you can walk to just about anywhere in Florence.  Upon arrival by train we were able to locate the hotel by following directions from a prior posting.  We were in room 426 and it was better than we expected.  We had a balcony that had a nice view of the hills above Florence and it was nice to be able to leave the door open during the night.  Be sure and keep the curtains closed cause we did get a couple of mosquitoes in the room.  The bathroom was very clean with the shower curtain around the floor drain which we found worked just fine for us.  All the linen was changed daily and the room was very clean.  The…

title: Safer than expected
review: I was immediatly turned off by the stained, dirty looking carpet. It was very warm even though it was in Nov. We opened the windows but the mosquitos swarmed in. The shower was a hole in the floor in the corner of the bathroom with a shower curtain. The beds were clean, at least I think they were. When the carpet is so dirty it makes you wonder. There were clean towels (they were like tablecloths but did the job) each day & the breakfast was good but please fix that carpet!

title: Pleasant Stay
review: Having read some reviews of this hotel we, as pensioners, were rather apprehensive about tales of "dodgy characters" and "threatening transients" in the vicinity of the hotel. However we have just returned from 6 days at the Della Natione and at no time did we feel unsafe or threatened, we also found the Duomo to be a 7 minute walk away not 15 and we are in our 60's. The hotel was comfortable, we had a quiet room which was cleaned regularly together with the bathroom and although the breakfast was continental it was more than adequate with supplies of foods being constantly replenished. The staff were friendly and helpful and pre-booked tickets for us when required.

title: Disappointing
review: For it's its price and classification, this hotel is above average.  Nice and big rooms.  Near Stazione, SMN which is a big plus.  Near shopping center, the Duomo.  Breakfast is good with lots of selection.  Internet access is free. Will definitely recommend this hotel to budget traveler.  Staff are friendly and speaks English.

title: Very very very poor.
review: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in July 2005.  We chose it because we were travelling in and out of Florence by train, and for that reason it was a good choice. Tip:  if you arrive by train, make sure you leave the station by the exit on the right as you come off the platform.  We took the left hand exit and had a long walk around the outside of the station trying to find the hotel.  If you leave by the right hand exit you only need to cross the street and turn right and the hotel is on your left. We were happy with the 20 minute walk from the hotel into the town centre.  It was good to have time to walk off all that pasta! The hotel itself was a bit disappointing.  The reception staff were friendly and helpful enough, and the free internet access was a bonus.  The…

title: mixed feelings
review: Well, I guess everyone has a different angle.  I am not even sure from the past reviews this is the same hotel we stayed at for 3 nights!  As far as I am concerned, the best thing that this hotel has going for it is price and the free Internet access. We booked via an online travel agency and had a very good deal.  I didn't find the location to be that desirable. Yes, it is across from the train station, which means getting to the hotel is a snap if you can manage to avoid being hit by motorcyclists and buses. However, this area is fill with cheap shops, and less than desirable crowd.  The main attractions are at least a 20 minute walk and while it doesn't seem like a lot, after a whole day sightseeing and walking on narrow, rough cobblestones streets and dodging traffic it's a…

title: Very Nice Hotel, Helpful Staff
review: 1. The hotel location is right next to the train station and about 10 - 15 minutes walk from the more interesting areas of Florence. The train station area is very busy, very noisy, dirty and there are also quite a few of "sketchy" people...   2. The hotel lobby and entrance etc... looks pretty good, you also get free internet and receptionists seem sympathetic. Newly renovated I beleive.  3. Rooms: Except for the washrooms, the rooms were clean and of good size. However, washroom had a bad odor, no shower separation on the floor (picture the washroom and shower sharing the same floor). The towels to dry yourselves can be used as a table cloth for your dining room...also towels smell of vinegar so do the sheets you sleep on.  4. Overall impressions: I beleive this hotel would be…

title: Not great
review: This hotel was very easy to find, just over the road from the main train station of Florence.  Once arrive checking in was quick and the lady at reception spoke excellent English.   We had a room on the top floor and had our own balcony, which gave great views of the skyline of Florence, and the view was even better at night when all the buildings were lit up.  The hotel was clean and well presented, and the people on reception were always glad to help, when we arrived they gave us a map of Florence that turned into our bible. This map had all the major locations and roads and it was small enough not to make you look too much like a tourist. The breakfast was ok, not much choice but it gave you something to eat before the start of your own day in Florence.  One of the downsides…

title: Bad hotel, good location
review: This hotel has a great location right across from the train station and within easy walking distance to the main sights.  Our bedroom was huge but our bathroom was quite small.   In order to open or close the bathroom door, you had to lift up the toilet seat!!  The decor was sparse.  Our room did not have air conditioning (I think some rooms did, but ours didn't...)  The bathroom was clean with new fixtures but the shower was very primitive -- it was just a curtain around a corner of the bathroom, with no place to put soap/shampoo.  Of course there was water all over the floor afterwards...  The towels were terrible (and weird).  They were really more like bed sheets than towels -- very thin and neither soft nor absorbent! I felt like I was drying myself with a pillow case.  We…

title: I hope you don't like Air Conditioning
review: 2 adults/2 teenagers stayed for two nights. We had no sleep during our stay! Large studio suite was on second floor on busy street side. Bus stop right under window. Very loud throughout the night and could hear all activity on the street. Cars, scooters, drunks. This took away from the entire experience as we were very tired after spending 15 hours per day touring Florence. Directly across from train terminal. Internet hotel with computer in room for no cost. 6 terminals in lobby for use too. Bar in hotel but not busy. A nice join up place. Cont. breakfast in am was great.  Kitchenette in room allowed us to eat in when wanted. Shopped at local market across street. AC in room worked well. Bathroom large and clean with fresh towels daily. This was a very nice hotel but location,…

title: Good value
review: Dear Tripadvispr User,  I thank you for your comments. The problem you are pointing out is going to be solved soon. The new Apartments where you stayed are very well equipped (Lcd Tv, Internet in the room) and I am glad you did some pictures showing the size, colours and facilities. We have already ordered double size window for those apartements in order to avoid the noise coming from the main street. We did renevate those rooms in february and we did have not time to install the windows.  I am oly sad because you gave us the worst raiting for this reason but if I do understand well you were happy for the rest of the hotel.  Also we do have 2 apartments located in the back of the house, did you ask our reception staff to change your room ?  Thanks

title: Above average yet reasonably priced Hotel Delle Nazione
review: The hotel itself is pleasant, reasonably priced and close to sights and attractions.  We checked in and the staff was polite and efficient.  The room was clean and well appointed.  The trouble began when we found that the AC in our room was non fuctional.  We complained at the desk and they assured that it would be repaired.  We complained again after four hours and were ignored and not offered any concession for our trouble.  Incidently, when I complained the second time, another couple on our floor was complaining as well to no avail.  The hotel staff did nothing for two days even as the room was unbearably hot... I'm sure it was because my room was prepaid.

title: Early Checkin Warning
review: We stayed at Delle Nazioni for two nights in April. The hotel is right across the train station S.M.N. which is great. The rooms are big,comfortable and clean. The hotel is either new or lately renovated cause it looks very nice inside and the decoration is very pleasant,modern but warm. There is free internet access in the lounge(didnt use it, we saw the pcs). The breakfast also is very good, not rich, but good enough. The only bad thing i can think of is the thin towels which were like tablecloth, but thats minor.

title: Better than expected!
review: We arrived early (12:30 pm) and checkin time is not until 2:00 pm.  We asked if we could leave our luggage here while we went sight seeing.  We were told we could leave our luggage in the room over by the front door - there is no lock on the door and anyone has access to this room.  There is no ticketing system for your luggage - so someone could easily walk off with your luggage.  The sign in the room says they are "Not Responsible".  Just a friendly warning.

title: think about it
review: We stayed at the Hotel Delle Nazioni for 4 nights in March 2005. We had a triple room on the 4th floor, at the back of the hotel. The room was clean with plenty of space for the three of us, and we had a balcony with a lovely view of rooftops of Florence.  The staff were friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was good. There were groups of young people staying there, who were occasionally noisy, but this wasnt really a problem. Overall, the hotel gave us great value for money, and I would stay there again.

title: Nice Clean Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: OK on a budget
review: We stayed at the hotel the last week in October.  We were in one of the renovated rooms which were very clean.  Showers didnt bother us a bit, most of the water went right down the drain and used one towel as a bathmat.  Food was good at the breakfast buffet. Hotel is just a short walk from the Duomo. The hair dryers ARE VERY slow and the handle gets hot after a while but, other than that, no complaints with the hotel.  Would recommend to others and if/when I am lucky enough to get back to Florence, I would stay there again!
